activity_instructions: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: Media has dramatically transformed my life over the years: from the way I consume information to the pace at which I receive it. Initially, my primary sources of news were newspapers and television broadcasts, which provided scheduled updates and limited viewpoints. However, the advent of the internet, along with the proliferation of smartphones, has revolutionized my interaction with media. Now, I have constant, on-demand access to a vast array of resources, from online articles and videos to podcasts and social media platforms. This shift has made staying informed both more comprehensive and overwhelming; it's easy to fall into information overload. Social media, in particular, has blurred the lines between personal and public spaces, facilitating instant communication but also raising concerns about privacy and misinformation. Furthermore, the personalized algorithms on platforms like YouTube and Twitter curate content tailored to my interests, which can be both a boon and a curse; while it ensures relevancy, it can also create echo chambers that reinforce my existing beliefs. Thus, while media has undoubtedly enhanced my ability to connect with the world, it also demands a higher level of discernment to navigate it responsibly.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph about a job your friend has or had in the past. Include the following: the name of the company, when your friend worked there (if you are describing a past job), the job title and responsibilities, and who your friend reported to. If you don’t know, you can invent this information. Type in the input box. Write 40-70 words.
student_submission:
The Beauty of Nature

Nature is one of the most beautiful and awe-inspiring things in the world. From the tallest mountains to the deepest oceans, the natural world is full of wonders. The lush green forests, colorful flowers, and vibrant wildlife all create a perfect balance that is essential for life on Earth.

Every season brings a new transformation to nature. In spring, flowers bloom, and animals awaken from their slumber. Summer brings warmth, sunshine, and abundant life. Fall is a time when the leaves change color, creating stunning landscapes. Winter covers the world in a blanket of snow, offering a peaceful, quiet beauty.

Nature also plays a crucial role in maintaining the balance of our planet. Trees and plants produce oxygen, clean the air, and provide shelter for countless creatures. Rivers and oceans regulate the Earth's climate, while animals help maintain the food chain.

Sadly, human activities such as deforestation, pollution, and climate change are threatening the delicate balance of nature. It is crucial that we take action to protect the environment and preserve the natural beauty that we all cherish.

activity_instructions: Now write a report comparing the two car designs. Which design do you think you should go with? Persuade your design team to choose one of the designs for next year’s rollout. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission: The XZ3 and the E-XZ3 are the new cars designed for next year: both are sporty cars with superior aerodynamics and advanced traction. The XZ3 model has a 6.4-liter all-aluminum V8 engine, gasoline-powered. It goes from zero to 60 mph in 2.7 seconds and has a top speed of 207.1 mph. The E-XZ3 model has a 5.4-liter all-aluminum engine, hydrogen-powered. It goes from zero to 60 mph in 5.7 seconds and has a top speed of 159.1 mph. Common sense dictates that customers need high speed and acceleration in this type of car, but I have no doubt that every day more people are looking for alternative fuel also in this market segment. For this reason, I believe that it will be better if we choose the E-XZ3 model

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Hi Alice,

I know that cultural diversity can be difficult to handle because I´m from Venezuela, but I´ve been living in Portugal for almost 8 years. I´ve had to deal with that since I moved here. It has been challenging, but I have gotten to do it. 

In my country, people have a tendency to gesture a lot with their face, and we tend to be direct. Also, we´re not comfortable with silence, but in Portugal is the opposite. Portuguese people are comfortable staying in silence. They tend to be quite indirect and try to avoid conflict. 

Every country has a way of doing the things, that´s why I think that the most important thing is trying to adapt your behavior to the culture as soon as possible. That way you will be able to be polite and avoid misunderstandings.

activity_instructions: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Good morning, everyone, and welcome to Frisko Shipping! We are delighted to have you on board. You’re joining a dynamic company with a presence in 20 cities around the world and more than 5,000 dedicated employees working together to shape the future of maritime transport.

Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko, but the story behind its creation is truly inspiring. Bill once fell into the ocean, was bitten by a shark, and was saved by a passing ship. That moment changed his life—it sparked the idea that led to this company’s creation. His story is proof that inspiration can strike anywhere, even in the most unexpected circumstances.

Today, we hold 10% of the global shipping market and earned a profit of 5 million dollars last year. But our success isn’t just about numbers; it’s built on passionate, motivated individuals like you.

To get started, we’ll have a short quiz to see what you already know about Frisko Shipping. And before we wrap up, I want to leave you with one thought: What inspires you? Find your motivation, embrace new opportunities, and make the most of your journey here.

Welcome aboard!

activity_instructions: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Speech Draft:

Good morning, everyone.

Today, I want to reflect on our journey over the past few months. Like any challenging expedition, we’ve faced both rough terrain and rewarding milestones.

Our biggest achievement has been renewing our partnership with Crum. This was no small feat, and as an added bonus, Crum praised our unwavering commitment to quality. This recognition is a testament to the dedication and teamwork shown by every member of our crew.

However, the road hasn’t always been smooth. Three months ago, we encountered a major obstacle: a series of unresolved defects that threatened our progress. Alongside this, we dealt with a few minor technical bumps that slowed us down.

But as a strong and resilient team, we adapted. We changed how we deliver updates, making the process faster and more reliable. Additionally, we enhanced our Quality Assurance processes to prevent similar issues in the future.

Looking ahead, our focus will be on providing even more support to ensure a smoother path and avoid future disruptions for our customers.

Thank you.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: In India, robots are increasingly being integrated into various sectors, enhancing efficiency and productivity. In manufacturing, robots are used for tasks like assembly, welding, and painting, significantly speeding up production processes. In healthcare, robotic surgery and automated diagnostic tools are improving patient outcomes and reducing human error. Service robots are becoming common in hospitality, assisting with tasks such as room service and cleaning. I find the rise of robotics fascinating and promising, as they have the potential to revolutionize industries and improve quality of life. However, there are concerns about job displacement and the ethical implications of relying heavily on machines. Positively, robots can handle dangerous and repetitive tasks, leading to safer work environments and allowing humans to focus on more creative and complex activities. On the downside, the rapid adoption of robots could lead to significant job losses, particularly in low-skilled sectors, and exacerbate social inequalities. Balancing technological advancement with social responsibility will be crucial for maximizing the benefits of robotics in society.

Maria

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is no longer just a buzzword; it is a crucial aspect of modern business that benefits both society and companies themselves. In my opinion, businesses have a responsibility that extends beyond making profits—they must also contribute positively to their communities and the environment.

Firstly, CSR helps build trust and loyalty among consumers. Today’s customers are increasingly aware of social and environmental issues and prefer to support companies that demonstrate ethical practices. When businesses invest in sustainable initiatives or community projects, they create a positive brand image, which can translate into long-term success.

Secondly, CSR can drive innovation and employee satisfaction. Companies committed to social responsibility often foster a more inclusive and supportive work environment. This can motivate employees, improve productivity, and attract top talent who want to work for organizations with values aligned to their own.

Critics sometimes argue that CSR distracts companies from their primary goal of profitability. However, evidence shows that responsible business practices can lead to better financial performance by reducing risks and opening new market opportunities.

In conclusion, CSR is essential for businesses today. It is a win-win strategy that encourages ethical behavior, benefits society, and ultimately contributes to a company’s sustainability. Businesses ignoring their social responsibilities risk losing relevance and trust in an increasingly conscientious world.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Recommendation for Training Provider: Skills Pro

After evaluating two training companies, TrainQuick and Skills Pro, I recommend selecting Skills Pro for our employee training needs.

While TrainQuick offers a more affordable and flexible option, its use in other branches has been limited, and employees have expressed concerns about mixed class settings. This suggests that the platform may not meet all of our team’s engagement or learning preferences.

On the other hand, Skills Pro, though more expensive, delivers high-quality course content that consistently results in successful completions. Employees who have completed the training report that, while the courses are challenging, they provide deep value and tangible skills. The company is also planning to expand its course offerings, which could further benefit our team in the future.

Although the higher cost of Skills Pro is a consideration, the long-term benefits of providing comprehensive, high-quality training outweigh the initial expense. By investing in a proven provider, we can ensure that our employees gain the necessary skills and complete their training successfully, contributing to their growth and productivity within the company.

Conclusion: I recommend we move forward with Skills Pro to meet our training needs effectively.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility
 
I believe that companies do have a responsibility towards society, not just their shareholders. Businesses don’t grow in isolation—they depend on people, communities, and the environment. So it makes sense that they should give something back.
 
When companies treat their employees well and take care of the environment, they create a better reputation for themselves. People are more likely to trust and support businesses that are socially responsible. In fact, many consumers today prefer to buy from brands that care about social and environmental issues.
 
Also, CSR isn’t just about doing the right thing—it can actually help a company succeed. A good CSR strategy can lead to happier employees, loyal customers, and stronger relationships with the community. All of this contributes to long-term success.
 
Of course, companies still need to make profits. But that doesn’t mean they should ignore their impact on society. In fact, balancing profit with social responsibility can lead to more sustainable growth.
 
To sum up, CSR should be a part of every company’s values. It’s not just about charity—it’s about being responsible, fair, and forward-thinking in the way they do business.

Thanks!

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. What was the preliminary offer? What happened during the negotiations? What was the final deal? Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission:
Just wanted to take a moment and review the results of our negotiations. This is what I have: The vendor has confirmed that they can deliver 250 laptops at $850 per unit. That's down from the full price of $925. Delivery would be over the next three months. The total  purchase price is $212,500. Negotiating computer purchases requires strategic planning. Consider factors like hardware specifications, warranty, support, and total cost of ownership. Build relationships with suppliers, clarify terms, and ensure mutually beneficial agreements. 
John: Good morning, Michael. We're interested in purchasing 20 computers for our office. Can you provide a quote?

Michael: Good morning, John. Absolutely! What specifications are you looking for? Processor, RAM, storage?

John: We need Intel Core i5, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD, e Windows 11.

Michael: Okay. Our price for that configuration is $850 per unit.

John: That's a bit high. We're looking for something around $750.

Michael: I can offer $800, considering the bulk order.

John: How about $780, including warranty and support?

Michael: (pausa) Alright, $780. We'll throw in free installation and a 3-year warranty.

John: Sounds good. What's the delivery timeframe?

Michael: Within 7-10 business days.

John: Acceptable. We'll need a formal quote and contract.

Michael: I'll send it over today. Shall we finalize the agreement?

John: Yes, please.

activity_instructions: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
Performance Review for Oliver Murray

Oliver has made a remarkable impact in his first year with us, demonstrating exceptional talent and dedication. He started strong, bringing innovative ideas to the table and consistently delivering high-quality work with minimal errors. His initiative in identifying and resolving a product error not only saved the company significant costs but also showcased his problem-solving abilities. Oliver has been recognized as Employee of the Month twice and earned a well-deserved promotion within just six months.

However, there are areas for improvement. Oliver has missed two deadlines without communicating with the team, which highlights the need for better collaboration and consideration for team dynamics. Moving forward, I encourage Oliver to focus on improving his time management skills and to actively engage with his colleagues to enhance teamwork. By addressing these goals, I am confident he will continue to thrive and contribute to our team's success.

At White Space Associates, we firmly reject the baseless rumors circulating about a decline in our share prices. These claims are complete nonsense. Recently, we secured a prestigious contract for Mishima Corporation’s new HQ, beating 20 other top agencies. Mr. Mishima personally approved our design, further solidifying our position in the industry.

Over the past three years, our company has experienced significant growth, with profits rising steadily. We also have three major contracts lined up in the coming years, reinforcing our strong financial outlook.

Our legal team is actively pursuing compensation from those responsible for spreading these malicious rumors. We want to assure our clients that we are committed to protecting their interests as well as our own.

White Space Associates remains a leader in the architecture industry, and we are poised for continued success.

Samantha Paget 
CEO, White Space Associates

activity_instructions: Listen to the audio. Write down what the speaker says below. Once you've written down as much as you can, click 'done' and compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
Setting up a new 5G network is no easy task, so I’ll try to break this down for you into small, easy-to-understand steps. In order to get government approval to roll out a new 5G network, we’ll have to demonstrate that we understand the existing mobile network and explain how we plan on integrating our own service.

To start with, our new service has to be able to communicate with and integrate into the current mobile network technology. This consists of a network of base stations, the core circuit switched network, which handles voice calls and text, a packet switched network, which handles mobile data, and the public switched telephone network to connect subscribers to the wider telephony network. Of course, we will also have to show that our service follows 5G standards, such as WCDMA.

Once this has been demonstrated to the proper governmental authorities, we need to prove that we will respect customers’ privacy with our new service. After that, we’ll have to show that we are following all the anti-monopoly regulation. This is to ensure that no one company takes control of the entire market.

Only when all of this has been completed, can we begin to approach mobile phone manufacturers, who will be able to supply the phones that will run our new service.

Finally, after having passed all of these benchmarks, we will be in a very good position to gain government approval.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: A Third Option — How About a Weekend in Asheville?

Hi Ken and Josh,

Thanks for your suggestions! Both Boston and Denver sound like great places to visit, but I wanted to throw in a third option: Asheville, North Carolina.

Asheville is a vibrant city nestled in the Blue Ridge Mountains. It offers the perfect blend of outdoor adventure, arts, and great food. We could spend the mornings hiking along scenic trails in the Pisgah National Forest and the afternoons exploring the River Arts District or relaxing at a local brewery (there are more than 30!). The weather this time of year is mild and perfect for being outside.

There’s also the Biltmore Estate, the largest private home in America, which we could tour. It’s got amazing gardens and historic charm. And if we’re in the mood for live music or a cool vibe, downtown Asheville won’t disappoint.

It’s a bit more relaxed than the big cities, but still packed with things to do. Let me know what you think!

Best,
Mariah

activity_instructions: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
When considering iconic American cities, New York City and Los Angeles often come to mind. Both cities are renowned for their cultural influence, economic power, and diverse populations. However, beneath these similarities lie distinct differences that define their unique characters.
One of the most apparent differences between New York City and Los Angeles lies in their geographical settings and climates. New York City, located in the northeastern United States, experiences a full range of seasons, including cold, snowy winters and hot, humid summers. The city's dense urban landscape is a mix of towering skyscrapers and historic buildings, all within proximity to the Atlantic Ocean. In contrast, Los Angeles is situated in Southern California and boasts a Mediterranean climate characterized by mild, wet winters and hot, dry summers. The sprawling city, surrounded by mountains and the Pacific Ocean, is known for its extensive freeway system and expansive suburban areas. These geographical and climatic differences influence everything from architecture to lifestyle.
Both cities are cultural and economic powerhouses, but they exert their influence in different ways. New York City's culture is a melting pot of global influences, evident in its diverse neighborhoods, world-class museums, and thriving arts scene. It is a hub for finance, media, and fashion, with Wall Street symbolizing its economic might. Los Angeles, on the other hand, is synonymous with the entertainment industry. Hollywood, the heart of the global film and television industry, defines much of the city's identity. While New York is fast-paced and competitive, known for its high-pressure business environment, Los Angeles is often perceived as more laid-back, with a focus on creativity and innovation.
In conclusion, while New York City and Los Angeles share significant similarities as influential American metropolises, their differences are pronounced. From climate and geographical setting to cultural focus and lifestyle, each city offers a distinct experience to its residents and visitors. New York City embodies a fast-paced, cosmopolitan ethos, while Los Angeles exudes a relaxed, sun-soaked vibe with a creative edge. Understanding these differences enriches the appreciation of what each city has to offer, highlighting the diverse tapestry that makes up the United States.

activity_instructions: Read the email from your manager. Then write an interesting, friendly advertisement for the policy change. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
From_
ToAll
Hi, there.

I have a problem I'd like your help with. I know what a creative writer you are. Could you take a look at the text below and rewrite it for me to make it more interesting? Here's the text:

Dear colleague,

This is to inform you of an upcoming change in company policy. Starting on the first Monday of next month, the company will be providing free breakfasts to all employees. We hope this will be a way to lessen the stress of trying to grab something to eat before getting to work, and also give us all a chance to socialize a bit before we start our day.

We're very pleased with our menu. We will be offering fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels and doughnuts every day. In addition, we will have one hot item each day. This could be anything from scrambled eggs and potatoes to pancakes with maple syrup. We will also be offering fresh-brewed coffees and teas, along with fresh-squeezed orange and grapefruit juices.

I'd like everyone to be as excited as I am, and I'm hoping that, with your help and creativity, this new policy will be a big success.

Thanks for your help.

Mary

activity_instructions: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Buying a home in India can be a complex but rewarding experience. While housing costs vary significantly across the country, it's generally a substantial investment. Securing a home loan involves navigating a maze of paperwork, including income proofs, credit history, and property details. Interest rates on home loans are competitive, but factors like credit score and loan amount influence the final rate.  
Home Buying Process:
1 Financial Planning: Determine your budget, down payment capacity, and pre-qualify for a loan to understand your borrowing power.  
2 Property Search: Research neighborhoods, property types (apartments, villas, etc.), and shortlist potential properties based on your preferences and budget.  
3 Property Inspection: Conduct thorough inspections to assess the property's condition, including structural integrity, plumbing, and electrical systems.
4 Loan Application: Gather necessary documents, apply for a home loan from banks or housing finance companies, and compare interest rates and terms.  
5 Legal Due Diligence: Verify property ownership, check for any encumbrances, and engage a lawyer to review all legal documents.  
6 Negotiation and Agreement: Negotiate the purchase price and terms with the seller and draft a legally binding sale agreement.  
7 Loan Disbursement and Registration: Once the loan is approved, proceed with the final payment, registration of the property, and transfer of ownership.
Smooth Home Buying Experience:
Consult a Real Estate Agent: A qualified agent can help you find suitable properties, negotiate prices, and navigate the market.  
Engage a Mortgage Broker: A broker can help you compare loan options from different lenders and secure the best deal.  
Maintain Good Credit: A good credit score can improve your loan eligibility and interest rates.  
Read All Documents Carefully: Understand all terms and conditions before signing any agreements.
Be Patient and Persistent: The home buying process can be time-consuming. Stay patient and persistent throughout the journey.
has context menu

activity_instructions: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Good morning, everyone.

I’m pleased to share that we’ve successfully renewed our partnership with Crum—a strong signal that our ship is back on course. Even better, Crum commended us for our unwavering commitment to quality. That recognition belongs to every crew member here.

Of course, our journey hasn’t been without rough waters. Around three months ago, we hit a patch of turbulence—some persistent defects went unresolved, and a few other technical hiccups emerged. These weren’t just minor waves; they were signs we needed to recalibrate.

And recalibrate we did. We’ve since changed the way we deliver updates, ensuring smoother rollouts. Just as importantly, we’ve strengthened our Quality Assurance framework—tightening our sails, so to speak—to better catch issues before they surface.

As we sail ahead, we’re not just focusing on speed, but on direction and stability. We’ll continue to reinforce our systems and offer stronger support to prevent future disruptions—keeping our clients’ trust as our guiding star.

Thank you.

activity_instructions: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Criticism of celebrities often revolves around their influence on societal norms and the perception of reality. Many argue that celebrities contribute to unrealistic standards of beauty and success, promoting an unattainable lifestyle that can lead to issues such as body image disorders and materialism among the public. This influence is amplified by social media, where celebrities often share curated glimpses of their lives, further blurring the line between reality and fantasy for their followers.
Moreover, the pedestal on which society places celebrities can lead to a lack of accountability for their actions. Some celebrities leverage their status to avoid consequences, setting a poor example for impressionable fans. Additionally, the sheer volume of attention given to celebrities can overshadow more pressing global issues, diverting public discourse away from substantive topics that require critical attention.
On a broader level, the celebrity culture perpetuates a cycle of superficiality, where individuals are celebrated more for their status and appearance rather than their contributions to society.

activity_instructions: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Buying a home and applying for a home loan in India can be a complex process, but with the right guidance, it becomes manageable. The first step is to identify the property you wish to purchase. Housing prices vary significantly depending on the location, with metropolitan areas like Mumbai and Delhi being more expensive compared to smaller cities and towns.

Once you have chosen a property, the next step is to apply for a home loan. This involves a considerable amount of paperwork. You will need to provide proof of identity, address, income, and employment, along with property documents. Banks and financial institutions also require a good credit score to approve a loan.

Interest rates on home loans in India typically range between 7% and 9%, but this can vary based on the lender and your credit profile. It's essential to compare rates from different banks to get the best deal. Fixed and floating interest rate options are available, each with its pros and cons.

Using a real estate agent can be beneficial, especially for first-time buyers. Agents can help you find properties that meet your criteria and assist with negotiations. Similarly, a mortgage broker can help you navigate the loan application process, ensuring you get the best terms and rates.

Overall, while the process of buying a home and securing a loan in India involves several steps and considerable paperwork, with proper planning and professional assistance, it can be a rewarding experience leading to homeownership.

activity_instructions: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment.

NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade.

Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition.

In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One legendary creature that is popular in India is the Naga, a serpent deity reversed in Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-snake beings, possessing immense power and wisdom. They are believed to reside in underground realms and water bodies, such as rivers, lakes, and oceans.

Nagas play a significant role in various myths and legends. They are considered protectors of treasures and sacred places, and are often associated with fertility and prosperity. In Hindu mythology, the Naga king Vasuki is known for his role in the churning of the ocean where he served as the rope wrapped around Mount Mandara.

In addition to their protective nature, Nagas can also be vengeful if disrespected or harmed. This duality makes them fascinating and complex figures in Indian folklore. Temples dedicated to Nagas can be found throughout India, where devotes offer prayers and rituals to seek their blessings and protection.

The climate is cooler, with that fresh air that makes tou want to lake a deep breath. the streets are peaceful, with old houses that tell a bit of the Italian immigration history. Visitors can taste delicious traditional food, hike along nature trails, and enjoy beautiful waterfalls and viewpoints. If you like nature and culture, you will definitely love visiting Santa Teresa!

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: The Monstre de Banyoles is a legendary creature that has captured the imagination of the inhabitants of the Catalonia region in Spain. It is said to inhabit Lake Banyoles, the largest natural lake in Catalonia. According to legend, the monster is a kind of giant serpent or dragon, with shiny scales and eyes that glow in the dark. Stories about the Monstre have circulated for centuries, and it is attributed with mysterious sightings and strange phenomena in the lake. It is said that the monster emerges from the depths on full moon nights, causing waves and commotion in the calm waters. Some accounts even suggest that the Monstre protects the lake and its surroundings, keeping at bay those who attempt to harm it. Over the years, the Monstre de Banyoles has become a symbol of local culture, inspiring festivals, works of art, and tales that celebrate its mystique. Although many consider it just a legend, its presence remains alive in the tradition and folklore of the region.

activity_instructions: You are a medical resident who writes a blog about the health industry. One of your readers has asked you a question. Read the question, then write a suitable answer. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating.

In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case.

During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

I hope this email finds you well. I want to share an update on our current priorities and ensure we remain aligned as we move forward. 
First and foremost, the US Client designs are our top priority. While progress has been slower than anticipated, it is still on track. This project is critical as a successful outcome could secure future collaborations with the client. Let's maintain our focus and continue the excellent work.

activity_instructions: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
NAFTA - the North America Free Trade Agreement - is a free trade agreement between the three biggest countries of the Northern part of America. To be more specific, the member states are the USA, Canada and Mexico and after years of long and difficult negotiations the agreement came into force in January 1994.

The agreement can be seen as a kind of expansion of the already existing bilateral agreement between the USA and Canada which facilitated trade and reduced customs duties among the members and eliminated them respectively. It has had a profound effect on the trade relations, especially in agriculture (e.g. dairy, fruits, grains), but also in the car or steel industries.

Unlike the European Union, NAFTA did not perform supranational government functions, nor did its provisions take precedence over national law.

Today, after more than 30 years of its conclusion, it can be noticed that there has been both, positive and negative, impacts on all three members, but overall each of them has been benefitting from it.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of the text in no more than 100 words. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission: Drug regulation in the U.S. is managed by the FDA, which ensures that medications are safe, effective, and properly labeled. Drugs are classified as either over-the-counter (proprietary) or prescription-only (ethical), based on their risk and required supervision. Historically, regulation began with the 1906 Pure Food and Drug Act and has expanded through later laws, including the 1938 Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act. Today, drug manufacturers must submit products for testing and approval. Ongoing FDA oversight includes actions like requiring warning labels, such as for acetaminophen, which can be harmful when misused.

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
A Day to Remember: The Mysterious Disappearance

It was a sunny Saturday morning when my friend, Arjun, and I decided to go on an adventure. We had heard rumors about an old, abandoned mansion on the outskirts of our town, and our curiosity got the better of us. Armed with nothing but our smartphones and a sense of excitement, we set off to explore the mysterious place.

As we approached the mansion, we couldn't help but feel a chill run down our spines. The once-grand structure was now a shadow of its former self, with ivy crawling up the walls and broken windows that seemed to whisper secrets of the past. We hesitated for a moment, but our adventurous spirits pushed us forward.

Inside, the mansion was even more eerie. Dust-covered furniture, cobwebs in every corner, and the faint smell of decay filled the air. We wandered through the rooms, marveling at the remnants of a bygone era. It was then that we stumbled upon a hidden door behind a large, ornate bookshelf.

With a mix of excitement and apprehension, we pushed the door open and found ourselves in a dimly lit corridor. The walls were lined with old portraits, their eyes seemingly following our every move. At the end of the corridor, we discovered a small, dusty room with a single, ancient-looking chest in the center.

Arjun, being the braver of the two, decided to open the chest. As he lifted the lid, a blinding light filled the room, and we were both momentarily stunned. When the light faded, we found ourselves in a completely different place. The mansion was gone, and we were standing in the middle of a lush, green forest.

Confused and disoriented, we tried to make sense of what had just happened. It was then that we noticed a small, glowing orb floating in front of us. The orb seemed to beckon us to follow it, and with no other options, we did. It led us through the forest to a clearing where a group of people dressed in medieval clothing were gathered.

They welcomed us warmly and explained that we had been transported to a different time and place. The mansion, they said, was a portal to their world, and the chest was a key to unlocking it. They told us stories of their land, filled with magic and wonder, and invited us to stay and explore.

Arjun and I spent the next few days in this enchanting world, experiencing things we had only read about in books. We rode on the backs of dragons, learned spells from wise old wizards, and even helped defend a village from a band of marauding trolls. It was an adventure beyond our wildest dreams.

Eventually, we knew we had to return to our own world. The villagers gave us a small, enchanted stone that would take us back to the mansion. With heavy hearts, we said our goodbyes and used the stone to transport ourselves back.

As we stood once again in the dusty room of the mansion, we couldn't help but wonder if it had all been a dream. But the enchanted stone in Arjun's hand was proof that our incredible adventure had been real. We left the mansion that day with memories that would last a lifetime and a promise to return someday.

activity_instructions: You need to address the concerns of your company's shareholders. Write an email to reassure them. Read your notes first. Type in the input box. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Subject: Reassurance and Stability at Future Foundations Construction Company

Dear Shareholders,

I understand the concerns raised regarding the stability of Future Foundations Construction Company, especially with recent rumors about share price fluctuations. Let me assure you that these rumors are completely unfounded.

While it’s true that our share value experienced a temporary drop two months ago following the resignation of our former CEO, Greg Johnson, we are pleased to announce that under the leadership of our new CEO, Harry Levi, a well-respected figure in the industry, the company’s share price has swiftly recovered and reached a historic high.

Despite the challenges of an unstable market, we have secured three major contracts for the next three years, ensuring guaranteed profits and stability.

We deeply appreciate your continued loyalty and confidence in us. The future of Future Foundations is bright, and we will soon share our five-year road map to provide further reassurance.

Best regards,
Harry Levi
CEO, Future Foundations Construction Company

activity_instructions: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Good morning everyone,

Thank you for being here today. I’m excited to share with you a presentation about our company — who we are, what we do, and where we’re heading.

Let me begin with a quick overview. Our company was founded with a clear mission: to deliver innovative solutions that make life easier for our clients. Over the years, we’ve grown from a small startup into a trusted name in the industry, with a presence in multiple markets and a dedicated team of professionals.

Now, let’s move on to what sets us apart. First, our people. Their commitment and creativity drive our success. Second, our values — integrity, collaboration, and continuous improvement — are at the heart of every decision we make. And third, our clients. We pride ourselves on building strong, lasting relationships.

To illustrate this, let me share a quick anecdote. Last year, during a challenging project deadline, our team went above and beyond, working late nights and weekends. The client not only met their launch date, but also praised our support as “game-changing.” It’s moments like these that define us.

In conclusion, I encourage you to take pride in the work we do and the values we uphold. Let’s keep moving forward — together — with the same passion and purpose that brought us this far.

Thank you.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
The Hang Seng Index (HSI), Hong Kong's key stock market index, has shown strong performance in the past six months, driven by significant investment inflows from Mainland China. This growth has particularly boosted the Properties and Utilities sub-indices, reflecting the impact of mainland investment on sectors tied closely to Hong Kong's infrastructure and development needs.

After experiencing a low of 20,956 six months ago, the HSI steadily climbed to reach a peak of 27,499. This upward trend underscores renewed investor confidence and a strengthened economic connection between Hong Kong and Mainland China. Experts are optimistic about the HSI's continued growth, anticipating further gains in the coming year. This positive outlook is supported by both ongoing foreign investments and a surge in local demand, which together are expected to drive the index higher.

With Hong Kong’s economic ties and internal market strength, the Hang Seng Index is positioned for robust growth, making it an attractive focus for global and regional investors alike.

Write about a memorable movie, or one you recently saw.

Give facts and opinions about it. Who starred in the movie? Who directed it? What was it about?

Follow the structure you have studied.
student_submission:
I recently watched The Irishman, a crime drama directed by Martin Scorsese. It was released in 2019 and stars Robert De Niro, Al Pacino, and Joe Pesci. The movie was mostly shot in the United States, especially in New York and Pennsylvania.

The story follows Frank Sheeran, a former hitman, as he looks back on his life, including his connections with the mafia and the disappearance of union leader Jimmy Hoffa.

What I liked most about the movie were the powerful performances, especially by Al Pacino and Joe Pesci. The direction by Scorsese and the attention to historical detail were also excellent. However, I found the film a bit too long, and some scenes moved slowly.

I definitely recommend The Irishman to fans of crime dramas, historical films, and anyone who enjoys strong character development. It's a thoughtful and well-crafted film.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: In my country, artificial intelligence (AI) is being used more and more in many areas like education, healthcare, business, and transportation. Many schools now use AI tools to help students learn better, and hospitals use AI to detect diseases faster. Businesses use it to improve customer service and manage data. Even self-driving cars are being tested on the roads. I feel both excited and concerned about this rapid growth. On the positive side, AI can make life easier, save time, and help solve complex problems quickly. It can also create new jobs in tech fields and improve the quality of services. However, there are also negative effects. Some people may lose their jobs as machines take over tasks that humans used to do. There are also privacy concerns, as AI often collects and uses a lot of personal data. If not used responsibly, it could lead to unfair treatment or decisions. Overall, while AI brings many benefits, society must be careful and thoughtful in how it is used. With the right rules and education, AI can be a powerful tool for good.

activity_instructions: As the managing director of Blue Sea Logistics, you have commissioned a proposal from LookAhead Software to build an automated program featuring SCM and ERP software. The proposal is a little vague, especially the ‘Opportunity’ section, and the completion date is one month later than you had requested. Make notes below on the extra points you want to include in your counter-proposal. Compare your text with the model.
student_submission:
Dear LookAhead Software team,

  Thanks for submitting your proposal. I'd like to delve deeper into the scope and opportunities presented in the document.

    Regarding the objective, we've been very adamant that the new software integrates with the latest version of our CRM and order entry systems, which is not clear in your response. Moreover, we'd like to learn more about which business processes will be automated after the changes. In terms of opportunities, you're falling short in quantifying the expected efficiencies and ROI from using the new software. As an example of the former, the percentage of manual checks, a key performance index that we measure every month, hasn't been quantified in your document.      

  Finally, your completion date is one month later than expected, which is unacceptable. I’d like to kindly ask you to propose a project plan that can cover the core functionalities by September 17th.

   Sincerely,

Jim Bell

Steven, 

Here there are some advice for incentive people in the workplace. 

1. Working as a team is a priority in any company, specially to keep up everyone in terms of essential task.

3. Training is essential because method, and procedures are changing through the time. 
4. Meeting to get feedback from the employees is a positive sign that they are listening.

On the other hand, companies do not follow the next behaviors. 
1. Being bossy is a disrespectful manner to act front of the group. 
2. Success is a word that deserves everyone not only the leader. 
3. Being open with the team is very important to recognize that he or she is part of the team.

activity_instructions: Read the email from your manager. Then write an interesting, friendly advertisement for the policy change. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
yhrryr ryry r yryr yry rygrygI have a problem I'd like your help with. I know what a creative writer you are. Could you take a look at the text below and rewrite it for me to make it more interesting? Here's the text:

Dear colleague,

This is to inform you of an upcoming change in company policy. Starting on the first Monday of next month, the company will be providing free breakfasts to all employees. We hope this will be a way to lessen the stress of trying to grab something to eat before getting to work, and also give us all a chance to socialize a bit before we start our day.

We're very pleased with our menu. We will be offering fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels and doughnuts every day. In addition, we will have one hot item each day. This could be anything from scrambled eggs and potatoes to pancakes with maple syrup. We will also be offering fresh-brewed coffees and teas, along with fresh-squeezed orange and grapefruit juices.

I'd like everyone to be as excited as I am, and I'm hoping that, with your help and creativity, this new policy will be a big success.

Thanks for your help.

Mary

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: In Saudi Arabia, robots are becoming increasingly integrated into various sectors. From hospitality to healthcare, they are transforming the way services are delivered. For instance, in the hospitality industry, robots are used to greet guests, manage check-ins, and even serve food. In healthcare, robots assist in surgeries, provide support in elderly care, and help with administrative tasks. I feel that the rise of robots in society brings both opportunities and challenges. Positively, robots can enhance efficiency, reduce human error, and perform tasks that are dangerous for humans. They can also contribute to economic growth by creating new job opportunities in tech and robotics. On the downside, the increasing use of robots could lead to job displacement for workers in traditional roles, and there are ethical concerns about privacy and the extent of automation in our lives. Balancing these aspects is crucial for ensuring that the benefits of robots are maximized while mitigating any negative impacts on society.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
The Hang Seng Index: Recent Trends and Growth**

The Hang Seng Index (HSI), a major stock market index in Hong Kong, has demonstrated remarkable growth in the past six months, driven largely by investment from Mainland China. Sub-indices such as Properties and Utilities have experienced significant increases, reflecting the influence of this financial influx. Six months ago, the HSI faced a low of 20,956; however, it surged to a high of 27,499, showcasing its resilience and appeal to investors.

Experts project further growth for the HSI in the coming year, fueled by two primary factors. First, sustained investment from other countries is expected to bolster the index's performance. Second, internal demand within Hong Kong itself will play a crucial role in maintaining upward momentum. These combined forces suggest a positive outlook for the Hang Seng Index, reinforcing its significance as a key indicator of Hong Kong's economic health and investment climate.

activity_instructions: Read the blog post. Then write about a city you visited. Type in the input box. Write 90-110 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Impressive City

by Dirk Fischer / September 1994
Bangkok is like a beehive. It buzzes continuously whether it is day or night. Unfortunately, there is a lot of poverty visible in the city. To escape the noise, it is best to travel to the outskirts. Here, there are many traditional temples to see. Cultural performances can also be attended. Another highlight are the snake farms where the antidote is produced. If you travel to the country, be careful of pickpockets and don't be too shocked by the poverty you will see there.

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: Developing leadership qualities is a journey that involves self-awareness, continuous learning, and practical experience. From my observations, effective leaders often exhibit qualities such as empathy, resilience, and the ability to inspire and motivate others. Empathy allows leaders to understand and connect with their team members, fostering a supportive and collaborative environment. Resilience helps leaders navigate challenges and setbacks with a positive attitude, maintaining focus on long-term goals. In my experience, one of the most important qualities of a leader is the ability to communicate effectively. Clear and transparent communication builds trust and ensures that everyone is aligned with the team's objectives. Additionally, a good leader is adaptable and open to feedback, constantly seeking ways to improve and grow. I believe that everyone has the potential to be a leader, but it requires dedication and a willingness to step out of one's comfort zone. Leadership is not about holding a specific title or position; it's about influencing and guiding others towards a common goal. By cultivating these qualities and embracing opportunities for growth, anyone can develop their leadership potential.

activity_instructions: Read your meeting notes. Then write an email to the managers in your company. Give the details about the conference. Use your own words where possible. Type in the input box. Write 40-60 words. Use your own words where possible.

If you have any questions, just let me know.

Alan

activity_instructions: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
Performance review for Oliver Murray

General performance:
Oliver joined the company one year ago and has already from the start showed great potential and has delivered strong results. He is showing creativity with interesting new ideas, he is a very conscientious worker with very few mistakes. He is remarkably sharp and ambitious.

Key achievements:
During Olivers first year at the company he has found and fixed a product error, ensuring major cost savings. Due to this his manager decided to promote him after only six months in service. Oliver has also managed to be appointed "employee of the month" two times in one year.

Areas of improvement:
Although Oliver is a very good and highly appreciated staff member he has a few areas of improvement to reach his full potential. Due to his wish to deliver perfect results he sometimes struggles with deadlines, and he has missed two. He also needs to work on his communication skills and make sure he informes his team when there is a risk of falling behind and missing deadlines. Due to his ambitious nature he also tends to put himself first, and forget to think about his colleagues. 

Goals:
Starting immediately i would like Oliver to start making a scheduled plan for his projects which should be followed up weekly to make sure he will meet his deadline.
To make sure he develops a better team player attitude he also needs to send out weekly informational e-mails to his team.

activity_instructions: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
Performance Review – Oliver Murray
Oliver has made a strong impact in his first year with us, demonstrating impressive intelligence, dedication, and problem-solving skills. His ability to generate innovative ideas and execute his work with minimal errors has set him apart as a high-performing individual.
One of Oliver’s most notable contributions was identifying and correcting a product error, leading to significant cost savings for the company. His exceptional work earned him Employee of the Month twice and a well-deserved promotion within just six months—clear evidence of his commitment to success.
While Oliver excels in individual performance, there are areas for improvement. Missing two deadlines without communicating with his team affected workflow and collaboration. Strengthening his teamwork and ensuring transparency in deadline management will further enhance his effectiveness and reliability.
Goals for Development:
- Improve deadline management and proactive communication with the team.
- Increase collaboration and consider team dynamics in decision-making.

Overall, Oliver is a valuable asset to our organization. With continued growth in teamwork and deadline accountability, he has the potential to achieve even greater success.

activity_instructions: You are a medical resident who writes a blog about the health industry. One of your readers has asked you a question. Read the question, then write a suitable answer. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi there,

First off, it’s great to hear that you’re considering a career in medicine! Becoming a doctor is indeed a long and challenging journey, but it’s also incredibly rewarding. Medical training typically starts with a four-year medical school program after your undergraduate degree, followed by several years of residency and possibly fellowship. Clinical training is hands-on, involving a lot of direct patient care, which can be tough at times due to the emotional and physical demands. You’ll work long hours, deal with complex cases, and continually be learning. But it’s also where you build your skills and truly begin to understand the practice of medicine.

There are many options within the medical field. You could specialize in areas like surgery, pediatrics, cardiology, psychiatry, or family medicine, to name a few. Each specialty has its own unique path and lifestyle.

As for finances, medical residents and fellows are indeed paid, but it often feels like a tight budget due to the years of training and student loans. While the pay increases significantly as you become an attending physician, you may need to budget carefully in the earlier years.

Working in a clinic or hospital is fast-paced and can be stressful, but it’s also where you can make a real difference in patients’ lives. You'll work with a team, and though there are challenges, many find the sense of fulfillment to be worth it.

I hope this helps! Feel free to reach out if you have more questions. Best of luck on your journey!

activity_instructions: You're going to write an email about some future concerns for your company. Think about challenges your company faces, or general problems companies face. Second, supply chain disruptions continue to impact production timelines. We could mitigate this by diversifying suppliers and adopting predictive analytics to foresee potential risks. 
Please let me know your thoughts. I would be happy to discuss these further. 
Regards,
Lalith

activity_instructions: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
NAFTA: The North American Free Trade Agreement. 
The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a significant trade agreement that involves three member states: the United States, Canada, and Mexico. This agreement officially came into force in January 1994, following years of negotiation aimed at fostering economic cooperation and trade among the three nations.

One of the primary objectives of NAFTA was to reduce or eliminate customs duties on goods traded between the member countries. This has led to a notable increase in trade volume, particularly in the agricultural sector. For instance, the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the United States has surged, benefiting consumers with a wider variety of fresh produce.

While NAFTA has had a profound impact on trade relations, it has also generated both positive and negative effects for the member countries. On the positive side, it has facilitated economic growth and job creation in certain sectors. However, some industries have faced challenges, leading to job losses in specific areas.

Overall, despite the complexities and mixed outcomes, NAFTA has provided significant benefits to all three member states, enhancing their economic ties and fostering a more integrated North American market.

activity_instructions: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
An airplane consists of several essential parts, each playing a crucial role in its flight. 

The **fuselage** is the main body of the aircraft, designed to hold passengers and cargo. It houses the cockpit, where pilots control the plane, and provides structural support to the wings and tail.

The **wings** are vital for generating lift, allowing the airplane to rise into the air. They are shaped to create a difference in air pressure above and below, which lifts the plane. Wings may also have flaps and ailerons that help control movement during flight.

The **tail** section, or empennage, stabilizes the airplane and includes the horizontal stabilizer and vertical fin. The horizontal stabilizer helps maintain the aircraft's pitch, while the vertical fin, equipped with the rudder, controls yaw, allowing the plane to turn left or right.

Finally, the **engines** provide the thrust necessary to propel the airplane forward. They can be located on the wings or at the rear of the fuselage and work by sucking in air and compressing it, mixing it with fuel, and igniting it to produce powerful exhaust gases.

Together, these components enable safe and efficient air travel.

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Self-Awareness and Personal Development:
Know your strengths and weaknesses:
Understand your unique leadership style and identify areas for improvement. 
Seek feedback:
Actively solicit feedback from colleagues and superiors to gain a broader perspective on your leadership. 
Develop emotional intelligence:
Understand and manage your own emotions, as well as those of others, to foster positive relationships and build trust. 
Practice empathy:
Put yourself in the shoes of others to understand their perspectives and motivations. 
2. Communication and Interpersonal Skills:
Be a clear and concise communicator:
Effectively convey your vision, goals, and expectations to your team. 
Practice active listening:
Pay close attention to what others are saying and demonstrate genuine interest in their perspectives. 
Build strong relationships:
Cultivate trust and rapport with your team members through open communication and mutual respect. 
Resolve conflicts constructively:
Address disagreements and challenges in a positive and collaborative manner. 
3. Decision-Making and Problem-Solving:
Develop critical thinking skills: Analyze situations, evaluate information, and make sound decisions. 
Be decisive and proactive: Don't be afraid to take calculated risks and make timely decisions. 
Encourage collaboration and input: Involve your team in the decision-making process to foster ownership and buy-in. 
4. Motivation and Inspiration:
Inspire and motivate others: Create a positive and engaging work environment that encourages team members to reach their full potential. 
Set clear expectations and goals: Communicate your vision and provide a clear roadmap for achieving success. 
Recognize and reward accomplishments: Acknowledge and appreciate the contributions of your team members to boost morale and motivation. 
5. Continuous Learning and Adaptability:
Stay informed about industry trends and best practices: Continuously learn and grow as a leader to stay ahead of the curve. 
Be adaptable and flexible: Adjust your leadership style and approach based on the needs of your team and the ever-changing business environment. 
Embrace challenges and learn from mistakes: View setbacks as opportunities for growth and development. 
6. Building a High-Performing Team:
Empower your team: Give team members the autonomy and resources they need to succeed. 
Delegate effectively: Assign tasks and responsibilities appropriately based on the skills and experience of your team members. 
Foster a culture of collaboration and teamwork: Encourage open communication and shared responsibility. 
By focusing on these key areas, you can develop the leadership qualities necessary to lead effectively and inspire your team to achieve their full potential.

activity_instructions: Think of something weird, exciting or funny that happened to you recently, and describe it in an email to a friend. Make it interesting and descriptive, and remember to check for pronoun reference. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: You Won't Believe What Happened!

Hey [ram],

I hope you're doing well! I have to tell you about something absolutely bizarre that happened to me last weekend. So, I was at the local park, just enjoying a sunny afternoon, when I noticed a group of people gathered around a tree. Curious, I walked over to see what was going on.

To my surprise, they were all staring at a squirrel that had somehow managed to get a tiny pair of sunglasses stuck on its head! It was the funniest thing I've ever seen. The squirrel was running around, looking like a little celebrity, and everyone was trying to take pictures. I couldn't stop laughing!

But here's where it gets even weirder. As I was watching the squirrel, a guy dressed in a full pirate costume (yes, a pirate costume!) walked up and started giving a dramatic speech about how he was on a quest to find his lost treasure. He then pulled out a map and began leading a group of kids on a treasure hunt around the park. It felt like I had stepped into a completely different world!

Anyway, I thought you'd get a kick out of this story. Hope to catch up soon!

Cheers, [sita]

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate Social Responsibility: A Necessary Commitment to Society
Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is more than just an ethical practice—it’s a fundamental aspect of sustainable business success. Companies operate within communities that provide their workforce, customers, and infrastructure, and in return, they should contribute positively to these communities. This relationship fosters mutual growth, ensuring stability for both businesses and society.
Beyond ethical considerations, CSR benefits corporations in tangible ways. Studies show that businesses with strong social responsibility initiatives attract loyal customers and motivated employees. Ethical operations lead to positive public perception, which can enhance brand reputation and long-term profitability. Additionally, sustainable business practices contribute to environmental preservation, ensuring resources for future generations and minimizing operational risks related to climate change.
While critics argue that businesses exist solely to maximize profits for shareholders, CSR is not in opposition to this goal. In fact, responsible businesses often outperform their competitors because consumers and investors increasingly prioritize ethics when making decisions. Furthermore, government regulations alone cannot address all social and environmental challenges—corporate initiatives play a crucial role in bridging these gaps.
In conclusion, CSR should not be viewed as a burden but as an investment. Companies that integrate social responsibility into their core strategy not only contribute to societal well-being but also strengthen their long-term financial stability. A business that cares for its community fosters trust, loyalty, and sustained success.

Effective collaboration and open communication will be key to the success of our projects. I encourage everyone to stay engaged and share updates regularly, addressing any challenges as they arise. Lastly, there are several new initiatives we’re moving forward with, so it’s important that we familiarize ourselves with these tasks, as they will be vital for our long-term growth.

activity_instructions: You are preparing to brief your troops about the unit’s deployment. Read the information again and make notes on the main points. Type into the input box. Compare your notes with the model text at the end.
student_submission:
Notepad

Confidential

PANTASIA – Background Information for Deploying Units

The situation in the Federation of Pantasia began to cause the international community concern a year ago when an election resulted in a vote to break up the federation and form two separate countries for its two main ethnic groups, the Alphas and the Betas. Fighting broke out for control of the mineral-rich Argos Region, as well as between certain minority groups who were made refugees. There is also evidence of an attempt at ethnic cleansing of a minority group.

Six months ago the military staged a coup to reunite the Federation. Although a large portion of the armed forces have returned to Federal control, elements have remained loyal to the new governments of Alpha and Beta. These armies have had small battles between themselves over disputed territories while resisting operations by the Federal forces based in Federal Territory.

Until a month ago the situation was a stalemate, however, the various factions have been rearming under the pretence of negotiations. Recently, strong leadership in Beta has resulted in a campaign that has pinned down Federal forces and Beta forces have also launched an all-out attack through Alpha territory to seize valuable land in Argos.

This has resulted in considerable civilian casualties, refugees and dislocation of population. There are reports of executions, rape, destruction of property and infrastructure. It is also believed that Beta has established concentration camps as part of its ethnic cleansing policy.

Apart from the problems of the ongoing conflicts, there has been the constant threat of hunger for the civilians in the area.  Earlier in the year the weather was unusually cold and dry, which resulted in crop failures. In recent weeks heavy rains have caused flooding and the destruction of bridges, roads and rail links, cutting off some of the most vulnerable villages.

As a result of the conflict and because of humanitarian concerns, Chapter VII of the UN Charter was invoked by a special resolution with strong rules of engagement (ROE) to impose peace, separate the warring factions and provide humanitarian care. An Implementation Phase, involving air power supported by ground troops, will be launched at 0600 hours on Monday unless the factions lay down their arms. This seems increasingly unlikely.

In addition to war-fighting the infantry units will be expected to conduct humanitarian operations, to protect people and improve basic facilities. The Implementation Phase is expected to last one month and then turn into a Stabilization Phase, although it is possible that the war fighting phase will last longer. During the Stabilization Phase, infantry units will be ensuring peace and security while a new government takes over and NGOs enter the country to assist the civilian population. Some units will also be involved in direct humanitarian work.

Confidential
