activity_instructions: Read your manager’s feedback. Redraft your speech with expressions to connect your points together and make it flow more smoothly. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Let me begin with a story about our journey over the last year. Today, we are proud to celebrate a significant achievement: the renewal of our partnership with Crum. This milestone is akin to reaching a critical checkpoint in a long race, showcasing our unwavering dedication to quality. Crum’s praise for our commitment illuminates our path avforward, spurring us on to greater heights.

Reflecting on our journey, we’ve encountered some challenges along the way. About three months ago, we faced a fork in the road with unresolved defects that threatened to derail our progress. Moreover, we encountered some minor technical issues, which momentarily slowed us down. Despite these hurdles, we did not falter.

By changing our update delivery method, we ensured smoother transitions and minimized disruptions. Additionally, we enhanced our Quality Assurance processes, meticulously examining every aspect to prevent future pitfalls. These strategic adjustments, made possible through cross-team collaboration, have finely tuned our engine, making our journey towards excellence smoother and more reliable.

As we look to the future, our commitment to ongoing support remains steadfast. We pledge to avoid future problems and maintain strong relationships with our customers. This forward-looking approach is our compass, guiding us toward continuous improvement and success.

Thank you, and let’s continue cruising towards new heights together.

activity_instructions: Using your notes, draft a speech with a consistent metaphor. Add variety by using different terms for teams and problems. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Good morning, everyone.

I’m pleased to stand before you today to share some exciting news. We have successfully renewed our partnership with Crum, a relationship that has proven to be both valuable and rewarding. I’m especially proud to say that Crum has recognized our dedication to quality, which has always been at the core of everything we do. Their praise reinforces the hard work and commitment that each one of you puts into making our products and services the best they can be.

However, like any successful partnership, it’s not without its challenges. About three months ago, we faced some unresolved defects that, understandably, caused concern. Along with that, there were a few other minor technical issues that impacted the overall experience. We took these matters seriously and focused on finding the right solutions.

To address these challenges, we’ve made significant changes to our update delivery system. This change has allowed us to ensure a smoother, more efficient process, ultimately reducing the likelihood of delays or errors. Additionally, we’ve improved our Quality Assurance processes, putting even greater emphasis on identifying and resolving issues before they reach our customers.

These improvements are just the beginning. As we move forward, we are committed to providing the necessary support to avoid any future issues that may arise. Our goal is to ensure that Crum, along with all our clients, continues to experience the high level of service and quality they’ve come to expect from us.

Thank you for your continued dedication and hard work. Together, we’ll continue to grow stronger and achieve even greater success.

Thank you.

activity_instructions: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Welcome to Frisko Shipping!

Good morning, everyone! It’s great to see so many new faces here today. Welcome to Frisko Shipping—we’re excited to have you on our company!

Before we wrap up, let’s have a quick quiz to test how much you already know about the company. Don’t worry, no pressure—just a fun way to get started!

Let’s start with a little background. Frisko Shipping was founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko, a man whose journey into this industry is as remarkable as it is inspiring. You might have heard the story—Bill once fell into the ocean, got bitten by a shark, and was rescued by a passing ship. That moment of survival and chance sparked the idea that led to the company you’re joining today. If there’s one lesson to take from this, it’s that inspiration can come from the most unexpected places!

Now, a few key facts about who we are today:

We operate in 20 cities worldwide.
We have a team of over 5,000 dedicated employees.
Last year, we generated a profit of 5 million dollars, holding 10% of the global market share. What truly makes Frisko Shipping successful is the energy, motivation, and enthusiasm of its employees like you. We’re looking for individuals who are ready to take initiative, work as a team, and bring fresh ideas to the table.



Finally, as you embark on this journey with us, I encourage you to think about your own inspiration. What drives you? What challenges will push you to grow? Frisko Shipping is more than just a company; it’s a place where ambition meets opportunity. Let’s make waves together!

Welcome aboard!

activity_instructions: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. student_submission:
Property and Liability Insurance Assessment for Dave's Used Clothing Store

Exterior

- Loose bricks - risk of falling bricks and injuring someone.
- Blocked drainpipes - risk of flooding.
- Untidy yard - risks include fire hazards, potential for staff injury, obstruction for special equipment, etc.
- Leaking roof - risk of flooding, mold, electrical short circuit with subsequent fire, risk of staff electrocution through water.
- Cluttered sidewalk - risks include staff injury, inability for special equipment to pass in case of fire, etc., obstruction for firefighters and other emergency workers, ambulances if necessary.

Interior

- Poor lighting - risk of injury due to poor visibility, loss of vision, low efficiency of staff.
- lack of air conditioning - poor working conditions, suffocation and consequences for the health of workers, low efficiency of workers.
- stacked boxes - risks of injury due to cluttered passages, fire hazard in case of fire, barrier for personnel evacuation.
- old fire extinguishers - risk of fire and inability to avoid at the initial stage.
- loose chemicals - risk of injury in case of contact with the skin, fire hazard due to spontaneous combustion, personnel poisoning, etc.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning a new language is both exciting and challenging. One of the most common issues language learners face is fear of making mistakes. Many students feel embarrassed when speaking, which can limit their progress and confidence. Pronunciation and grammar rules also present difficulties, especially when they differ significantly from the learner's native language.

Another major challenge is vocabulary retention. Even after learning new words, it’s easy to forget them without frequent practice. This is especially true when learners don’t have enough opportunities to use the language in real-life situations. Lack of immersion or exposure to native speakers can make it harder to improve listening and speaking skills.

Additionally, motivation plays a big role. Some students feel discouraged if they don’t see quick results, especially when progress seems slow. To overcome these obstacles, learners need consistent practice, supportive learning environments, and tools like language apps or conversation partners. Setting small, achievable goals can also help students stay motivated and track their progress.

Despite these challenges, language learning is a rewarding experience that opens doors to new cultures and opportunities. With patience and the right strategies, learners can overcome their fears and become more confident speakers.

activity_instructions: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Buying a home and applying for a home loan in Brazil can be a complex but achievable process. While it involves several steps and paperwork, it's generally manageable with the right guidance.
Process Difficulty and Forms: The process can be somewhat bureaucratic, requiring a significant amount of documentation from both the buyer and the seller, as well as the property itself. This includes personal documents, income proofs, property registrations, and various certificates. Filling out forms is a constant part of the journey, from loan applications to deed transfers.
Housing Costs and Interest Rates: Housing in major urban centers is generally expensive, especially in sought-after neighborhoods. However, prices vary significantly across different regions and cities. Interest rates on home loans in Brazil have historically been higher compared to some developed countries, but they fluctuate based on the Selic rate (Brazil's benchmark interest rate) and market conditions.
Professional Assistance: It is highly recommended to use a real estate agent (corretor de imóveis) for finding properties and navigating the purchase process, as they offer valuable market insights and legal assistance. Engaging a mortgage broker (correspondente bancário) can also simplify the loan application process, as they can help compare options from various banks and assist with documentation. While not strictly mandatory, their expertise can significantly ease the burden and reduce potential pitfalls.

Subject: A Third Option for Our Business
Dear Josh and Ken,
I've been following your discussion on the rent increase and potential relocation of our business. I understand the pros and cons of each option, and I'd like to propose a third alternative.
What if we were to partner with the city's new Riverfront Development project? The city is investing heavily in revitalizing the riverfront area, and we could be part of it. We could relocate our showroom to a newly renovated warehouse space along the river, taking advantage of the increased foot traffic and exposure.
Additionally, we could utilize the city's new co-working spaces for our manufacturing operations, reducing our costs and increasing efficiency. This option would allow us to maintain our personalized service while also benefiting from the city's investment in the riverfront area.
I'd love to discuss this option further and explore the possibilities.
Best regards,

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
A district is a larger, administrative division within a state or country, while a city is a more densely populated, urban area within that district. A city typically has its own local government and is often the largest urban center within a district, though a district can contain multiple cities. 
Key Differences:
Scale:
Districts are larger administrative units, while cities are smaller, more concentrated urban areas. 
Governance:
Districts are governed by a higher-level local government, while cities have their own local government. 
Composition:
Districts can include both urban and rural areas, while cities are primarily urban. 
The power to create new districts or alter or abolish existing districts rests with the State governments. This can either be done through an executive order or by passing a law in the State Assembly. Many States prefer the executive route by simply issuing a notification in the official gazette.
I personally would prefer city

activity_instructions: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words.
student_submission:
From:
To: All

Hi everyone,

Good evening! It’s a real pleasure to be here with you tonight as we celebrate another milestone for our company. This evening is about acknowledging the hard work, dedication, and teamwork that have carried us through a challenging but ultimately successful year.

As Thomas Edison once said, *"There’s no substitute for hard work."* And that’s exactly what each of you has shown—through countless hours, late nights, and the relentless pursuit of excellence. Thanks to your commitment, we’ve not only met our sales goals but also upheld the high standards that define our brand.

I want to express my deepest thanks to all of you. Your efforts do not go unnoticed, and they make all the difference.

Let me leave you with these words from Winston Churchill: *“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.”* Let’s take pride in what we’ve accomplished—and stay hungry for what lies ahead. The future is bright, and together, we’ll keep building it.

Thank you, and enjoy the evening!

activity_instructions: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Buying a home in India can be both an exciting and challenging experience. The process involves several steps, starting with identifying the right property. Housing prices vary significantly depending on the location, with metropolitan areas like Mumbai, Delhi, and Bangalore being more expensive compared to smaller cities and towns.

Applying for a home loan is a crucial part of the process. Most banks and financial institutions offer home loans with interest rates ranging from 7% to 9% per annum, depending on the applicant's credit score and the loan amount. The process involves filling out several forms and providing documentation such as proof of identity, income, and property details. It can be time-consuming, but many banks offer online application facilities to streamline the process.

Using a real estate agent or mortgage broker can be beneficial, especially for first-time buyers. Real estate agents can help identify suitable properties and negotiate prices, while mortgage brokers can assist in finding the best loan deals and navigating the application process.

Overall, while buying a home in India involves multiple steps and paperwork, it is manageable with proper planning and assistance from professionals. The key is to research thoroughly, understand the financial commitments, and seek expert advice when needed.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of the text in no more than 100 words. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulates drugs and medical treatments in the United States to ensure safety and effectiveness. Drugs sold over-the-counter (OTC) are deemed safe for unsupervised use, while prescription drugs require medical oversight. Since the early 1900s, laws like the Pure Food and Drug Act and the Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act have enforced drug safety and efficacy. The FDA also monitors drug manufacturing and labeling, ensuring public access to safe treatments. Recent legislation mandates warning labels on OTC medications like acetaminophen, which can cause liver damage when misused with alcohol.

activity_instructions: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Airplanes are complex machines, and each part plays a vital role in their ability to fly. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and sometimes the cockpit, where the pilots sit. It provides the structure that connects all the other parts of the airplane.
The wings are essential for flight. Their shape creates lift when air moves over them, allowing the airplane to rise into the air. They also often house the flaps and ailerons, which help control the airplane´s spees and sirection.
The tail, or empennage, stabilizes the airplane. It usually includes the vertical stabilizer and the horizontal stabilizer. These keep the airplane steady during flight and allow for precise control of its pitch and yaw, which are movements up and down or side to side.
Finally, the engines provide the power needed for thrust. They push the airplane forward, allowing the wings o generate lift. Engines can be jet engines or propellers, depending on the type of airplane.
Together, these parts enable the airplane to fly safely and efficiently.

activity_instructions: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words.
student_submission:
Proposal submitted to: Alex Capet, Capet's Capital

Job name: Style Boutique and Design Center

Proposed by: Style Studio Inc.

Contact: Josh Cole, Creative Manager (josh.cole@style-design.com)

Style Studio hereby proposes the design and construction of the Style Boutique and Design Center on Park Street, NYC. The center will provide custom designs on request and host contemporary design boutiques by award-winning in-house designers. The estimated cost of the project is $15 million.

Strategic summary

InData Group, which we hired to conduct market research, reported that this project had found a niche in the fashion market with its concept of on-the-spot design and instant tailoring and repairs. Their surveys revealed that our target customers, young professionals aged 21 to 35, are attracted to the idea of having immediate access to new fashions designed specifically for them.

We forecast an almost immediate return on your investment. By the end of Year 2, the forecasted revenue will have a surplus of $5 million, with profits rising to $3 million a year by Year 3. We guarantee that within five years, Capet's Capital will have recouped its investment and start realizing a profit.

Risk assessment

Using a reputable insurance company to compile a risk assessment analysis, we've factored any possible economic downturn into our forecasted revenues and profits. Our projected figures have taken any worst-case scenarios into account up until Year 3.

We've already engaged Bright Lights Media Agency, who have planned and designed thorough media and advertising coverage. A massive campaign has been organized to start three months before our grand opening event.

activity_instructions: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
An airplane is made up of several key parts, each with its own important function. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the cockpit, where the pilots sit, and the cabin, where passengers and cargo are located. The fuselage also connects all the other parts of the airplane together.

The wings are crucial for flight. They generate lift, which allows the airplane to rise off the ground. The shape of the wings is designed to create a difference in air pressure above and below them, which lifts the plane into the air.

The tail of the airplane, also known as the empennage, includes the horizontal and vertical stabilizers. These stabilizers help keep the airplane balanced and stable during flight. The horizontal stabilizer controls the pitch (up and down movement), while the vertical stabilizer controls the yaw (side to side movement).

Finally, the engines provide the thrust needed to propel the airplane forward. Most modern airplanes use jet engines, which work by expelling hot gases at high speed to push the airplane forward.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate Social Responsibility: A Necessity, Not a Choice

In today’s business world, corporate social responsibility (CSR) is no longer optional—it is essential. Companies have a duty to consider their impact on society, the environment, and their employees. While some argue that businesses should focus solely on profit, the truth is that responsible companies benefit in multiple ways.

First, CSR strengthens a company’s reputation. Consumers are more likely to support businesses that care about ethical practices, sustainability, and fair treatment of workers. Brands that invest in eco-friendly initiatives or community development often gain customer loyalty and trust.

Second, CSR can improve employee satisfaction and productivity. Employees want to work for companies that align with their values. When businesses offer fair wages, invest in diversity, and support charitable causes, they create a positive work environment that attracts and retains talent.

Some critics claim that CSR is just a marketing strategy. While it is true that some companies engage in “greenwashing,” many businesses genuinely strive to make a difference. Governments and consumers must hold corporations accountable to ensure their initiatives are meaningful.

In conclusion, corporate social responsibility is not just about philanthropy—it is about creating long-term value for businesses and society. Companies that embrace CSR are more sustainable, more respected, and ultimately more successful.

ubject: Issues During Cessna 123 Landing


I wanted to update you on a situation with the Cessna 123. During landing, the approach was unstable, and we had trouble aligning with the runway. The braking system also had delayed response, making us concerned about a possible runway overrun. Thankfully, the landing gear worked fine, but the tires showed significant wear. We’re looking into the cause of the unstable approach and recommending a more thorough check of the braking system. Just thought I’d keep you in the loop.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
The Big Online Debate
Do you believe companies have a responsibility to society? Or do you think a company's only responsibility is to its shareholders? We invite you to join this discussion by posting your opinion on corporate social responsibility (CSR). Below are some quotes from recent submissions. We look forward to hearing from you!

For CSR

Companies have a big impact on society. They should help the communities where they operate. After all, those communities are letting them do business there. It's a two-way street. And it's the same with sustainable operations and fair employee benefits. The former secures future possibilities, and the latter ensures high productivity and low turnover.
– lil@213

The reason CSR makes good business sense, the reason it contributes to the bottom line, is because consumers care. Companies with a good CSR record are rewarded by customer loyalty. Consumers are happy, the company performs well and communities around the world benefit.
– Jack@MSU

As an integrated part of society, corporations need to conform to social expectations, and that entails helping the community.
– James.W@efstudent.com

Against CSR

The problem with corporate social responsibility is that corporations don't have social responsibility. Milton Friedman has pointed out that the real responsibility of business is to increase its profits; business is not answerable to society's expectations but to the shareholders'.
– theG8T

It's great that corporations are spending huge sums of money on development projects across the world, but these sums of money are usually still inconsiderable relative to total earnings. In this sense, it's still quite a cheap marketing device to buy a good public image.
– JackD_92

It's the government's job to make and enforce laws and regulations that will benefit the greater public. Corporations will need to conform to these regulations, but by no means should they be put in the driver's seat.
– patty925

activity_instructions: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Although there are several equally effective and efficient methods of writing, I prefer using the listing method of writing. As a person who is in the habit of making lists often for several aspects of my life, I find it to be the most efficient way of writing. 
I usually list out all the distinct points of information or ideas that I need to complete the writing process and having listing all the ideas allow free flow of information and prevents short term writer's block. Listing the ideas or information also allows me to further elaborate and explore on each idea without having to worry about potentially losing a thought or other ideas that are in my mind. So after doing justice to one idea, I can move on to the next idea and similarly elaborate on that idea as well. The listing method also proves itself to be efficient if the writing process is done over a long period of time because you can always come back to the ideas without losing them from your memory.

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to present some of next year’s car models to your team. Listen as she explains the differences among the models. Note the model features in the order your boss mentions them.
student_submission:
Presentation of Next Year's Car Models

1. Popularity: The X Series is the company’s most popular line of cars. In fact, it has proven to be a bigger hit among consumers than the Q Series.

2. Engine Size and Power: In terms of engine size, the 400 model holds a larger engine than the 300 model. The 400 model’s engine also produces 225 horsepower, making it more powerful than the 300 model.

3. Cost and Length: When it comes to cost, the sedans are the least expensive members of the X Series family of cars. Additionally, in terms of length, sedans are the shortest of the three types of cars in the X Series lineup.

4. Interior Space: The sedan is the roomiest type of car, as it can comfortably seat five passengers. Comparatively, the coupe and convertible are only big enough for four passengers, making them less spacious than the sedan.

This summary covers the key features of the upcoming X Series models, highlighting their popularity, engine specifications, pricing, and interior space

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
my friend Jake had the most bizarre experience of his life. He swears by it, and honestly, I’m still not sure what to believe.
 
Jake was hiking alone in the woods near his cabin when he stumbled upon an old, rusted door—just standing upright in the middle of a clearing. No walls, no building, just a doorframe with a locked handle. Curious, he walked around it, expecting to find some kind of explanation, but there was nothing. The strangest part? As he got closer, he could hear faint whispers, like a conversation happening just beyond the door.
 
Being the adventurous (and slightly reckless) guy he is, Jake knocked. The whispers stopped instantly. Then, without any wind or reason, the door creaked open—revealing nothing but more trees behind it. Spooked, he backed away, and the door slammed shut on its own.
 
When he returned the next day with a friend, the door was gone. No traces, no footprints, just an empty clearing.
 
To this day, Jake insists it wasn’t a dream. So what was it? A portal? A ghostly trick? We may never know, but one thing is certain—some mysteries are best left unanswered.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Urban Decay and the Power of Community Action
In many cities across the globe, neighborhoods once full of life and pride are slowly falling into disrepair. This process, commonly known as urban decay, involves the gradual deterioration of a city area caused by neglect, economic decline, and social problems. When streets are filled with graffiti, phone booths are broken, mailboxes are damaged, and public signs are vandalized, the environment becomes uninviting and even dangerous. This neglect doesn’t just affect how the area looks—it has a deeper social and psychological impact on the people who live there.

When residents constantly see damage and mess around them, a sense of hopelessness may start to grow. They may begin to feel that no one cares, that their community has been abandoned by authorities and forgotten by society. This mindset can quickly become a vicious cycle: neglected areas often attract more crime, especially vandalism and gang activity, which leads to even more destruction. As a result, families may move away, businesses may close, and the entire neighborhood can collapse economically and socially.

However, there is hope—and that hope lies in the power of community action. Citizens do not need to wait for government programs or external support to make a change. In fact, some of the most successful transformations in urban areas have come from ordinary people deciding to take responsibility for their surroundings.

One important step is to organize cleanups. Community members can gather to paint over graffiti, pick up trash, plant flowers, and repair damaged structures. These acts may seem small, but they send a strong message: we care. They also help rebuild a sense of ownership and pride in the neighborhood. When people come together to improve their surroundings, they also create connections with each other, strengthening the social fabric of the community.

Another important initiative is the creation of neighborhood watch programs. These groups help prevent crimes by increasing awareness and communication among residents. When people know each other and look out for one another, it becomes harder for criminal activity to take root. Neighborhood watch programs also show outsiders—especially those who might want to cause harm—that the community is alert and active.

Education is also essential. Schools and local organizations can help teach young people about the importance of respecting public spaces. Programs that involve youth in community projects give them a sense of purpose and help prevent them from turning to destructive behavior.

Finally, long-term change also depends on cooperation with local governments. While residents can do a lot, public policies, funding, and infrastructure support are crucial. Communities should organize meetings, write petitions, and advocate for improvements such as better lighting, repaired roads, and increased police presence.

In conclusion, while urban decay is a serious issue, it is not irreversible. Through unity, effort, and persistence, communities can restore pride and safety in their neighborhoods. Change begins when people decide to act—when they clean, protect, and stand together for a better environment. Everyone, from young students to elderly residents, has the power to make a difference. A clean, safe, and hopeful neighborhood is not just a dream—it is a shared responsibility.

activity_instructions: Write an email to a fellow pilot, telling him or her what happened. Write 70 - 100 words.
student_submission:
Emergency steps in aviation are critical procedures followed to handle in-flight or ground emergencies. While specific steps vary depending on the aircraft type and situation, here are **general emergency steps** followed by pilots and crew:

### 1. **Maintain Aircraft Control**
- **Fly the aircraft** first: Aviate, Navigate, Communicate.
- Stabilize flight path or attitude.

### 2. **Identify the Emergency**
- Use checklists and instruments to diagnose the problem (e.g., engine failure, fire, depressurization).

### 3. **Perform Immediate Actions**
- Follow **memory items** (immediate, critical steps) if applicable, such as shutting down a failed engine or donning oxygen masks.

### 4. **Communicate**
- Declare an emergency: “Mayday” (life-threatening) or “Pan-Pan” (urgent but not life-threatening).
- Contact ATC: give nature of emergency, intentions, position, fuel remaining, and souls onboard.

### 5. **Use Emergency Checklist**
- Follow the Quick Reference Handbook (QRH) or aircraft emergency checklist.

### 6. **Navigate to a Suitable Landing Site**
- Divert to nearest suitable airport.
- Set up for emergency landing (engine-out, gear issues, etc.).

### 7. **Prepare Cabin**
- Brief cabin crew and passengers.
- Secure cabin for landing or evacuation.

### 8. **Land the Aircraft**
- Execute emergency landing as per procedure.

### 9. **Evacuate if Necessary**
- Use evacuation checklist.
- Direct evacuation via usable exits.

### 10. **Report and Record**
- After landing, report incident and log necessary details.

Dear Kim,

Here are some tips for writing effective emails:

Subject Line: Make it clear and specific to help the recipient understand the email's purpose at a glance.
CC-ing: Only CC relevant individuals to avoid unnecessary clutter in inboxes.
Bullet List: Use bullet points for easy-to-read information, especially when outlining key points.
Attachments: Mention any attachments in the body of the email and ensure they’re properly labeled.
Keep the tone polite, proofread for errors, and always include a clear call to action when needed.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
The Hang Seng Index (HSI) has staged a measured recovery over recent weeks, reflecting a cautious shift in investor sentiment amid persistent global uncertainties. Following a period of considerable volatility earlier this year, the index has shown consistent gains through April, supported by a combination of improved corporate earnings and proactive economic policy measures in China.



Key sectors, particularly technology and financial services, have contributed significantly to the HSI’s performance, buoyed by strong quarterly results and optimism surrounding government-led stimulus initiatives. Analysts note that efforts to stabilize the property sector and enhance domestic consumption have played a pivotal role in bolstering market confidence.



Nonetheless, external risks—including heightened geopolitical tensions and the potential impact of slower global trade—continue to pose challenges. Market observers advise maintaining a cautious outlook, emphasizing that while recent trends are encouraging, volatility remains a significant factor.



In summary, the Hang Seng Index’s recent rebound signals tentative recovery, contingent on continued economic support and improved macroeconomic conditions both domestically and internationally.

activity_instructions: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words.
student_submission:
Strategic Summary

Zen will be a boutique hotel uniquely combining luxury accommodation with a spa and a state-of-the-art health and fitness center. Market research from AccomData Group shows growing trends in weekend getaways to relaxing resorts and an increased focus on healthy lifestyles. Zen will capitalize on this demand by offering an innovative experience that addresses common market gaps, such as unsatisfying cuisine in fitness centers.

Zen will feature a healthy, gourmet menu crafted by top chefs from renowned restaurants, alongside fully equipped gyms, swimming pools, and expert instructors. With an estimated construction time of two years and a projected annual profit of $1 million from the second year post-opening, investors can expect to recoup their initial $4 million investment within four years of opening and start seeing profits by year five.

Risk Assessment

The financial projections account for potential economic downturns, ensuring a realistic outlook. In a stable economic environment, the recouping period could be halved. To mitigate market-entry risks, we have partnered with Kudos Advertising Agency to execute an intensive media campaign, building strong brand awareness and ensuring a successful launch. With a growing market demand and a robust marketing strategy, Zen presents a low-risk, high-reward investment opportunity.

activity_instructions: Now write a report comparing the two car designs. Which design do you think you should go with? Persuade your design team to choose one of the designs for next year’s rollout. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
**Report: Comparison of Two Car Designs**

After reviewing the two car designs, Design A offers a sleek, modern aesthetic with an emphasis on aerodynamic efficiency, which aligns well with current consumer interest in fuel efficiency and sustainability. Its minimalist interior and high-tech features will appeal to tech-savvy buyers looking for a premium, eco-friendly experience. However, its higher production cost could limit profitability.

Design B, on the other hand, has a more traditional look with a focus on comfort and practicality, offering ample space and a user-friendly interface. While it’s likely to attract a broader customer base, particularly families, its less innovative approach might not stand out in a competitive market that’s rapidly shifting towards cutting-edge technology.

Considering the industry’s push toward electric and tech-driven vehicles, I recommend going with **Design A** for next year’s rollout. Its focus on innovation and sustainability aligns with both current trends and our long-term strategy.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: In my country, robots are increasingly being used in various industries, such as manufacturing, healthcare, agriculture, and even customer service. In factories, robots perform repetitive tasks with precision and speed, which increases productivity and reduces human error. In hospitals, robotic systems assist in surgeries and patient care, improving outcomes and making complex procedures safer. In agriculture, robots help with planting, harvesting, and monitoring crops. I feel optimistic about these advancements because they can greatly improve efficiency and quality of life. However, I also recognize the potential downsides. The widespread use of robots might lead to job displacement, especially in sectors that rely on manual labor. This could increase unemployment and widen economic inequality if not managed properly. On the positive side, robots can take over dangerous or tedious tasks, reducing risks to human workers and allowing people to focus on more creative and meaningful work. Overall, I believe robots will benefit society if their integration is handled thoughtfully and ethically.

activity_instructions: Your friend Kim needs help with emails. Read the beginning of the email. Then, make a list of tips for writing effective emails. Type in the input box. Write 70-90 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Dear Kim:
Here are some tips for writing effective emails:
- Start with a clear subject line that shows the purpose.
- Use a friendly greeting like “Hi” or “Hello.”
- Keep paragraphs short and focused.
- Get to the point quickly and avoid unnecessary details.
- Use polite language and avoid sounding demanding.
- Close with a clear call to action or next step.
- Sign off professionally (e.g. “Best regards” or “Thanks”).
- Proofread for typos and clarity before sending.

Please feel free to reach out if you have comments or questions

Thank you

Kind Regards

activity_instructions: Listen to a liaison officer advise a military unit prior to a VIP visit. Make notes on the main points. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
It sounds like you're working on an interesting exercise! While I can't directly listen to audio, I can certainly help you understand how to take notes effectively. Here's a general approach for listening to a liaison officer advising a military unit and making notes on the main points:

Preparation Details: Take note of any specific instructions given about security protocols, timing, and logistics. This might include arrival and departure times, routes, and check-in procedures.

Roles and Responsibilities: Identify who is responsible for what tasks. This includes specific duties for different members of the unit, as well as any coordination with external entities like security personnel or event organizers.

VIP Information: Note any details about the VIP, such as their preferences, important characteristics, or specific requirements. This could include security concerns, medical needs, or personal preferences.

Contingency Plans: Record any backup plans or procedures to follow in case of unexpected events. This might involve alternative routes, emergency contacts, or changes in schedule.

Communication Protocols: Pay attention to how the officer advises maintaining communication throughout the visit. This might include specific channels, call signs, or frequencies to use.

Dress Code and Conduct: Take note of any instructions regarding the appearance and behavior of the unit members. This could include uniform details, posture, and how to address the VIP.

Coordination with Other Units: Note any instructions about working with other units or external agencies. This could involve coordination for transportation, security, or media coverage.

Once you have these notes, compare them to the model provided to see if you captured all the main points. Look for any additional details you might have missed or areas where your notes could be more specific.

activity_instructions: You have plans to meet again with the prospective car dealership owner later this week in hopes of closing the deal. To help prepare for the meeting, take notes as your boss describes the current state of the automotive industry. Pay particular attention to what she says about customer preferences, current industry trends, and your company's strategy.
student_submission:
Current State of the Automotive Industry
Sales Trends: The automotive industry has become healthier in the last quarter, with sales increasing. This indicates a strengthening market worldwide.
Customer Preferences
Families: Prefer roomier vehicles (e.g., sports wagons and minivans).
Single Men: Tend to favor flashier cars (e.g., sports cars, convertibles).
Enthusiasts: Still highly interested in Jeeps and 4x4 vehicles.
Industry Trends
Improved Fuel Efficiency: All new models have better fuel efficiency compared to past vehicles.
Alternative Fuel Models: Availability of models that run on alternative fuels, including ATVs.
Benefits of ATVs:
Lower oil consumption
Reduced exhaust emissions compared to traditional vehicles.
Company Strategy
Diverse Offerings: Emphasize the importance of providing a wide range of car models to cater to various customer needs and preferences.
Customer Retention: A broad inventory will discourage customers from looking at competing dealerships and encourage them to find their desired vehicle within your offerings.
Key Points to Communicate to Dealership Owners
The positive state of the automotive industry and growing sales.
The importance of catering to different customer segments (families, single men, enthusiasts) while offering a variety of models.
Highlighting the enhanced fuel efficiency and environmental benefits of alternative fuel vehicles.

activity_instructions: You work in the pharmaceutical industry. Your boss has asked you to summarize an article for him so that he can better talk in English about the major players in the industry. Summarize the article. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The article is about the key pharmaceutical industry companies which are concentrated in the U.S., Europe and Japan. The pharmaceutical market is characterized by complex national regulations and consolidation among the largest international groups. 
Three global leading companies are GlaxoSmithKline, Pfizer and Merck & Co.. While GlaxoSmithKline and Merck & Co. are research-driven pharmaceutical companies, Pfizer is one of the largest consumer healthcare and pharmaceutical companies with three main business segments: human health, animal health and consumer healthcare. Instead, GlaxoSmithKline holds an estimated 7 percent of the world's pharmaceutical market with more than 90,000 employers worldwide and a research and development budget about $7 billion. They concentrate on four therapeutic areas, which are anti-infective pharmaceuticals (vaccines), pharmaceuticals for the central nervous system (like Paxil for depression), pharmaceuticals for respiratory diseases like Advair for asthma and pharmaceuticals for gastro-metabolic or oncology like Hycamtin and Zofran. 
Merck & Co. gained a wide market span through the joint venture with Sanofi-Aventis SA, and became one of the world's largest seller of animal medications. They also provide prescription drug benefit services through Merck-Medco Managed Care LLC.

activity_instructions: Look at your notes then write to your manager, Samantha. Describe what will be in your speech. Use a soft but confident tone. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: Update on Crum Partnership and Quality Enhancements  

Hi Samantha,  

I hope this message finds you well. I wanted to share a quick overview of what I’ll cover in my upcoming speech regarding our partnership with Crum and recent improvements.  

I’ll start by highlighting the renewal of our partnership with Crum, emphasizing their appreciation for our commitment to quality. This sets a positive tone and reinforces the value of our collaboration.  

Next, I’ll address the challenges we faced three months ago, including unresolved defects and minor technical issues. To reassure stakeholders, I’ll explain the solutions we’ve implemented: streamlined update deliveries and strengthened Quality Assurance processes. These steps have already shown promising results in reducing delays and enhancing product reliability.  

Finally, I’ll outline our forward-looking approach—proactive customer support and continuous process refinement—to prevent future issues and maintain trust.  

The tone will remain soft yet confident, focusing on accountability, progress, and teamwork. I’ll keep the language simple to ensure clarity for all audiences.  

Let me know if you’d like me to adjust any details. I’m happy to discuss further!  

Best regards, 
Pooja

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
Corporate social responsibility (CSR) is not just an ethical obligation but a practical necessity in today's interconnected world. While some argue that a company's sole responsibility is to maximize profits for its shareholders, this view overlooks the long-term benefits of investing in societal and environmental well-being.
First, CSR fosters trust and loyalty among consumers. In a competitive market, companies that demonstrates genuine care for societal issues often attract and retain customers who value ethical practices. This, tur, enhances brand reputation and can lead to increased profitability. As lil@213 pointed out, it's a two-way street-businesses thrive in communities that they support and invest in.
Second, CSR initiatives improve employee satisfaction and productivity. Offering fair wages, promoting diversity, and creating sustainable workplaces cultivate a positive work culture, reducing turnover and associated costs. This aligns with Jack@MSU's observation that CSR can contribute directly to a company's bottom line.
On the contrary, dismissing CSR as mere marketing, as JackD_92 suggests, undermines its broader impact. While some companies may exploit it superficially, genuine CSR initiatives can address pressing global issues like climate change, inequality, and resource depletion-areas where governments alone often fall short.

activity_instructions: To help you prepare for your presentation at next week's city council meeting, listen again as the forensics expert talks about how to spot a counterfeit document and take notes on the counterfeit detection methods mentioned.
student_submission:
Measures to detect document forgery.

Forgery can involve any type of document. A forged document is a document in which the truth has been altered; that is, the document does not
reflect reality. The alterations can be both physical and intellectual.
Today we will talk about how to determine if a document is forged:
1. Check the thickness of the paper.
2. Look for color-changing ink.
3. Shine a light behind it to reveal the watermark.
4. Ask the suspect to verify the information on the document.
5. Perform a handwriting analysis to make sure the signatures match.
6. Check the serial numbers.
7. Scan the document to find the microchip.

Thank you for your attention!

activity_instructions: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
Termination of Employment (Revised)

7.1. Following the successful completion of the probationary term of employment as outlined in paragraph 4, Party A may terminate the employment of Party B at any time, provided such termination is in compliance with applicable laws regarding discrimination:

(a) For just cause at common law: In this case, Party B is not entitled to any advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice. Just cause includes, but is not limited to, instances of gross misconduct or violations of the law, excluding any actions that could be deemed discriminatory or in violation of protected characteristics, including but not limited to race, gender, age, sexual orientation, disability, religion, or any other status protected by applicable law.

(b) Without just cause: In this case, Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to one month, plus two weeks for each full year of service with Party A, up to a maximum of fifteen (15) months. This provision shall not be invoked in circumstances where termination may be construed as discriminatory based on Party B's protected characteristics.

7.2. Party B may terminate his employment at any time by providing Party A with at least eight (8) weeks' advance notice of his intention to resign. This notice period may be adjusted in cases where the termination is a response to discriminatory practices or a hostile work environment, as defined by applicable discrimination laws.

Comparison with the Original Model:

The revised section retains the original structure and stipulations regarding termination but explicitly incorporates protections against discrimination for both parties. It emphasizes that just cause cannot include grounds that could be considered discriminatory and affirms that termination without cause should also respect the principles of non-discrimination. Additionally, it allows for flexibility in the resignation notice period if the employee's decision to leave is prompted by discriminatory practices, thus promoting a fair and equitable workplace.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
Over the past year, the Hang Seng index has been erratic. In the first half of the year, it experienced gradual growth due to investment developments in China. The utilities and real estate segments underpinned the growth of the Chinese market with a strong performance during this period of time. However, at the end of the half-year, the index fell to a level of almost 21,000, before recovering to a value of 27,500 by the end of the year. This was mainly explained by investor confidence collapsed and this led to a flight to safer investment assets such as US Treasury bonds and other safer financial assets. After bottoming out, the index resumed a growth path that is expected to continue in the coming months.
Financial experts see a growth path for the coming year due to investment optimism in the rest of the world and especially in Hong Kong.

activity_instructions: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Sure! Here's a comparison-contrast essay using the 'X then Y' structure:

---

**Kolkata vs. Darjeeling: A Tale of Two Cities**

Kolkata, the City of Joy, is a bustling metropolis known for its rich cultural heritage and vibrant street life. Walking through the streets of Kolkata, one is greeted by the aroma of delicious street food, the sound of trams clattering along, and the sight of colonial-era architecture standing tall amidst modern skyscrapers. The city is a melting pot of traditions, where festivals like Durga Puja are celebrated with grandeur, and intellectual pursuits are highly valued. Kolkata's charm lies in its ability to blend the old with the new, creating a unique urban tapestry.

In contrast, Darjeeling, nestled in the foothills of the Himalayas, offers a serene escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. Known for its stunning tea gardens and panoramic views of the snow-capped mountains, Darjeeling is a haven for nature lovers. The cool, crisp air and the tranquil ambiance provide a perfect setting for relaxation and rejuvenation. The town's colonial charm is evident in its quaint cottages and the iconic Darjeeling Himalayan Railway, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Unlike Kolkata, Darjeeling moves at a slower pace, allowing visitors to savor the beauty of nature and the simplicity of life.

In conclusion, while Kolkata captivates with its dynamic energy and cultural richness, Darjeeling enchants with its natural beauty and peaceful atmosphere. Both places offer unique experiences, making them special in their own ways.

---

Feel free to make any adjustments or let me know if you need further assistance!

activity_instructions: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Good morning, everyone,

Welcome to Frisko Shipping! I’m thrilled to have you here as the newest members of our global team. We were founded in 2001 by Bill Frisko—yes, the same Bill who once fell into the ocean, got bitten by a shark, and was rescued by a passing ship. That near-death moment sparked the inspiration to create this very company. If that’s not proof that inspiration can strike anywhere, I don’t know what is!

Today, we’re in 20 cities around the world, with over 5,000 employees. Last year, we earned 5 million dollars in profit and now hold 10% of the global shipping market. Those are big numbers—but behind them are passionate, driven people. That’s where you come in.

We expect you to bring your energy, ideas, and enthusiasm. And to start things off, we’ll have a quick quiz to see how much you already know about us!

As you begin this journey, I challenge you: what might inspire you today? And how will you use that to move us all forward?

Thank you—and welcome aboard!

Schools cannot deny admission based on economic background. This act has helped many children receive education, especially in rural areas, improving their future opportunities.

activity_instructions: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words.
student_submission:
Strategic Summary
We propose the development of "Zen," a $4 million boutique hotel that integrates a spa and health & fitness center, targeting the growing demand for wellness-centered weekend getaways. Market research by AccomData Group indicates a clear upward trend in consumers seeking relaxing retreats and prioritizing healthy lifestyles. Moreover, their surveys reveal widespread dissatisfaction with cuisine at existing fitness centers.

Zen will offer a gourmet healthy menu curated by top chefs from renowned restaurants, setting it apart in the market. Facilities will include fully equipped gyms, swimming pools, and certified instructors. Construction is expected to take two years, with projected annual profits of $1 million starting in the third year. Full investment recovery is anticipated within four years, with profit beginning in year five.

Risk Assessment
All financial projections account for potential economic downturns. If the market remains stable, investment recovery and profitability may be achieved in half the expected time. An intensive media campaign led by Kudos Advertising Agency is planned to ensure high visibility and market traction from launch.

activity_instructions: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
7.1 Following successful completion of the probationary period referred to in section 4, Party A may terminate Party B’s employment:

(a) for just cause at common law, provided that no termination shall be based on or motivated by discrimination against Party B on the grounds of race, sex, age, disability, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, or any other protected characteristic under applicable laws; in such a case, Party B is not entitled to advance notice or compensation in lieu of notice.

(b) without just cause, provided that the termination is not discriminatory, in which case Party A shall provide Party B with advance notice of termination or compensation in lieu of notice equal to one (1) month plus two (2) weeks per year of completed service with Party A, to a maximum of fifteen (15) months.

7.2 Party B may terminate their employment at any time by giving Party A at least eight (8) weeks’ advance written notice. Party B similarly undertakes not to resign or otherwise terminate their employment in a manner motivated by discriminatory or retaliatory intent.

7.3 Any alleged termination, resignation, or other ending of this contract that appears to be based on discrimination shall be subject to applicable anti-discrimination legislation and may give rise to claims under those laws.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission: In India, Robots are increasingly being used across various sectors from healthcare, automobile, to agriculture and education.  In industries like automobile manufacturing, robots handle repetitive and precise tasks, improving efficiency and reducing human error. In healthcare, robotic surgery and automated diagnostic tools enhance the quality of patient care. Farmers are also beginning to use robots for tasks like planting and harvesting, helping to address labor shortages. Many people feel a mix of curiosity, excitement, and concern about this shift. While I am impressed by the technological progress making improvement across everyone's lives, i am also concerned about the potential job displacement and loosing the human touch in services. The positive effects on society include increased productivity, better healthcare, and safer work environments. However, the negative aspects include the potential loss of jobs, especially for low-skilled workers, and a growing dependence on technology. Without proper education and regulation, the digital divide could widen, leaving some communities behind.

activity_instructions: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words.
student_submission: Good evening, it is a pleasure to be here with all of you sharing this dinner of gratitude for the effort, dedication, enthusiasm and commitment of all of you to carry out this important part of the project. We have been through a lot, hard and difficult times but you have been fighters, you have not given up and for that reason, I want to count on all of you to face the end of the project for next year. A year where I am more than sure that, in the end, there will be individualized rewards for each of you, because this would be impossible without you. Now I just want to thank you and hope you enjoy the dinner and the party as you deserve.

activity_instructions: Think about a business situation you have been in with an unhappy client, or make something up. Write a summary of the situation. What did the client say? What did you do? Type in the input box. Write 70-90 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: Business clients are organizations or individuals who purchase products or services from another business to support their own operations. These clients typically seek solutions that enhance efficiency, reduce costs, or solve specific business challenges. Building strong relationships with business clients is crucial for long-term success, as it leads to repeat business, referrals, and brand loyalty. Effective communication, personalized service, and delivering value are key to maintaining positive business-client relationships. Additionally, understanding their unique needs and offering tailored solutions can help businesses stand out in a competitive market.

activity_instructions: Write a thank-you letter to your friend, Clay. Say thank you for a gift or a party. Type in the input box. Write 30-50 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
July 16,

Dear Clay, thanks for inviting at your home, is beautiful, the food is delicious, i  really like the music in your dinner.
I hope to see you soon,

Sincerely

activity_instructions: Write about a company problem you are familiar with. Describe the problem. What possible solutions were there? Was a solution found? For reasons of confidentiality, do not mention a real company name, real people's names or real product names. Use general terms and descriptions instead. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
rozrobky.
In one of the companies I worked for, there was a problem with the low productivity of the software development team. The reason was outdated software and lack of clear coding standards.
Various solutions were considered. First, update the software and implement modern development tools.Secondly, to organize trainings to improve the qualifications of employees. Third, hire additional developers with experience working with new technologies.
As a result, a decision was made to gradually update the software and conduct regular trainings. This made it possible to gradually increase the productivity of the team and improve the quality of the code.

activity_instructions: You're PA to the CEO of Future Software. Read her email about seeing a client in New York. Compose a polite email to inform the client of your CEO's plan and promise future action. Type in the input box. Write 100–150 words.
student_submission:
Dear Mr. Biggins,
I'm writing to let you know that our company CEO, Ms. Kerr, will be in New York next week, and she would like to take the opportunity to visit the Electronic Solutions company office on Wednesday 23rd. She would particularly like to spend the afternoon there.
Would this date suitable for you? Ms. Kerr will share the agenda later this week and as soon as I receive it, I'll share it with you in order to organize everything. 
I look forward to hearing from you.

Best regards,

César Rodrigues, PA
to Ms. Kerr, CEO Future Software Inc.

activity_instructions: You need to address the concerns of your company's shareholders. Write an email to reassure them. Read your notes first. Type in the input box. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Dear Shareholders, 

We understand you may have concerns regarding recent market whispers and the perceived instability of the construction business. We want to be absolutely clear: Future Foundations Construction Company is unwavering in its market position and committed to maintaining exceptional stability.

Please, be assured that any rumors circulating about our share prices plummeting and wiping out your investments are entirely unfounded and false. These speculative claims do not reflect the true health and trajectory of our company.

We acknowledge that our share value experienced a temporary dip two months ago. This was directly related to the resignation of our former CEO, Greg Johnson. However, we are thrilled to report that with the appointment of Harry Levi as our new CEO, a well-known and highly respected leader in the construction industry, our share value has not only recovered but has surged to a historic high. Harry's leadership is already making a profound impact.

Our commitment to stability in this dynamic market is further solidified by three major contracts secured for the coming three years, guaranteeing a strong and consistent profit outlook. This robust pipeline ensures our continued success and growth.

We sincerely thank you for your unwavering loyalty and confidence in Future Foundations. We are incredibly optimistic about our future, and we're excited to share our five-year road map with you soon, which will further illustrate our strategic vision and secure trajectory.

Rest assured, your investments are safe and thriving with Future Foundations.

Best regards,

Ms. Smith,
Future Foundations Construction Company

activity_instructions: There's a rumor about your architecture agency. The CEO is asking you for a press release. Read the email and write the press release in 130–200 words.
student_submission:
Press Release
White Space Associates

We’ve seen the recent rumors in the press claiming our share prices have dropped — let’s be clear: this is completely false and has no truth at all. These claims came just as construction began on Mishima Corporation’s new HQ, a project we’re proud to lead.

White Space beat out 20 top global agencies for the Mishima contract, and the final design was personally approved by Mr. Mishima himself. That says a lot about the trust our clients have in our work.

In the next few years, we’ve got three major projects already lined up, and our profits have been rising steadily for the past three years. This isn’t a company in trouble — it’s a company growing stronger.

Our legal team is already taking action against those behind these damaging rumors, and we want to remind our clients that we’re protecting their interests just as firmly as our own.

White Space Associates stands by its work, its clients, and its future.

-END-

activity_instructions: Read the email from your manager. Then write an interesting, friendly advertisement for the policy change. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Dear Team, I hope this message find you well!

Exciting news! Starting the first Monday of next month, we're launching a fantastic new perk just for you: free breakfasts!

Say goodbye to the morning rush and hello to a delicious start to your day.

What is better than well cooked food to start your day? 
You can expect each morning, fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels and doughnuts. And that’s not all, every day will feature a special hot item, like fluffy scrambled eggs with potatoes or golden pancakes drizzled with maple syrup. You are probably asking your self, "What is there to drink?" You will enjoy a variety of fresh-brewed coffees, teas, and freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juices.

We hope this new policy not only makes your mornings a bit easier but also provides a wonderful opportunity to connect with colleagues before diving into work.

Looking forward to sharing breakfast with you all!

activity_instructions: Now use the notes to compose a confirmation email to your customer. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: Reservation Confirmation for Your Marbella Villa Stay

Dear Mr. Livingston,

We are delighted to confirm your reservation for a week-long stay at Marbella Villa from 1st December to 15th December. Thank you for choosing us for your upcoming vacation!

Reservation Details:

Guest Name: John Livingston

Email: j.livingston87@gmail.com

Stay Duration: 1st December to 15th December

Car Hire: Not required

Guests: Adults

Special Request: Fully equipped kitchen

Deposit: $450 (paid via credit card)

We are committed to ensuring that your stay with us is as comfortable and enjoyable as possible. The villa is fully prepared to meet your needs, including the kitchen setup you requested. If there’s anything else we can assist with before your arrival, please don’t hesitate to reach out.

We look forward to welcoming you to Marbella Villa and hope your time here will be both relaxing and memorable.

Warm regards,

Sohee.Kim

activity_instructions: Read the email thread and respond to the request from a colleague, Stef Shaw. Use the notes to help you. Write the email in a friendly but fairly formal style. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission: We are very pleased to hear about your interest in the project and the potential for it to be useful to more than one team. Regarding collaboration and cost-sharing, we believe that the best way forward is for you to experience our system firsthand. This direct interaction will allow you to better evaluate its features and determine its suitability for your projects. To facilitate this, I have cc-ed my colleague, EF Student, who is responsible for administering access to the demo version of the system. EF Student will guide you through the process, ensuring that you have everything needed to test the system thoroughly. This hands-on approach will provide clarity on how our solution can meet your needs and support multiple teams effectively. We are confident that once you explore the system, you will see the value it can bring to your collaborative efforts. We look forward to your feedback and further discussions. Best regards.

activity_instructions: There's a rumor about your architecture agency. The CEO is asking you for a press release. Read the email and write the press release in 130–200 words.
student_submission:
We as White Space Associates are releasing this public statement because of the recent slanderous claims in the press that our share prices have dropped just now Mishima Corporation releases the construction of their new Headquarter building.
We can confirm that these rumors are total nonsense. 
We beat up 20 other top agencies to get the contract from Mr Mishima who approved our design by himself.
We can bring up this afternoon that we've got three big contracts lined up in the coming years and the rise as well in the profits in the last three years.
We will also let our legal team take some action to seek compensation from those who are behind the rumors, so will be able to remind our clients that we are protecting them as well as us.

activity_instructions: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Bengaluru, often referred to as the "Silicon Valley of India," is a bustling metropolis known for its thriving IT industry, modern infrastructure, and cosmopolitan lifestyle. The city boasts a pleasant climate, numerous parks, and a vibrant cultural scene. With its rapid growth, Bengaluru offers countless opportunities for career advancement, entertainment, and education. The city's diverse population and modern amenities make it a hub for innovation and development.

In contrast, Bagalkot, located in northern Karnataka, offers a more traditional and serene environment. Known for its historical significance and cultural heritage, Bagalkot is famous for its ancient temples, such as the Badami Cave Temples and the Pattadakal monuments, which are UNESCO World Heritage Sites. The city has a slower pace of life, with a focus on agriculture and local industries. Bagalkot's landscape is dotted with beautiful natural formations and historical sites, making it a peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of urban life.

While Bengaluru excels in providing modern amenities and a dynamic lifestyle, Bagalkot offers a tranquil environment with rich cultural and historical significance. Both cities have their unique charm, catering to different preferences and lifestyles. Whether one prefers the fast-paced life of Bengaluru or the serene ambiance of Bagalkot, each city has something valuable to offer.

activity_instructions: Write a blog post advising Arthur on his situation. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: Navigating office politics requires tact, emotional intelligence, and strong communication skills. Build genuine relationship with colleagues and maintain a reputation for reliability and integrity. Stay professional, avoid gossip, and focus on delivering quality work. Understand team dynamics and align yourself with positive influencers. Always remain neutral in conflicts and prioritize the organization's goals over personal gains.
