Write a second paragraph to explain how serious it is and what is being done. Type in the input box. Write 60-80 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Dear our team menbers,
Our boss is out of offiece today.
According to her, the projector in our meeting room does not work now. Our IT department is fixing. So, we cannot use it and have any presentation at the meeting. According to her, it is not serious and it will be fixed by this afternoon.
Please notice about this point. Thank you very much for your understanding. Best regards,
M. Matsuura

activity_instructions: You see a niche in the hotel market and decide to write a business proposal for investors. Write the **strategic summary** and **risk assessment** sections of the proposal using the notes. Write 140–200 words.
student_submission:
Proposal:
Design and build a boutique hotel called Zen. The hotel will also feature a spa and a health and fitness center. The estimated cost of the project is $4 million.

Strategic Summary:
According to a market study by AccomData Group, there is a growing trend towards relaxing weekend getaways at resorts and an increased focus on healthy lifestyles.
According to the study, most guests are not satisfied with the cuisine offered by fitness centers.
In the proposed boutique hotel, we plan to introduce a healthy menu with top chefs from renowned restaurants to avoid the issues highlighted in the study.
To ensure customer satisfaction, the new boutique hotel will have fully equipped gyms and swimming pools with trained instructors.

The estimated construction period is two years.
The expected return on investment is in the second year after opening and the estimated annual profit after the second year is approximately $1 million. The estimated payback period is four years from opening. The planned profit start is five years from opening.

Risk Assessment
Using a reputable risk assessment firm, we have factored in a potential economic downturn into our projected revenue and profits. All economic downturns have been factored into the figures above.
If the economy remains stable, the time it takes to pay off investments and realize profits could be cut in half.
We have already engaged Kudos Advertising Agency, who have planned and designed a comprehensive media and advertising campaign. An extensive campaign has been launched three months before our grand opening event.

activity_instructions: A consultant has emailed you a list of issues, which the code of conduct could address. Write a reminder to the employees of the code of conduct rules to address these issues. Type in the input box. Write 65-100 words.
student_submission:
Hello everyone.

I received an email from a consultant regarding our code of conduct. Unfortunately, many of the points are poorly filled. Workplaces are not clean and tidy for many employees. You must keep your workspace clean and tidy. It is crucial that confidential files are kept in locked cabinets. A note was also made about clothing, especially for female employees. I would like to remind you that we have a dress code in the office. Unfortunately, it has been noticed that smoking is being done in the men's restroom. This is not allowed! It is imperative that smoking rules are obeyed.

I hope we follow all the rules  of code of conduct in the future.

Best regards
Kate

activity_instructions: Summarize the siege incident in no more than 50 words. Use the text to help you. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission: Indian forces in the Makeni Rescue Operation evacuated 14 personnel under heavy rebel fire in Somalia. Despite helicopter damage, all were safely extracted by a second aircraft. The mission showcased Indian aircrew skill and bravery in a dangerous, chaotic peacekeeping environment.

activity_instructions: Rewrite the termination section of the contract to take into account possible discrimination either against or by the employer or employee. Compare your amendment with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
Aspect	Model Clause	Amended Clause
Notice Period	30 days	30 days (unchanged)
Immediate Termination	Allowed for misconduct/breach	Still allowed, but includes legal nuance and clarification
Discrimination Clause	Not mentioned	Explicitly prohibits discriminatory/retaliatory terminations or employee misconduct
Employee Protection	Not addressed	Employee can raise a complaint if termination is believed to be discriminatory
Employer Protection	Not addressed	Employer can terminate if employee engages in discriminatory conduct (with proper procedures)

student_submission:
Counterfeit Goods: What You Need to Know

Counterfeit goods are unauthorized replicas of legitimate products, often designed to deceive consumers. These items span various industries, including luxury fashion, electronics, pharmaceuticals, cosmetics, and even automotive parts. While they may seem like an affordable alternative, their impact is far-reaching and harmful.

Types of Counterfeit Goods

Luxury Items: Fake designer handbags, clothing, and jewelry.

Electronics: Imitation gadgets and accessories that may pose safety risks.

Pharmaceuticals: Counterfeit drugs that lack proper ingredients, endangering health.

Cosmetics: Substandard beauty products with potentially harmful substances.


Effects of Counterfeiting on Society

Counterfeit goods harm the economy by undermining legitimate businesses and costing governments billions in lost tax revenue. They also jeopardize consumer safety, as these items often fail to meet quality standards. Moreover, counterfeiting funds organized crime and exploits workers, perpetuating unsafe labor practices.

How to Spot a Fake

Price: If it seems too good to be true, it likely is.

Packaging: Look for spelling errors, poor-quality materials, or missing certifications.

Seller: Buy only from reputable retailers and websites.

Details: Compare logos, stitching, or other features with the genuine product.


What to Do If You Discover Counterfeit Goods

If you suspect you’ve purchased or encountered counterfeit goods:

1. Report it to the manufacturer or retailer.


2. Notify your local consumer protection agency.


3. Avoid using counterfeit items, especially if they pose health or safety risks.



Being informed and vigilant helps protect you, legitimate businesses, and the broader community from the harmful effects of counterfeit goods.

Service providers range from traditional telecom companies to emerging players in mobile, fixed-line, and internet services. Companies are increasingly forming strategic partnerships to enhance capabilities, such as the joint venture between NTT Docomo, NTT, NEC, and Fujitsu for 6G technology.

Overall, the telecommunications landscape is marked by rapid technological advancements, strategic consolidations, and a push towards more robust and secure networks

activity_instructions: You are a new member of a law firm who is shadowing your more experienced colleague. Listen to the closing arguments and the verdict of a tort action trial for trespassing, and take notes for future reference.
student_submission:
The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating.

In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case.

During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Language learning can be a rewarding yet challenging journey. Students often face several issues and challenges that can hinder their progress. 

**What are the common difficulties in language learning?** One major challenge is **pronunciation**. Many students struggle with mastering the sounds and intonation patterns of a new language, which can lead to misunderstandings. **How does grammar affect language learning?** Grammar rules can be complex and different from the student's native language, making it difficult to construct sentences correctly. **What role does vocabulary play?** Building a robust vocabulary is essential, but memorizing new words and their meanings can be overwhelming.

**How do cultural differences impact learning?** Cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions can be confusing and hard to grasp. **What about motivation and confidence?** Maintaining motivation and confidence is crucial; students often feel discouraged by slow progress or fear of making mistakes. **How can practice opportunities be limited?** Limited opportunities to practice speaking with native speakers can impede fluency development.

Addressing these challenges requires patience, consistent practice, and sometimes seeking additional resources or support from teachers and peers.

John

activity_instructions: You are a new member of a law firm who is shadowing your more experienced colleague. Listen to the closing arguments and the verdict of a tort action trial for trespassing, and take notes for future reference.
student_submission:
Case Summary: Byron vs. Mr. Medina
Facts:

On the night in question, Mr. Medina entered Mr. and Mrs. Byron’s home without permission.

The intrusion caused property damage and emotional distress to the Byron family.

Mr. Medina claimed he was lost, confused, and seeking shelter, believing the house to be empty.

Plaintiff's Argument (Byrons):

The act was a clear trespass, violating the sanctity and security of their home.

Mr. Medina's actions led to material destruction and a lasting sense of fear and vulnerability.

His alleged confusion does not excuse the emotional trauma or disturbance caused.

Defendant's Argument (Mr. Medina):

Claimed he was in a state of distress, lost in the cold and woods.

Entered the house to survive the night, believing it to be vacant.

Acknowledged the disturbance but framed his actions as necessary for survival, not malicious.

Court’s Findings:

The judge clarified that trespass is a form of action, not a distinct cause of action.

Despite the indirect nature of the damage, liability was affirmed.

The court concluded that entering private property without consent, even to seek shelter, is a criminal offense.

Judgment:

In favor of the Byrons.

Damages awarded: $1,000

$500 in basic damages

$500 in aggravated damages

Mr. Medina is required to pay the total immediately.

activity_instructions: Now prepare the content for an informative web page about counterfeit goods. Be sure to keep the following points in mind: Types of counterfeit goods, the effect of counterfeiting on society, the signs of a fake, what to do if you discover fake goods.  Write 250-300 words.
student_submission:
Counterfeit Goods: What You Need to Know

Counterfeit goods are fake products made to imitate real, branded items, usually sold at lower prices to deceive consumers. These illegal replicas cover a wide range of categories, including luxury fashion (handbags, shoes, watches), electronics (phones, headphones, chargers), pharmaceuticals (medicines, supplements), cosmetics, toys, auto parts, and even food and beverages.

The effects of counterfeiting on society are severe and widespread. Economically, it causes global losses worth hundreds of billions of dollars annually, reducing tax revenue and threatening jobs. For businesses, it means damaged reputations and decreased trust in genuine brands. More critically, counterfeit goods often fail safety standards, posing health risks. Fake medicines may contain incorrect or harmful ingredients. Counterfeit electronics can overheat or explode. Even counterfeit toys can include toxic materials. Beyond individual risks, profits from counterfeiting have been linked to organized crime, terrorism, and human trafficking.

Spotting counterfeit goods isn’t always easy, but there are red flags. Warning signs include misspelled brand names, poor packaging quality, no product registration or authenticity code, unusually low prices, and sellers operating through unofficial or shady websites.

If you suspect a product is fake, do not buy it. If you already purchased it, report it to consumer protection agencies, the original brand, or law enforcement. Many companies offer authenticity verification tools and reporting platforms on their websites.

To protect yourself and others, always buy from authorized sellers or brand-certified stores. Stay informed and help stop the counterfeit trade by sharing information and reporting suspicious activity. Your actions can make a difference.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Here are some tips for motivating your employees, as well as things to avoid.

To keep your team motivated, incentivize their efforts by tying company success to personal rewards. This will make them feel like their hard work directly impacts the business. Also, take an active interest in their career development. Offer training opportunities and mentorship to help them grow professionally.

A healthy work-life balance is crucial. Recognize that employees have personal lives and allow them the flexibility to manage both. Listening to your employees, especially when they voice concerns, can also improve morale and productivity. Treat your subordinates the same way you would like to be treated by your superiors.

Avoid demotivating your staff by disrespecting them, taking credit for their work, losing your temper, or letting them unfairly take the blame. Failing to praise good work can also have a negative impact.

Good luck with your team! 

Best,  
EF Student

student_submission:
Subject: Weekly Priorities and Team Updates

Hi Team,

Hope you're all doing well! I wanted to highlight a few key updates and priorities for the week.

First and foremost, the US client designs are high priority. This project is crucial—if we deliver strong results, there’s a good chance they’ll continue working with us. Progress has been a bit slow, but still on track. Let’s keep the momentum going—great job so far!

Second, we’re preparing for some team changes. Two of our staff members will be leaving in Q2, so we’ll need to find suitable replacements soon. If you know anyone who might be a good fit, please reach out to me directly.

Lastly, the marketing media reorganization is on hold. It’s a large and complex task, but since we’re not actively using the old media, we’ve decided to freeze the project for now.

Thanks for your continued dedication. Let’s keep pushing forward!

Best Regards.

We’re pleased to share that we’ve renewed our partnership with Crum. This is a great milestone for the team, especially given the challenges we faced just a few months ago.

The best part? Crum noticed. In fact, they called out our renewed focus on quality as a key reason they chose to continue working with us.
Moving forward, we’ll keep building on this momentum, making sure we stay ahead of issues — not just for Crum, but for all our customers.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Some look to the stars to spot signs of life on other planets. Others look for signs of a different kind, to the omens and portents they hope will foretell of riches a-waiting, relationships a-coming and fame a-calling. Some look upward to the heavens for such signs; others, inward to visions and inspiration. And the rest of us may look downward at more humble and homely teacups, tarot cards and talismans to find what the future might hold in store.

By no means a 21st-century phenomenon, means of divining the future have long been part of traditional cultures around the world. People have scoured their dreams for symbols that might unlock what’s around the corner. Some societies have looked to Mother Nature for guidance, reading the entrails of animals or the shapes formed by clouds, shadows cast by stones or yarrow stalks, or scanned upturned palms and faces. These forms of divination have often been associated with people believed, or who believe themselves, to have special gifts of extrasensory perception, or second sight. The role of the priest or priestess, shaman or magician is still central in many societies today, though their responsibilities may now also include here-and-now concerns as well as forebodings.

Throughout history, particular people have been associated with clairvoyant or clairaudient abilities. For the rationalists, these people are no more than charlatans who offer vague and cryptic messages, veiled in metaphor and imagery, open to variable interpretations. To those who feel there is more to this world than the physical eyes can show us, such messengers hold the key to unlocking the future trajectory of our world, and offer hope of averting dangers yet to come.

One such individual is Nostradamus. Controversy and criticism surround what is known of him. Born Michel de Nostredame in France in the early 16th century, he Latinized his name to Nostradamus for personal reasons. Often depicted as a physician, some historians claim he was thrown out of medical university. On one thing most would agree, however: Nostradamus was an astrologer, looking to the movement of the planets and people’s times of birth to draw up his prognostications. But he has perhaps gained most notoriety not for his glimpses into personal lives, but for his revelations about the future through quatrains, or verse-like commentary.

Attributed to Nostradamus with the benefit of what naysayers call retrospective hindsight are prophesies of world wars, numerous famines and disasters, man’s landing on the moon and the recent collapse of world economies. For non-believers, however, these verses are no more than the ramblings of a man deluded, and the application of creative interpretation on the part of those who wish to believe in Nostradamus’ clairvoyance. Linguists argue his messages were wrapped in such obscurity and metaphorical language that the doors of perception were left wide open for the public to make of them what they would. They point to the wealth of phrases such as ‘and the young lion shall overcome the old’ as his means to figuratively (and some would say, therefore, evasively) refer to a wide spread of people and nations. But when the times get tough and bad things happen to good people, many look to Nostradamus’ writings, imagining they foretold this writing on the wall and heralded apocalyptic news.

How did Nostradamus make these predictions supposedly ranging from technological advances to world destruction? Reportedly, he stared into water or fire to see these visions, though more extreme believers claim the man was a time traveler! Perhaps there is only one thing we can be truly certain of, however: The debate about the meaning of Nostradamus’ work will continue for as long we have a future!

India and the ASEAN Free Trade Area
India is a key partner in the ASEAN Free Trade Area (AFTA), formalized through the ASEAN–India Free Trade Agreement. Signed in 2009 and implemented in 2010, this agreement strengthens trade ties between India and ten Southeast Asian nations: Indonesia, Malaysia, Singapore, Thailand, Philippines, Vietnam, Myanmar, Brunei, Laos, and Cambodia.
The pact primarily focuses on reducing or eliminating tariffs on a wide range of goods, boosting economic cooperation, and opening new markets for exports. For India, this agreement enhances access to a region with a combined population of over 600 million and a rising middle class. It supports sectors such as pharmaceuticals, textiles, and agriculture, while encouraging investment and joint ventures.
Beyond economic gains, the agreement reinforces strategic ties with Southeast Asia and supports regional stability and integration. As global trade dynamics evolve, India’s engagement with ASEAN continues to be vital for both growth and diplomatic influence.

Would you like a version that compares it with NAFTA?

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
How to Develop Leadership Qualities

I believe leadership is something we can all develop with time and effort. In my personal experience, one important quality of a good leader is responsibility. A leader needs to take responsibility not only for their own actions but also for the people they work with. I once worked on a team project at school, and our leader was someone who always supported us and made sure we all understood what to do. He didn’t blame anyone when things went wrong. Instead, he helped us find solutions. That experience showed me that patience and good communication are also very important.

Another key quality is confidence, but not arrogance. A leader should trust their decisions but also listen to others. I think kindness and respect are important too. People follow leaders they trust and respect.

In my opinion, everyone has the potential to be a leader. Some people are natural leaders, but others can learn through practice and experience. Leadership is not about being the boss; it’s about helping others and making good decisions for the group.

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Mysterious Nighttime Adventure of Rohan
 
Hey everyone, welcome back to my blog! Today, I want to share an incredible story that happened to my friend Rohan. It's a tale of mystery, adventure, and a dash of the unknown.
 
The Nighttime Encounter
Rohan was out for a solo drive on a crisp winter night, enjoying the quiet roads and the stars twinkling above. As he was cruising down a deserted highway, he noticed a strange, glowing light in the distance. Curious, he pulled over and got out of his car to investigate.
 
The Glowing Portal
To his amazement, Rohan found himself standing in front of a shimmering portal. It pulsed with an otherworldly energy, and he felt an inexplicable pull towards it. Without hesitation, he stepped through the portal and found himself in a completely different world.
 
The Dreamlike Landscape
Rohan described the landscape as dreamlike, with rolling hills, towering trees, and a sky that seemed to shift between different colors. He walked for what felt like hours, taking in the breathtaking scenery and marveling at the strange creatures that inhabited this mystical realm.
 
The Unexpected Return
Eventually, Rohan stumbled upon a glowing pathway that led him back to the portal. As he stepped through it, he found himself back on the deserted highway, feeling a bit disoriented but exhilarated by his experience.
 
The Aftermath
Rohan couldn't shake off the feeling that his nighttime adventure was more than just a dream. He felt changed, as if he'd been given a glimpse into a world beyond our own. He's been searching for answers ever since, trying to understand the secrets of that mysterious portal.
 
Conclusion
Rohan's story has left me with more questions than answers. Was it a hallucination, a dream, or something more? I'd love to hear your thoughts on this incredible tale. Have you ever experienced anything like this? Share your stories in the comments below!
 
Stay tuned for more updates on Rohan's journey, and don't forget to subscribe for more exciting stories and adventures!

activity_instructions: Your research team is investigating the leisure habits of people of different age groups. You are attending a seminar on research done into the leisure trends of seniors citizens. Look at the note paper you’ve prepared to remind yourself of the key points you want to know, then listen to the seminar and take notes.
student_submission:
Summary Report – Seminar on Leisure Activities for Seniors

Researcher: Gemma Banks
Institution: Chester Health Authority
Research Year: 2009

Objective

To investigate whether there is a relationship between changes in leisure habits and the number of doctor visits among seniors aged 60 and over.

Method

Quantitative study with 60 participants (men and women equally distributed);

Divided by age groups: 60, 70, 80, and 90;

Data collection through interviews and focus groups.

Main Results

Fewer meals out: 90% cited high prices and a decline in quality.

More computer use: common across all ages and genders.

Less outings: linked to increased technology use.

Preference for relaxing activities at home among seniors with higher incomes (80+).

Conclusion

Seniors are more digitally connected than one might imagine, but increased computer use can lead to reduced physical and social activity.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. student_submission: Last month, I negotiated the purchase of a used laptop from a private seller. The preliminary offer was $500, which I felt was too high considering the device's age and visible wear. During the negotiation, I asked questions about the laptop’s battery life, storage, and any past issues. I pointed out the scratches and compared prices from similar listings. The seller explained they had recently upgraded the RAM and installed a new battery, which added value. After some back and forth, we agreed on a final price of $430. I also requested that the seller include the charger and a laptop sleeve, which they accepted. In the end, I felt satisfied with the deal, and the seller seemed happy to make the sale. It was a fair and respectful negotiation for both sides.

activity_instructions: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
One of the most fascinating legendary creatures in India is the Naga, a serpent deity revered in Hindu and Buddhist traditions. Nagas are often depicted as half-human, half-serpent beings, possessing immense power and wisdom. They are believed to reside in the underworld, guarding treasures and sacred knowledge.

In Hindu mythology, Nagas are associated with water bodies like rivers, lakes, and seas, and are considered protectors of these natural resources. They are also linked to fertility and prosperity, often invoked in rituals to ensure good harvests and abundant rainfall. Some of the most famous Nagas include Shesha, the king of all Nagas, who serves as the bed for the god Vishnu, and Vasuki, who played a crucial role in the churning of the ocean to obtain the nectar of immortality.

In Buddhist lore, Nagas are seen as benevolent beings who protect the Buddha and his teachings. They are often depicted in temple art and architecture, symbolizing the harmony between humans and nature.

The Naga’s dual nature as both a protector and a potential threat reflects the complex relationship humans have with nature, making it a deeply intriguing and culturally significant creature in Indian mythology.

activity_instructions: Your new employee is ready to sign the contract. However, you think that the confidentiality agreement isn't detailed enough. Read the agreement and make amendments. Write no more than 200 words.
student_submission:
The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating.

In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case.

During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

activity_instructions: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Topic: Influencer Marketing

With the spread of social media, new marketing strategies have been adopted in recent years. One of them is influencer marketing by celebrities, which is a collaboration between popular social-media users and brands to promote brands’ products or services. To be more spefic, a celebrity visits some restaurants and posts food reviews and restaurant reviews on social media. The general rule is to clearly indicate that the food review is an advertisement.

The problem is that some influencers don't follow the rules. In case that they do not indicate that the article is an advertisement, the article is illegal and called as Stealth Marketing. By disguising the information as an advertisement, consumers mistakenly believe that the information is an objective opinion or a personal experience. This is a deceptive act. Influencers and celebrities need to have a good understanding of the rules and laws regarding information dissemination.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
Change is a natural part of life. Whether it's starting a new job, moving to a different city, or adjusting to unexpected circumstances, change challenges us to grow and adapt. Although it can be uncomfortable at first, change often brings new opportunities and fresh perspectives.

Many people resist change because it brings uncertainty. It takes us out of our comfort zones and forces us to confront the unknown. However, resisting change can hold us back from reaching our full potential. By embracing it, we open the door to personal development and transformation.

To make the most of change, it’s important to stay positive, set clear goals, and remain flexible. Accepting that not everything is within our control allows us to focus on what we can influence. Even setbacks can become stepping stones toward success when we adopt a mindset of growth.

Surrounding ourselves with supportive people and taking time to reflect can also help during transitons. In the end, change isn’t something to fear—it’s something to welcome. It reminds us that we’re alive, evolving, and capable of creating better versions of ourselves with every step forward

activity_instructions: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Criticizing the concept of celebrity culture can be quite thought-provoking. While celebrities often inspire and entertain, the culture surrounding them can sometimes be problematic. 

Firstly, the **obsession with celebrity lifestyles** can lead to unrealistic expectations. People often idolize celebrities, forgetting that their public personas are carefully curated. This can create a distorted view of reality, where success and happiness are equated with fame and wealth.

Secondly, the **invasion of privacy** is a significant issue. Celebrities are constantly under scrutiny, with their personal lives exposed for public consumption. This relentless attention can be detrimental to their mental health and well-being.

Moreover, the **emphasis on superficial qualities** can overshadow more meaningful achievements. Society often celebrates physical appearance and material success over intellectual or moral contributions. This can perpetuate shallow values and diminish the importance of genuine accomplishments.

Lastly, the **influence of celebrities on public opinion** can be concerning. While some use their platform for positive change, others may spread misinformation or promote harmful behaviors. The power they wield should be exercised responsibly.

In conclusion, while celebrities can be inspiring, the culture that surrounds them often has negative implications that warrant critical reflection.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
My Opinion on Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR)

I firmly believe that companies have a significant responsibility to society, beyond just focusing on profits for their shareholders. In today's interconnected world, businesses have a profound impact on the environment, communities, and the workforce. It is not only a moral obligation but also a smart business strategy for companies to adopt corporate social responsibility (CSR) practices.

First and foremost, CSR helps build trust and loyalty with consumers. Modern consumers are increasingly concerned about the ethical practices of the brands they support. Companies that are seen as environmentally responsible, fair to their employees, and supportive of local communities are more likely to retain customers and attract new ones. In this way, CSR is not just an expense—it is an investment that can lead to long-term success.

Furthermore, CSR benefits employees. Offering fair wages, ensuring safe working conditions, and promoting a positive work culture can reduce turnover, improve morale, and increase productivity. This ultimately benefits the company by reducing costs associated with hiring and training new staff.

In addition, corporations must recognize that they operate within communities and ecosystems that allow their businesses to thrive. Contributing to local development, reducing environmental harm, and ensuring that their operations are sustainable can create a positive feedback loop, where both the business and the community benefit.

In conclusion, CSR is essential not only for the well-being of society but also for the sustainability and success of businesses in the modern world.

I’ll open by highlighting how Crum has recognized our team's dedication to quality, setting the stage for a positive and forward-looking conversation.

I’ll address the challenges we faced three months ago, particularly the unresolved defects that impacted their experience. I'll also touch on some minor technical issues, but I’ll keep the tone balanced to emphasize how we took swift action.

In terms of solutions, I’ll highlight the key steps we’ve taken: we’ve updated our delivery process for updates, making it more efficient, and we’ve improved our Quality Assurance protocols to prevent similar issues in the future. These improvements have already made a tangible difference.

To close, I’ll focus on the future. I’ll reassure them of our ongoing commitment to support and avoid further issues, ensuring a continued, successful partnership. The tone will be confident yet approachable, reflecting our proactive efforts and strong dedication to quality.

activity_instructions: Read your manager’s feedback. Redraft your speech with expressions to connect your points together and make it flow more smoothly. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Redrafted Speech:

Good [morning/afternoon], everyone!

Let’s imagine we’re building a house. In a database, constraints are like the blueprint that ensures everything is in its right place. Just as a well-drawn blueprint keeps the structure strong and stable, constraints maintain the consistency and reliability of our data.

For example, primary keys are the foundation of this blueprint, uniquely identifying each element in our database, just like the cornerstone of a house. Then we have foreign keys, which connect different rooms or areas of the house, ensuring everything fits together seamlessly.

Next, unique constraints are like making sure each room has its own distinct feature, preventing any duplication. Check constraints act as our quality control team, ensuring that only the right materials — or data — are used in our design.

When these constraints are in place, we ensure the structure is solid and dependable. Without them, we risk building a weak foundation that could crumble under pressure. With these safeguards, we build a database that stands the test of time, just like a well-built house.

Thank you!

On MAY 19, Cessna 123 experienced difficulties during its landing approach at MEXICO. The aircraft encountered unexpected crosswinds, which caused instability upon descent. The pilot initiated a go-around after the initial approach proved unsafe. During the second attempt, the aircraft touched down slightly off-center, resulting in minor strain on the landing gear.

All safety protocols were followed, and no injuries were reported among the crew or passengers. A post-landing inspection revealed no significant damage to the aircraft. Maintenance has been scheduled as a precautionary measure.

The incident highlights the importance of continuous pilot training for adverse weather conditions and will be reviewed in upcoming safety briefings. A full investigation is underway to ensure all contributing factors are addressed.

activity_instructions: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) is a significant trade agreement between the United States, Canada, and Mexico. It came into force in January 1994 after years of negotiation. NAFTA aimed to reduce or eliminate customs duties among the member states, fostering a more seamless flow of goods and services across their borders.

One of the most notable impacts of NAFTA has been on agricultural trade. For instance, it facilitated the influx of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market, benefiting consumers with more diverse and affordable produce options. However, the agreement has had both positive and negative effects on its members. While it has boosted trade and economic growth, some industries and workers have faced challenges due to increased competition and shifts in production.

Overall, NAFTA has been beneficial for all three member countries, enhancing trade relations and economic integration in North America. Despite its complexities and mixed outcomes, the agreement remains a cornerstone of trade policy in the region.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
1. Motivation and Goals
Why do students want to learn a new language?
What are their short-term and long-term goals?
How does their level of motivation impact their learning process?

Challenges:
Lack of clear goals: Without specific objectives, students may lose interest.
Decreased motivation: Over time, motivation can wane, especially if progress is slow.

2. Language Complexity
What aspects of the language are most challenging (grammar, pronunciation, vocabulary)?
How do the structural differences between the native and target languages affect learning?

Challenges:
Grammar rules: Complex and different from the student's native language.
Pronunciation difficulties: Unfamiliar sounds and intonation.
Vocabulary expansion: Memorizing a large number of new words.

3. Learning Environment
What kind of learning environment do students have (classroom, online, self-study)?
How does the quality of instruction impact their progress?

Challenges:
Limited access to resources: Not enough exposure to native speakers or quality materials.
Ineffective teaching methods: Lack of engaging and interactive activities.
Distractions in online learning: Difficulty maintaining focus in a non-traditional setting.

4. Practice and Application
How often do students get to practice the language?
What opportunities do they have to use the language in real-life situations?

Challenges:
Limited practice opportunities: Not enough chances to speak or write in the language.
Fear of making mistakes: Anxiety about using the language incorrectly.
Inconsistent practice: Irregular study habits hinder progress.

5. Cultural Context
How important is understanding the cultural context of the language?
What role does cultural immersion play in language learning?

Challenges:
Cultural barriers: Difficulty in grasping cultural nuances and idioms.
Lack of immersion: Limited exposure to the culture and real-life interactions.

6. Personal Factors
What personal factors influence language learning (age, learning style, previous experience)?
How do individual differences affect the pace of learning?

Challenges:
Age-related factors: Younger learners often pick up languages more quickly.
Learning styles: Different students have varying preferences for how they learn best.

Previous experience: Prior knowledge of other languages can be both a help and a hindrance.

By addressing these questions and challenges, students can develop a more effective and personalized language learning plan. What specific aspect of language learning are you most curious about?

activity_instructions: You have plans to meet again with the prospective car dealership owner later this week in hopes of closing the deal. To help prepare for the meeting, take notes as your boss describes the current state of the automotive industry. Pay particular attention to what she says about customer preferences, current industry trends, and your company's strategy.
student_submission:
Here’s a polished version of your email, with clearer structure and improved tone for professional communication:


---

Subject: Survey Results – Collarless Dress Shirt (Rio de Janeiro & Shanghai)

Dear Mr. Samson,

Please find below the results of the consumer surveys conducted in Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai regarding the collarless dress shirt.

Survey Summary:
We gathered a representative sample across all demographics in both locations and asked for opinions on the design.

Interviewed:

Rio de Janeiro: 1,000 participants

Shanghai: 1,000 participants


Approval Ratings:

Rio de Janeiro:

Approve: 35% (Would buy: 20%)

Do not approve: 65%


Shanghai:

Approve: 80% (Would buy: 40%)

Do not approve: 20%



Key Feedback:

Among those not in favor (65% in Rio, 20% in Shanghai), concerns included:

Design, size, color, and material.


Among potential buyers (20% in Rio, 40% in Shanghai), moderate satisfaction was reported, with feedback including:

Inadequate pre-launch market research.

A good concept but poorly executed.

Lack of consideration for diverse consumer needs.



Recommendations Going Forward:

Conduct more targeted research on men’s preferences in accessories.

Improve design details (e.g., contrast stitching).

Offer slim-fitting sizing options.

Provide strong primary colors, black, and white.

Use wrinkle-free and sweat-absorbent materials.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph describing how robots are being used in your country. How do you feel about them? In what ways will they positively and negatively affect society? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Robots are increasingly becoming a part of everyday life, transforming industries, and impacting society in significant ways. From manufacturing to healthcare, robots are enhancing productivity and efficiency. In factories, robots handle repetitive tasks, increasing production speed and precision while reducing human error. In healthcare, robots assist in surgeries, provide elderly care, and even help in diagnosing diseases.

However, the rise of robots also brings concerns. Many worry that automation could lead to job displacement, particularly in sectors like manufacturing and transportation. As robots take over more tasks, workers may need to adapt by learning new skills or transitioning to different fields.

Ethical considerations also come into play. The development of robots with artificial intelligence raises questions about autonomy, decision-making, and the potential risks of machines making critical decisions. Despite these challenges, robots hold immense promise in improving quality of life, and careful integration into society can help maximize their benefits while addressing potential risks.

Here are some ideas for motivating your employees. I also included some things to avoid.

Incentivize your employees. Make them feel that the company's success means success for them as well. There's nothing like a possible reward to motivate people.
Take an active interest in your employees' career paths. Offer them additional training and act as their mentor.
Emphasize a healthy work-life balance. Recognize that employees have lives outside the company.
Listen to your employees. If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.
Treat subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your superiors.
Here are five ways to demotivate your staff:

Disrespect subordinates because they are below you.
Take credit or claim responsibility for work done by your subordinates.
Lose your temper.
Let employees unfairly take the blame for things.
Don't compliment or praise people for good work.
Good luck with your team! EF student

activity_instructions: You are a new member of a law firm who is shadowing your more experienced colleague. Listen to the closing arguments and the verdict of a tort action trial for trespassing, and take notes for future reference.
student_submission:
Case Notes: Byron v. Medina (Civil Action for Trespass)

Parties:
Plaintiff(s): Mr. and Mrs. Byron
Defendant: Mr. Medina

Nature of Action: Trespass

Plaintiff's (Byron's) Arguments:
Central Allegation: Defendant Mr. Medina broke into Plaintiffs' residence on the night in question.
Damages Caused:
* Destruction of property.
* Violation of the safety and sanctity of the home.
* Caused emotional distress and anguish to Plaintiffs.
* Psychological Impact: Plaintiffs will live in fear of further intrusions and for the safety of their own home.
* Claim: Hold the defendant liable for the terror caused.

Defendant's (Medina's) Arguments:
* Central Allegation: Defendant was a frightened young man seeking shelter in a seemingly empty house. * Circumstances: He was lost, confused, cold, and had nowhere to go.
* Justification: He acted out of necessity for survival.
* Damages: He acknowledges that some personal items were "slightly disturbed," but downplays the extent.
* Implied Legal Argument: Actions taken out of necessity for survival should not be penalized.

Key Legal Points Cited/Discussed:
* Nature of Action: "Trespassing" is a form of action, not strictly a stand-alone cause of action.
* Liability: Even if the damages were indirect, there was liability.
* Criminal Offense: Entering private property without consent with the intent to obtain shelter is a crime.

Judge's Verdict:
* Decision: Found in favor of the plaintiffs (Byrons).
* Rationale: Entering private property without consent with the intent to obtain shelter was considered a crime. The defendant abused the plaintiffs' trust with an unwanted intrusion.

Convictions/Compensation:
* Damages: $1,000 awarded to Mr. and Mrs. Byron.
* $500 basic.
* $500 aggravated.
* Community Service: 300 hours of community service.
* Payment: Mr. Medina must pay the damages immediately.

Lessons Learned/Observations:
* The law protects the sanctity of the home and the safety of the occupants.
* The claim of "confusion" or "necessity" is not necessarily a complete defense against trespassing, especially when there is criminal intent or breach of trust.
* Damages may be awarded not only for damaged property, but also for emotional distress and breach of security.
* Lawsuits may include both monetary compensation and community service sanctions to reinforce liability.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Thank you for sharing your experiences – I couldn’t agree more! Working across cultures has taught me that effective communication isn’t just about language, but also about understanding and respecting different social norms and behaviors.

Your examples really resonate with me. I’ve also found that things like eye contact, gestures, and conversational styles can vary widely and have a big impact on how messages are received. What feels natural or respectful in one culture might come across very differently in another.

I especially appreciate your point about not needing to be perfect. Simply showing a willingness to adapt and learn can make a big difference in building trust and strong working relationships. Cultural awareness is an ongoing journey, but it's one that truly enriches both personal and professional growth.

Thanks again for the great reminder!

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. What was the preliminary offer? What happened during the negotiations? What was the final deal? Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission:
I went to a famous store to buy furniture for my house. So, I chose all what I needed and asked the seller a discount. I had $7000 to negotiate. The full price was $8000. Obviously, I couldn't take that. It was too much. Then, I offered $6800 cash payment. He said he couldn't solve it on his own and asked a moment to check with the manager first. I expected around 15 minutes. When he got back, he proposed a 10% discount and free shipping. I expect them decrease the price at least 15% percent but I also wanted to close the deal. My counteroffer was $7000. I said I couldn't pay more. He agreed and we finalized the deal at $7000 cash payment, free shipping. 
I have to say, it was a good deal. We were both happy.

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
This is the curious love story of my aunt, Gisella, and Marco, her soon-to-be husband. They were only kids back in the 70’s when they started exchanging letters and becoming long-distance friends, as she was in Peru, and him, in Italy. 
Years went by, they became young adults, took different paths in life and stopped communicating. Each one of them got married, had children and years later got divorced. 
Little did she knew technology was going to reunite them, when Marco found her on Facebook and added her in 2018, restarting their friendship 40 years later, but this time with a twist: they were now able to instant message and see each other through videocalls. 
Sharing their life stories, friendship turned into longing, and longing turned into love. They finally met in Italy in October 2024, and a couple of months later decided to get married. Now we are just a few months away from their wedding that will take place in June 2025. 
After the wedding, they plan on living in northern Italy and visit Peru every other year so that she can visit the family, especially her daughter Claudia and granddaughter Valentina.

Proposal to: Jim My, Loaded Inc.

Job name: Zen 'boutique' hotel, spa, health and fitness center

Proposed by: Mar Inc.

Contact: Ing Mar, General Manager (ing@mar.com)

We are pleased to present the proposal for the development of Zen, a 'boutique' hotel, which is also a spa and a health and fitness center. The estimated cost of the project is $4 million.

Strategic summary
We hired AccomData Group to conduct a market research. The report showed that the number of weekend getaways is growing, especially to relaxing resorts. In addition, the report showed that those people have a growing attention to healthy lifestyle and doesn’t like the mostly unhealthy food in the resorts. 

Zen will provide healthy food with top chefs from renowned restaurants. 

Next to enjoying the healthy food, people have access to the equipped gyms and swimming pools and have the possibility to get training from instructors. 

The expected construction time is approximately two years. We forecast a return on investment in the second year after opening. The projected profit per year after the second year is $1 million. We estimate that after four years from opening the investment is recouped and realizing profit will start accordingly.

Risk assessment
To identify the robustness of our forecast we compiled a risk assessments. The outcome is that if the economy remains stable, the period required for recouping investment and realizing profits could be 2 years.

An intensive media campaign by Kudos Advertising Agency has been planned in the period of the grand opening.

Entendi! Aqui estão alguns pontos que você pode considerar para apoiar a sua argumentação a favor do aborto:

1. **Direitos Reprodutivos**: O aborto é visto como parte dos direitos reprodutivos das mulheres, permitindo que elas tenham controle sobre seus próprios corpos e decisões sobre quando e se desejam ser mães.

2. **Saúde da Mulher**: Em muitos casos, a gravidez pode representar riscos à saúde física ou mental da mulher. O acesso ao aborto seguro é fundamental para proteger a saúde das mulheres.

3. **Casos de Violência**: Em situações de violência sexual, como estupro, o aborto pode ser uma opção necessária para que a mulher não tenha que conviver com as consequências traumáticas da agressão.

4. **Condições Socioeconômicas**: Muitas mulheres podem não ter condições financeiras ou de suporte para criar uma criança. A possibilidade de interromper uma gravidez indesejada pode ajudar a evitar ciclos de pobreza.

5. **Saúde Fetal**: Em casos onde há diagnósticos de anomalias fetais graves, o aborto pode ser considerado uma opção para evitar sofrimento tanto para os pais quanto para a criança.

6. **Legalidade e Segurança**: A legalização do aborto geralmente leva a práticas mais seguras, reduzindo o número de abortos inseguros que podem resultar em complicações graves ou morte.

7. **Autonomia e Liberdade**: Defender o aborto é também defender o direito das mulheres de tomarem decisões sobre suas vidas e futuros, promovendo a igualdade de gênero.

Esses são apenas alguns pontos que você pode usar em seu trabalho. Se precisar de mais informações ou detalhes sobre algum desses tópicos, é só avisar!

activity_instructions: Read the class assignment. Then write your response on the class discussion board. Remember to take a stand on the proposal and support your position with reasons and examples. Type in the input box. Write 45-70 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
I believe that cutting physical education and sports classes in favor of test preparation is a misguided decision. Physical activity is essential for students’ physical health, mental well-being, and overall development. Eliminating these classes could lead to increased health problems, such as obesity and stress, and reduce opportunities for teamwork and leadership skills that sports often promote.

While preparing for tests is important, it should not come at the expense of students’ physical activity and social development. Instead of cutting sports, schools should strive to balance academic excellence with healthy lifestyles. Incorporating physical education into students’ routines helps improve focus, reduces anxiety, and boosts academic performance.

activity_instructions: You are handing over the watch. Make some notes on the information you must include. Write 100-150 words. Type in the input box.
student_submission: When handing over the watch, it is essential to provide a clear and concise update to ensure safe and continuous operation. Key information includes the ship’s current position, course, and speed, as well as any ongoing or planned changes in movement. The vessel’s draft and trim should be reported, especially if navigating in shallow waters. Note the traffic situation in the vicinity, including any vessels with close CPA. Update on the state of navigational equipment, engine room status, and communication systems. Report current weather conditions and any expected changes. Navigational aids in use (e.g., radar, ECDIS, GPS) should be mentioned. Ensure the next officer is aware of the captain’s standing and night orders, as well as any special events, such as drills, maintenance, or unusual operations. Lastly, point out the location and content of logbooks for reference. Clear communication is vital for maintaining safety and situational awareness.

Thank you

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
I have been working for more than twenty years, and during this time, I haven't found a true leader. This indicates that being a leader is not easy. Truthfully, leadership is a continuous process of improvement.

In my humble opinion, several skills are necessary to become a leader. One crucial characteristic is social skills. Additionally, honesty is vital because if people perceive someone as deceptive, no one will want to work with that person.

Moreover, besides having these skills, it is essential to work on persuading people. Our life is a succession of decisions, and some of them do not depend on us, so we will spend many hours trying to convince a large number of people in order to achieve our goals. 

We need to share our vision with them, and the best way to do this is by knowing how to reach them and understand them. Empathy makes it easier.

Apart from all of these, if you want to be successful, you need to design a strategic plan on how to reach the finish line, step by step.

student_submission: Last week, I had dinner at a cozy restaurant in the city center. I ordered a typical regional dish: rice with pequi, free-range chicken, and boiled cassava. The waiter explained that all the ingredients were local and organically grown. The chicken had a homemade flavor and was very well seasoned. The cassava was soft and delicious. The rice with pequi had a strong but pleasant aroma. I was surprised by the quality of the food. After the main course, I ordered a dessert. The dessert was a milk pudding with a sugarcane syrup topping. The pudding was light and very sweet. I left the restaurant feeling satisfied and wanting to come back another day

The city is peaceful and full of history, with a mix of ancient culture and modern conveniences. The food was also amazing, especially the sushi and matcha-flavored sweets. I highly recommend Kyoto to anyone who loves nature and culture. It truly felt like stepping back in time.

activity_instructions: Your friend is about to open a secondhand clothes shop. He doesn’t have much capital, and is renting a very old building. He has got a few quotes for property and liability insurance, but they have been very high. He asks you to do a risk assessment of the premises. Have a look at your checklist, then write him an email advising him of the changes he has to make. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Dave,

I’ve completed the risk assessment for your shop, and I can see why the insurance quotes are so high. There are several hazards that need addressing to reduce your risks and hopefully lower your premiums.

Exterior:

Repair any loose bricks and clear the blocked drainpipes to prevent structural damage and water leaks.

Clean and tidy the yard and sidewalk—this will reduce the risk of trips and falls for customers and staff.

Fix the leaky roof as it could damage stock and increase liability.

Interior:

Improve lighting for better visibility and safety.

Install air conditioning if possible—not only for comfort, but to protect clothes from humidity.

Organize or remove stacked boxes to prevent accidents.

Replace old fire extinguishers and ensure they’re up to code.

Store chemicals safely or remove them entirely if not essential to the business.

These changes should make the premises safer and more insurable. Let me know if you want help getting them sorted.

Best,

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
he debate on whether companies have a responsibility to society or solely to their shareholders is a complex one that reflects broader questions about the role of business in the contemporary world. Both perspectives present valid arguments, and my position leans towards a balanced approach that acknowledges the importance of corporate social responsibility (CSR) while recognizing the need for profitability.

On one hand, companies undoubtedly have a significant impact on the communities in which they operate. This impact extends beyond economic contributions to include environmental and social dimensions. As lil@213 mentioned, businesses and communities exist in a symbiotic relationship. Companies benefit from the resources, labor, and infrastructure provided by these communities, and, in return, they have a moral obligation to contribute positively to societal well-being. Moreover, as Jack@MSU highlighted, CSR can enhance a company's reputation and foster customer loyalty, ultimately benefiting the bottom line. Consumers today are increasingly aware of and concerned about the ethical practices of the companies they support, making CSR not just a moral choice but a strategic business decision.

On the other hand, critics like theG8T remind us of Milton Friedman's view that a corporation's primary responsibility is to its shareholders. While profit is undoubtedly a key driver of business success, this perspective can be too narrow, especially in an era where social and environmental challenges are pressing. JackD_92 points out that CSR efforts are sometimes perceived as mere marketing strategies rather than genuine contributions, which can undermine their effectiveness and authenticity.

A middle ground can be found by recognizing that businesses can pursue profit while also addressing societal needs. This is not only feasible but often beneficial in the long term. Companies that integrate CSR into their core operations can innovate, improve risk management, and create a sustainable competitive advantage. It's also important to note, as patty925 suggests, that governments play a crucial role in setting the regulatory framework within which businesses operate. Effective regulation can guide and incentivize companies to act in socially responsible ways without usurping the role of businesses in driving innovation and economic growth.

activity_instructions: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Celebrity culture often faces criticism for promoting superficial values and unrealistic standards. One of the primary concerns is the disproportionate influence celebrities have on public opinion and behavior, often outweighing more informed or expert voices. This phenomenon can lead to the dissemination of misinformation, particularly when celebrities endorse unverified health treatments or questionable products.

Moreover, the focus on celebrities tends to amplify materialism and vanity, with an emphasis on wealth, beauty, and status rather than substantive achievements or moral character. This skewed portrayal can contribute to societal issues such as body image disorders and the erosion of self-esteem, particularly among impressionable audiences who aspire to emulate these often unattainable lifestyles.

Additionally, the intense scrutiny of celebrities' private lives by the media and the public can result in a lack of privacy and mental health challenges for the individuals involved. This relentless attention can create a toxic cycle where personal struggles are sensationalized rather than treated with empathy and understanding.

Overall, while celebrity culture can offer entertainment and aspiration, it also poses risks by prioritizing spectacle over substance and potentially distorting societal values and priorities.

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
An Unexpected Adventure in Time

Last week, my friend Alex had an experience that sounded like it was straight out of a science fiction novel. While cleaning out his late grandfather's attic, he stumbled upon an old, dusty pocket watch. Intrigued, he wound it up and was surprised when it began to tick vigorously. As he examined it more closely, the room around him began to blur, and he felt a strange sensation of being pulled through time.

When everything came back into focus, Alex found himself standing in a bustling street that looked like it belonged to the early 20th century. People were dressed in period clothing, and horse-drawn carriages clattered down cobblestone roads. He realized he had somehow traveled back in time!

Determined to make the most of this unexpected journey, Alex explored the city, marveling at the historical landmarks and the way of life from a century ago. He even managed to befriend a few locals, who were fascinated by his stories of the future.

After what felt like hours, Alex decided to see if the watch could bring him back. To his relief, it did, and he found himself back in the attic, the watch now silent and still. Though it no longer worked, the experience left Alex with a newfound appreciation for history and a story that will be hard to top!

Formal Report: Recommendation for Skills Pro Training Company

To: Boss's Name
From: Name
Date: Date
Subject: Recommendation for Skills Pro Training Company

After careful consideration of various training providers, I would like to recommend Skills Pro as the most suitable company for our upcoming staff development initiatives.

Skills Pro offers a comprehensive range of training programs tailored to the needs of our industry. Their courses cover key areas such as leadership, communication, project management, and technical skills, all of which align with our organization's goals. They have a strong reputation for delivering high-quality, results-driven training that enhances employee performance and productivity.

Additionally, Skills Pro utilizes a blend of in-person and online learning formats, making their courses flexible and accessible for all employees. Their team of expert trainers is well-versed in current industry practices and delivers content in an engaging, practical manner. The company’s positive client testimonials and proven track record further affirm their ability to meet our training needs.

The investment in Skills Pro will ensure our employees acquire the necessary skills to excel in their roles and contribute effectively to the company’s growth. I strongly recommend we move forward with engaging Skills Pro for our training programs.

Thank you for considering this recommendation.

Sincerely,
 Name

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The Importance of Sustainability in Modern Business

As the world faces the growing challenges of climate change and environmental degradation, sustainability has become a crucial focus for businesses worldwide. In the past, companies often prioritized profit over environmental concerns. However, the shift toward sustainable practices is becoming not just an ethical choice but a strategic one as well.
Sustainability in business refers to practices that contribute to the long-term health of the planet, society, and economy. This can range from reducing carbon footprints and conserving water to adopting fair labor practices and supporting local communities. Consumers are increasingly drawn to brands that demonstrate a commitment to sustainability, making it not only a moral responsibility but a business opportunity.
Businesses that integrate sustainability into their operations tend to experience long-term benefits, including improved brand loyalty, cost savings through resource efficiency, and attracting top talent. With the increasing demand for eco-friendly products and practices, sustainability is no longer just a trend but a necessity for any business aiming to thrive in the modern world.

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Developing leadership qualities is a journey that involves self-awareness, practice, and learning from experiences. Key qualities such as communication skills, empathy, decisiveness, and integrity are often seen in effective leaders. Communication is crucial as it enables leaders to inspire and guide their teams clearly. Empathy allows leaders to understand and connect with their team members, fostering a supportive environment. Decisiveness is necessary for making timely decisions, while integrity builds trust and credibility.

In my observations, individuals who actively seek feedback and are open to growth often excel in leadership roles. For instance, a colleague who regularly sought mentorship and took on challenging projects gradually developed into a respected leader within the organization. They exhibited resilience and adaptability, learning from both successes and failures.

I believe everyone has the potential to be a leader in some capacity, as leadership is not confined to a specific role or title. It involves influencing and motivating others, which can occur in various contexts. However, realizing this potential requires commitment to personal development and a willingness to embrace challenges. By cultivating essential leadership qualities, anyone can grow into a leader and positively impact their community or organization.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of the report in no more than 75 words. Compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
A quantitative research project ehose purpose is to gather data on changing leisure habits amongst adolescents and to ascertain any correlation between these changes and the increasing obesity.
The methodologies include online surveys and face-to-face questionnaires.
The main trends identified include a marked reduction in the number of hours per week adolescents engage in walking, cycling, swimming or skateboarding.
It was found 65% increase in the number of hours per day spent at a computer or in other sedentary leisure pursuits and 80% rise in daily calorie consumption.
There was a drop in available parent-adolescent play time hours, resulting impacts the latter’s leisure pursuits, which tend to become more solitary and marked by inactivity as a result.
The report recommends that more physical education classes be reintroduced into schools between the ages of ten to sixteen, and that more attention should be put on health skills classes for all age groups and genders in school.
The report concludes by calling for local Parent-Teacher associations to extend their meeting agendas to include regular discussions of each child’s academic and physical well-being.

activity_instructions: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words.
student_submission:
CSR commitment is an asset that should be valued, because it lays the foundations for a more resilient company, according to an Indeed analysis. It's not just about marketing, because the company is obliged to respect and apply certain standards or rules, which can initially represent a substantial investment. However, this will soon be offset and amortised by a number of positive spin-offs:

In economic terms, the CSR approach has an impact on management strategy, as it helps to anticipate risks, improve efficiency and optimise costs. It is a means of securing the company's business over the medium and long term.

The actions taken as part of a CSR policy, particularly in terms of responsible purchasing, also help to build a healthy and balanced relationship with the company's suppliers and subcontractors.

CSR has an important social component, which translates into objectives in terms of working conditions, well-being and employee motivation.The initiatives we have put in place aim to promote quality of life at work and encourage dialogue within a calm working environment.

CSR also incorporates values relating to equality, non-discrimination and fair pay within the company.

Finally, implementing a CSR policy is also an opportunity for the company to take an interest in the entire ecosystem in which it operates and the consequences of its activities on the environment.It identifies its main impacts (greenhouse gas emissions, consumption of resources, production of waste, pollution, etc.), defines and implements an action plan to reduce them and measures its results.

activity_instructions: Summarize the terms of a contract to your boss, Mr. Kent. Write 75–150 words.
student_submission:
Summary of Contract for Mr. Kent:

On June 15, 2017, Design Inc. (Seller) and Green Solutions (Buyer) agreed to the following terms for the sale of goods:

Parties Involved: Seller, located at 3 Peacock Walk, Portland, specializes in Design and Retail. Buyer, located at 9 Green Lane, Tacoma, specializes in Information Technology.
Goods: Seller will deliver 250 Xu Console desks to Buyer by September 30, 2017.
Payment Terms: Buyer will pay half upon receipt of goods and the full amount within 30 days of delivery.
Delivery and Inspection: Goods are considered received upon delivery to Buyer's address. Buyer has 21 days to inspect and notify Seller of any damages.
Risk of Loss: Seller bears all risk of loss until Buyer receives the goods.
The contract was signed by authorized representatives of both parties.

activity_instructions: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
An airplane is made up of several important parts, each with a special job to help it fly safely and smoothly. The fuselage is the main body of the airplane. It holds the passengers, cargo, and the cockpit where the pilots sit and control the plane.

The wings are attached to the sides of the fuselage. They are shaped to lift the airplane into the air when it moves fast down the runway. Air moves faster over the top of the wings and slower underneath, creating lift that helps the airplane rise.

The engines provide the power needed to move the airplane forward. Most commercial airplanes have jet engines, which push air backwards to move the plane ahead.

At the back of the airplane is the tail, which helps keep the airplane stable and balanced in the air. The tail includes the rudder and elevators, which help the plane turn and move up or down.

All of these parts work together so the airplane can take off, fly through the sky, and land safely.
