Jessica Hernandez
Production Manager

activity_instructions: Write about how to develop leadership qualities. You can write about personal experiences or what you have seen happen in others. What qualities do you think are most important? Do you think everyone has the potential to be a leader? Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Being a leader is difficult, but it is possible to improve your leadership skills in a systematic and steady way.

First, identify the skills you need as a leader. The skills you need will depend on the company you work for, so ask your current leader what you need. It is also a good idea to add any skills you think you yourself need.

Once you have completed the list of skills you need, find out what skills you are currently lacking. Developing those skills is the way to become a leader. Make a plan to acquire the skills and put it into action. You may not be able to learn them on your own, so be proactive and get help from your company and your boss. 
They will be happy to help you.

Recognise your strengths as well as your missing skills. This will help you with what strategies to use when managing the organisation in the future.

Remember to get feedback from your manager and colleagues. It will help you realise strengths and weaknesses that you may not be aware of yourself.

activity_instructions: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Behind the glittering lights and the constant flash of cameras, some celebrities seem to forget the power of their voice. They stand in mansions, surrounded by luxury, promoting products that most people can’t afford. Meanwhile, millions struggle to pay their bills, their dreams buried beneath the weight of reality. It's easy to forget the world outside when you're lost in a bubble of fame.

They sometimes stir up trouble, not with their talent, but with their actions. A careless word here, an argument there, and suddenly they’ve become the story, overshadowing the things that truly matter. Their behavior can echo through the hearts of young fans, who mimic their every move, believing fame is the only thing worth chasing.

But what if they used their fame for something more meaningful? What if, instead of getting lost in the noise, they chose to be the voice of those unheard? Celebrities have a rare opportunity, not just to shine in the spotlight, but to inspire change. The real question is, are they willing to step beyond the glitter and give something real to the world?

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.

Dear Henry, good morning, below I give you information on aspects to motivate your work team and avoid some things that may affect the team and the company.

You must set clear and realistic goals. A leader must work together with his team to set challenging but achievable goals. Clear goals provide direction and purpose. 

A leader must recognize the achievements and effort of his team in a regular and genuine manner.

A leader must create a positive and stimulating work environment, where employees feel valued and appreciated. 
Provide opportunities for professional growth and development.

Employees feel motivated when they see that they have opportunities for growth and development in their career. 

A leader must encourage open and effective communication within the team. This involves actively listening to the ideas and concerns of employees, providing constructive feedback and promoting collaboration and the exchange of ideas.
I hope my strategies serve you and apply them with your work team. If you have any questions, suggestions or comments, you can write me an email. 
Best regards.

activity_instructions: Read the email thread and respond to the request from a colleague, Stef Shaw. Use the notes to help you. Write the email in a friendly but fairly formal style. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
Blockchain technology is a decentralized, distributed ledger system that securely records transactions across multiple computers in a way that ensures the data is tamper-proof and transparent. Originally developed as the underlying technology for cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin, blockchain has since found applications in many other industries, including finance, healthcare, supply chain, and voting systems.

The core of blockchain technology is its ability to store data in “blocks” that are linked together in a chronological chain. Each block contains a list of transactions, a timestamp, and a reference to the previous block, ensuring that once data is added, it cannot be altered without changing all subsequent blocks, which would require the consensus of the network. This makes it highly secure and resistant to fraud.

One of the main benefits of blockchain is decentralization. Unlike traditional centralized systems where a single entity has control, blockchain operates on a network of computers (or nodes) that work together to validate and store data, removing the need for intermediaries. This can lower costs and increase efficiency.

While blockchain holds great promise, challenges remain, such as scalability and energy consumption. However, ongoing advancements continue to address these issues, making blockchain a transformative technology with the potential to revolutionize many sectors.

activity_instructions: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Cristiano Ronaldo’s relentless pursuit of fame and status often overshadows the deeper qualities that truly define great athletes. His off-field persona is carefully crafted, a brand built on self-promotion, wealth, and image. Whether it’s his Instagram posts showcasing his chiselled physique, luxury cars, or private jets, Ronaldo’s image is one of perfection and excess. He thrives on being a global superstar, often placing his personal legacy above the collective success of his teams. This focus on his own brand can come off as self-absorbed, and it’s hard to ignore the contrast between him and his rival, Lionel Messi, who maintains a far humbler approach to fame.

While Ronaldo is busy ensuring the world knows every detail of his life, Messi stays under the radar, letting his on-field performance speak for itself. Messi’s success isn’t about flash; it’s about consistency, humility, and an almost quiet mastery of the game. Messi’s ability to remain grounded despite being the greatest player of all time is a stark reminder of how excessive self-promotion can often come across as insecurity. Ronaldo’s ego-driven image, at times, seems like it’s compensating for something, whereas Messi’s understated brilliance needs no validation. Ronaldo may have the glitz and glamour, but Messi has the quiet respect that comes with true greatness.

The XZ3 boasts a powerful 6.4-liter V8 engine, achieving a top speed of 207.1 mph and accelerating from zero to 60 mph in 2.7 seconds. activity_instructions: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission: the Media has changed dramatically in my lifetime. In the past, newspapers, magazines, and television were the primary sources of news and entertainment; people would gather around the TV for the evening news or read the morning paper with breakfast. Now, digital media dominates: I use smartphones, tablets, and laptops to access news, books, and videos instantly. Social media platforms like Twitter and Instagram have become major sources of information, although not always reliable. This shift has changed my reading habits significantly. I read more frequently but in shorter bursts—articles, blog posts, and social media updates rather than long-form journalism or books. While I still enjoy reading novels, I often use e-readers or apps instead of physical books. The convenience is unmatched; however, I sometimes miss the immersive experience of traditional reading. Overall, media has become more accessible and interactive, but it also demands more attention and discernment.

activity_instructions: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words.
student_submission:
Learning a new language is a rewarding yet challenging experience. Many language learners face common issues that can hinder their progress. One of the most significant challenges is motivation. Consistency is key in language learning, but maintaining interest over time can be difficult, especially when progress seems slow or when faced with the complexities of grammar and pronunciation.

Another issue is the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they fear they will sound incorrect or be misunderstood. This fear can lead to a lack of practice, which, in turn, slows down improvement. Overcoming this fear requires a shift in mindset, focusing on communication rather than perfection.

Additionally, the learning environment plays a crucial role. Without immersion or constant exposure to the language, learners may struggle to retain vocabulary or develop fluency. This can be particularly challenging for those who do not live in a country where the language is spoken. Language learners must be creative in finding ways to surround themselves with the language, such as through movies, music, or online conversations with native speakers.

Lastly, differences in cultural context can be a barrier. Understanding the culture behind a language is essential for full comprehension and communication. Without this understanding, learners might miss out on nuances or idiomatic expressions that are crucial for mastering a language.

By addressing these challenges, learners can improve their language skills and stay motivated throughout the journey.

Once you provide the list, I'll get started. Let's assume the list includes issues like project delays, team resource allocation, and budget concerns. Here's a possible email body:

"I would like to discuss several pressing matters regarding our current project. Specifically, we are facing delays in completion, which may impact our overall timeline. activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Last Saturday, my best friend Pinku called me in a panic. "You won't believe what I just saw the behind the old sacks of rice", she said. I thought it was another one of her exaggerated stories, but curiosity won. I rushed to her house in Mumbai. 

In the corner of her dimly lit storeroom, hidden behind old Diwali decorations and pickle jars, was a faintly glowing doorway-round, with ancient Sanskrit-like symbols spinning around it. Before we could overthink, we stepped in.

We landed in a surreal forest with golden mango trees, floating lotuses, and peacocks that recited shlokas. A talking langur named Bheemu welcomed us, offering sweet neem laddoos and advice  to avoid the "Time Serpents" - creatures that could rewind your memories.

We explored until the sky turned violet. Back home, only five minutes had passed. The portal is gone now.

But the laddoo? Still warm in my pocket.

activity_instructions: After the consultation, you write Pete a summary of his bad lifestyle habits and how to change them. Write the email below, including language of cause, effect, advice and describing benefits. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words.

Subject: Your Lifestyle Summary and Suggested Changes

Hi Pete,

Thank you for sharing your lifestyle habits during our consultation. Based on what you told me, there are several areas that need improvement.

Because of your long working hours and high stress levels, you feel constantly tired and rely on coffee and junk food, which is causing weight gain and poor sleep. Sitting in front of a computer all day and using a bad chair has also led to frequent back pain. In addition, smoking and watching too much TV have a negative effect on your physical and mental health.

To improve your overall well-being, I suggest starting with small changes. Try to go to bed and wake up at consistent times to improve sleep quality. Reducing caffeine intake and avoiding junk food will help you feel more energized. You could also take short breaks during work to stretch, which can reduce back pain. Replacing TV time with light physical activity, like walking or yoga, will benefit both your body and your mind.

Making these changes will not only improve your health, but also increase your focus, reduce stress, and help you feel more in control of your life.

activity_instructions: Use your notes to help you write the report. Make sure you follow the correct structure and conventions. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Report: Assessing the Potential for Oil Extraction in the Alberta Oil Fields

During my visit to Alberta's oil sands, I gathered key information on the region's potential for oil extraction. The oil sands contain significant resources of bitumen, which presents both opportunities and challenges.
Cost Analysis:
Operating costs for bitumen extraction range from $6 to $14 per barrel, while synthetic crude production costs are higher, from $18 to $22 per barrel. Supply costs are similarly higher for synthetic crude ($36 to $40 per barrel), compared to bitumen ($14 to $24 per barrel). 
Production Forecast:
Oil supply from the region is projected to reach 3.9 million barrels per day by 2015, indicating a strong production capacity. However, this growth will require expansions in traditional markets and potentially new market development.
Recommendations:
1. Monitor crude oil prices closely to ensure profitability.
2. Acquire more data on the costs of labor and logistics.
3. Consider the costs of transporting skilled labor to the region.
4. Begin testing to further evaluate extraction efficiency and costs.
In conclusion, Alberta’s oil sands offer promising opportunities, but careful market expansion and operational cost management will be critical to success.

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Here are some ideas for motivating your employees. I also included some things to avoid.

Incentivize your employees. Make them feel that the company's success means success for them as well. There's nothing like a possible reward to motivate people.
Take an active interest in your employees' career paths. Offer them additional training and act as their mentor.
Emphasize a healthy work-life balance. Recognize that employees have lives outside the company.
Listen to your employees. If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.
Treat subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your superiors.

Make wellbeing a priority and also identify their priorities , so that you can easily identify what is it that they value. There is no need to push it but make your employees feel safe when having a conversation with you.

activity_instructions: You work in the pharmaceutical industry. Your boss has asked you to summarize an article for him so that he can better talk in English about the major players in the industry. Summarize the article. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
The pharmaceutical industry is primarily concentrated in the developed regions of the United States, Europe, and Japan. In fact, these regions have formed an alliance known as the International Conference on Harmonization (ICH), an alliance whose objective is to harmonize the technical requirements for the registration of medicines for human use, thereby reducing the need for duplicate studies and facilitating more efficient drug development and approval.

Some of the pioneering pharmaceutical companies are GlaxoSmithKline, Pfizer, and Merck & Co.

GlaxoSmithKline is a pioneering research-based pharmaceutical company. It is headquartered in the UK, although its operations are primarily in the United States. Its activities are primarily focused on anti-infectives, the central nervous system, the respiratory system, and the gastro-metabolic system.

Pfizer is one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world, focusing on three areas: human health, animal health, and consumer healthcare.

Merck & Co. is a research-focused pharmaceutical company, known for being one of the leading developers of pharmaceutical products for animals, although it also has a wide range of pharmaceutical products for humans.

activity_instructions: Write a description, introducing the new bird species, comparing its appearance and habitat to that of the American robin, and classification using the formal zoological classification system. For the classification, suggest a name for the new species and say why it’s suitable. Use the email as reference.
student_submission:
A New Species of Robin

Recent DNA analysis has revealed a new species of bird closely related to the familiar American robin. This newly discovered species exhibits distinct physical characteristics and habitat preferences, setting it apart from its well-known relative.

Physical Characteristics:

While sharing similarities with the American robin, this new species is slightly smaller in size. A notable difference lies in its bill, which is proportionally larger. The male of this species displays a rustier, less vibrant red coloration compared to the bright red breast of the American robin.

Habitat:

This newly identified bird species shares a similar habitat preference with the American robin, thriving in various terrains. However, unlike the American robin, it does not migrate south of Canada during the winter months.

Classification:

Based on the DNA analysis, this new species is classified as follows:

Kingdom: Animalia
Phylum: Chordata
Class: Aves
Order: Passeriformes
Family: Turdidae
Genus: Turdus
Species: Turdus rustinus
The proposed species name, Turdus rustinus, is derived from the Latin word "rustinus," meaning "rusty." This name reflects the distinctive rusty coloration of the male bird, making it a fitting choice for this unique species.

activity_instructions: Should e-nav tools replace all traditional equipment on ships? Use your own ideas. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words.
student_submission:
The jury was initially split, with eight jurors voting to convict defendants on charges of both the conspiracy and intent to incite riots, and four jurors voting to acquit the defendants on all charges. The foreman handed a hung-jury message to the marshal to take to the judge, but he instructed the jury to keep deliberating.

In the end, on February 18, 1970, all seven defendants were found not guilty on the conspiracy charges, two were acquitted completely, and five were convicted of inciting to riot. These five were each sentenced to five years' imprisonment and fined $5,000 on February 20, 1970. The convictions were all reversed on appeal by the United States Court of Appeals for the Seventh Circuit on November 21, 1972. The reasons for the reversal involved bias by the judge and his refusal to permit defense attorneys to question prospective jurors regarding cultural bias. The Justice Department decided not to re-try the case.

During the trial, all the defendants and both defense attorneys were cited for contempt and sentenced to jail, but those convictions were also overturned. The contempt charges were re-tried before a different judge, who found four people guilty of some of the charges, but decided not to sentence the defendants to jail or fines.

activity_instructions: Write an application for a management position as a programmer. Type in the input box. Write 40-70 words. Use your own words where possible.

Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
SpaceX has launched its Crew Dragon spacecraft on a “rescue mission” to bring back two astronauts stranded at the International Space Station (ISS) since June. Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams travelled to the space station on Boeing’s Starliner spacecraft, which was on its first mission with a human crew.

But several engines malfunctioned once in space and the vehicle was found to be leaking helium, which is essential for the functioning of its engines. After weeks of analysis and discussion by Nasa and Boeing engineers, the space agency decided to send Wilmore and Williams home on the Crew Dragon because of safety concerns with Starliner.

For Boeing, this embarrassing episode is the latest in a long series of problems. They include fatal crashes of its 737 Max aircraft in 2018 and 2019 and a door that blew out mid-flight on a 737 Max 9 plane in January 2024.

Boeing’s Starliner craft has been beset with challenges since 2014 when Nasa awarded both Boeing and Space X with contracts to develop spacecraft that could transport astronauts and supplies to and from the ISS as part of its Commercial Crew Program (CCP).

Boeing received US$4.2 billion (£3bn) to develop the Starliner craft, while SpaceX received US$2.6 billion (£1.9 billion) to develop the Crew Dragon. Despite the lower contract value, SpaceX’s Crew Dragon has performed much better than Starliner, making a successful first crewed flight in 2020 and launching regularly to the ISS ever since. Starliner, meanwhile, has still not had a fully successful crewed flight.

activity_instructions: Should e-nav tools replace all traditional equipment on ships? Use your own ideas. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words.
student_submission: Electronic navigation tools, such as the Electronic Navigation Information System (ECDIS) and GPS, have revolutionized the way ships navigate. They offer accuracy, efficiency, and real-time data integration, allowing mariners to make informed decisions quickly. However, completely replacing traditional equipment can be risky. Classic methods, such as nautical charts and compasses, are essential in the event of technological failures. Furthermore, overreliance on technology can lead to the dehumanization of the navigation profession. Therefore, a balanced approach that integrates both systems is the most prudent way to ensure safety and efficiency in maritime operations.

activity_instructions: You work for a market research firm. You take a call from a potential new client who wants your company to undertake some research on student attitudes toward e-learning in comparison with traditional classroom learning. Listen to the voicemail message left by the client and take notes on what she wants.
student_submission:
Introduction

The rapid advancement of technology has significantly transformed the landscape of education, particularly with the rise of online learning platforms and virtual campuses. As universities adapt to these changes, understanding students' preferences and behaviors concerning online classes during vacations can help institutions develop better strategies for enhancing educational experiences. This research aims to investigate the willingness and frequency of new students attending online classes during vacation if provided with a virtual campus, along with their reasoning.

Plan

This project will span three months, focusing on a qualitative approach to gather in-depth insights from new students enrolled in the fall semester. The study will involve conducting interviews that explore students' perspectives on attending online classes during vacation periods. The analysis will provide valuable information to educational institutions for improving their online learning strategies and engagement during non-traditional academic times.

Questions

The research will revolve around the following key questions:

Would you attend online classes during vacation if we have a virtual campus?
How often would you attend these online classes during vacation?
Why would you choose to attend or not attend online classes during vacation?
Methodologies

The research will employ a qualitative approach, focusing on the collection of rich, detailed responses from participants through interviews. The methodologies will include:

Participant Selection: New students enrolled in the fall semester will be selected to participate in the study. Efforts will be made to ensure a diverse representation of students from various disciplines and backgrounds.

Interview Process: Semi-structured interviews will be conducted to allow participants to express their views freely while ensuring that the key questions are addressed. The interviews will be recorded (with participants' consent) and transcribed for analysis.

Data Analysis: The transcriptions will be coded and analyzed using thematic analysis to identify patterns and themes in students' responses. This qualitative method will facilitate a deep understanding of students' perspectives and the factors influencing their decisions.

Purpose

The primary purpose of this research is to understand new students' attitudes towards attending online classes during vacation if provided with a virtual campus. By exploring the frequency of attendance and the reasons behind their choices, this study aims to provide actionable insights for educational institutions to improve online learning offerings and strategies, ultimately enhancing student engagement and satisfaction during non-traditional academic times. The findings will contribute to the development of policies and practices that can better support students in their educational journeys.

activity_instructions: Explain in one sentence the factors which affect the premium of a liability policy. Write the sentence below. Use the text to help you. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
In the United States, there are seven basic types of home insurance. However, most homes are covered by two types, called Homeowner's 2 (HO-2) and Homeowner's 3 (HO-3). HO-2 covers the residence and personal property against 17 different types of peril, including fire, smoke, windstorm, theft, falling objects, electrical surges and water damage caused by home appliances. HO-3 covers all of the perils in HO-2 and adds all other perils not stated in the policy, excluding flood, earthquake, war and nuclear accident.

The owner must first determine how much it would cost to replace the house and many of the items inside. Most homeowner policies contain replacement cost coverage on the home and actual cash value coverage on personal property. Many policies also have automatic annual adjustments for inflation. This increases the amount of coverage on the home to keep pace with rising building costs.

Liability coverage is an important part of any home insurance policy. It covers financial liability in case someone unrelated to the insured suffers a serious injury on the property. The general level of liability protection in the United States is $100,000, but many people have coverage of $300,000 or even more. Most policies set limits for items like jewelry, collectibles, and computers. If you own expensive items, you can pay extra premiums to have those items fully insured under what is called a floater.

Many factors go into determining the premiums for a homeowner's policy. The age of the home, the materials used to build it, where it's located, the square footage and the number of rooms all play a role. Homeowners can usually save money on insurance policies by raising their deductible. In general, the higher the deductible, the lower the premiums.

activity_instructions: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
Social Media and Technology: Yesterday and Today

In the past, my family spent a lot of time together, engaging in conversations about various topics and sharing stories about our ancestors. We would sit together in the living room, watching television and eating popcorn. When family members traveled to other cities and countries, they sent us letters and postcards. Nowadays, with the media we have today, people use WhatsApp to communicate and send photos in real time. Our lifestyle has undergone significant changes; children no longer enjoy playing on the streets, swimming in the river, or reading books. Instead, they prefer playing video games and are often reluctant to spend time in public with their family and friends. While we have access to modern technology, it's important to reflect on the many wonderful experiences from the past that we are missing out on. Despite the advantages of advanced technology, we should consider the value of the simpler, more connected times we once enjoyed.

activity_instructions: Should e-nav tools replace all traditional equipment on ships? Use your own ideas. Type in the input box. Write 80-100 words.

activity_instructions: You are completing a pre-inspection checklist for a dry bulk cargo vessel, Starlight. Make notes about any issues you noticed. Use the categories provided and type into the input box. Write 80-100 words. Categories: general cargo safety and stowage; staffing levels and working conditions; general condition and maintenance of the vessel; safety standards
student_submission:
During the pre-inspection of the bulk cargo vessel Starlight, the following issues were observed:

Safety and stowage of general cargo: Some containment nets were damaged, and cargo was unevenly distributed across two holds.
Staffing levels and working conditions: The crew was incomplete, with two crew members absent and others showing signs of fatigue.
General conditions and maintenance of the vessel: Excessive rust was detected on the deck and poor lighting in access areas.
Safety standards: Fire extinguishers were expired, and some alarms did not function properly during the test.

activity_instructions: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
For me the most pracical techniques for creative writing are metaphors and listings. In the past I used both techniques, but in diffrent situations. 
Metaphors are for me more usefull in a verbal conversation or while I have to explain something to somebody. So I am able to connect new informations with common knowledge or knowledge the person allready got. For example in my actual position as teammanager I have to manage resources. If you have limited resources for a given workload, you will have to shift the resources from side to side. A good metaphor for this situation is a table with a tablecloth, which is to small. 
Listings are very usefull for writing scientific papers. I allways start with a list of topics I have to adress in the paper. Sometime this list could be used later as an draft for the index of the paper. In addition to that you are able to repeat this technique later in the progress, if necessary. So it is kind of similar to loop writing.

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
Hang Seng Index Rebounds on Mainland Investment and Sector Growth

The Hang Seng Index (HSI), Hong Kong’s benchmark stock market index, has shown impressive recovery and growth over the past six months, reversing a previous slump. After dipping to 20,956 half a year ago, the index surged to a high of 27,499 — a rise driven largely by renewed investor confidence and capital inflows from Mainland China.

Two key sectors — Properties and Utilities — have led the charge, with sub-indices in both areas showing dramatic gains. Analysts attribute this performance to China's steady economic recovery and cross-border investment, which has fueled optimism across Hong Kong’s markets.

Looking ahead, financial experts remain bullish. Many predict that the HSI will continue its upward trajectory into next year, supported not only by sustained interest from the Mainland but also increasing internal demand and growing global attention. With foreign investors eyeing Hong Kong as a stable gateway to China, the HSI could be poised for continued momentum.

The Hang Seng’s recent rally signals a renewed sense of strength in Hong Kong’s market — and potentially, a longer-term shift in regional investor sentiment.

activity_instructions: Listen to the audio. Write down what the speaker says below. Once you've written down as much as you can, click 'done' and compare your text with the model. This is a non-graded activity.
student_submission:
Today I'd like to talk about telecommunication mergers and introduce some factors that are critical to their success. In the last few years, there has been a wave of mergers in the communications field. Deregulation and technological innovation have spurred growth in  new services and are intensifying competition in nearly every product area.
Convergence between computing and telecommunications has finally taken hold , enabled by the Internet as the emerging backbone for a global, networked economy. Ongoing research by my company reveals  that since the mid-1980s, most large mergers and acquisitions (deals worth more than $500 million) resulted in poor returns to shareholders over the following three years, relative to industry averages.

activity_instructions: Think of something weird, exciting or funny that happened to you recently, and describe it in an email to a friend. Make it interesting and descriptive, and remember to check for pronoun reference. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hey Jaya,

I hope you're doing well! I just had to share this bizarre yet hilarious incident that happened to me recently. So, I was at the grocery store, minding my own business, when I noticed a guy in the produce section juggling oranges. Naturally, I stopped to watch, and he was surprisingly good! But then, one of the oranges slipped and rolled right towards me. In a reflex, I tried to kick it back, but instead, I ended up slipping on it and landing right on my backside!

The juggler rushed over, apologizing profusely, while I was just sitting there, laughing at the absurdity of it all. A few other shoppers joined in the laughter, and it turned into a light-hearted moment. I guess I can now say I’ve had my own slapstick comedy moment in real life!

Hope this brings a smile to your face!

Take care, Sneha

HI All,
Thanks for being here. It’s definitively been an exciting year full of work and dedication, and because of that it’s my pleasure to announce CRUM’s decision about renewing our partnership. CRUM highlighted our dedication to quality, which was praised by them as the decision-making point to make the new partnership I mentioned previously a reality.

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Hi Josh and Ken,
I’ve been thinking about our current situation and the options you both have proposed. While both have their merits, I’d like to suggest a third option that might offer a balance between maintaining our customer relationships and reducing our overhead costs.
How about we relocate to the burgeoning Riverfront District? This area has been undergoing revitalization and is quickly becoming a trendy spot with a mix of residential and commercial spaces. The rents here are significantly lower than downtown, currently around $2,500 a month, but it still offers a central location that’s accessible to our existing customer base.
By moving to the Riverfront District, we can maintain a physical showroom that allows customers to experience our high-end clothing in person. The area’s growth also presents an opportunity to attract new clients who are moving into the stylish lofts and condos being developed. Additionally, we can enhance our online presence as Ken suggested, to reach a broader audience and offer virtual consultations and measurements.
This option allows us to keep our personalized service while also significantly cutting overhead costs. 
Let me know your thoughts!
Best,
EF Student

activity_instructions: Your boss has sent you an email, asking you to prepare a presentation about the company. Read the email and draft a speech. Include an introduction, a body (with signposting phrases, where possible), an anecdote and a call to action. Write 150–250 words.
student_submission:
Good afternoon, everyone,

I’m thrilled to welcome you to Frisko Shipping! It all started in 2001 with our founder, Bill Frisko, who was inspired to create this company after a wild, near-death experience—you’ll want to hear this one! Once, he fell off a boat, got bitten by a shark, and was ultimately saved by a passing ship. That moment made him realize the potential of the shipping industry, and here we are today.

Frisko Shipping has grown far beyond that initial vision. Now, we’re in 20 cities across the globe, with more than 5,000 dedicated employees. Last year alone, we reached a remarkable profit of 5 million dollars, holding 10% of the global market. These numbers aren’t just statistics—they’re proof of the energy and dedication that drive us every day.

And as you join us, we’re counting on you to bring the same motivation and enthusiasm that have powered Frisko’s growth. To get a sense of where we stand, let’s start with a short quiz to see how much you already know about the company.

I’ll leave you with a thought: if a single experience can inspire a business like this, think about the potential you bring. You never know when a moment or idea might spark the next big step for Frisko. So, let’s dive in and make waves together!

Welcome aboard!

activity_instructions: Read Ken's email and then email Josh and Ken a third option. Use your imagination. You can create any facts about your city that will support your proposal. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Subject: Third Option Proposal for the New Community Center

Hi Josh and Ken,

I hope you're both doing well. After reviewing the two options for the new community center, I would like to propose a third alternative that I believe could be a great fit for our city.

Instead of focusing solely on a renovation of the existing building or constructing a new one, we could consider repurposing an unused space in the city’s downtown area. There is an old warehouse just off Main Street that could be renovated into a modern, multifunctional community center. This would not only keep costs down compared to a full construction project but also revitalize an underused part of the city.

The location is central, making it easily accessible for residents, and there’s plenty of room for parking, which would be a major advantage. Plus, the building already has strong structural foundations, which could make the renovation process quicker and more cost-effective.

This option would meet our community's needs and align with our sustainability goals by reusing an existing space.

Looking forward to hearing your thoughts.

Best regards,
[Your Name]

activity_instructions: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words.

Earlier you emailed me for some ideas on what to include in your speech. Here's what I'd suggest:

Greet the audience as usual, and say what the purpose of your speech is.
A quote is an easy way to give your speech more meaning. How about this one: 'There's no substitute for hard work.' – Thomas Edison
It's a reminder that there really are no short cuts in our industry, and success only comes with hard work. Feel free to use your own quote, though.
Show thanks to the staff for their hard work this year. They've done a lot of overtime to make sure our sales goals were met.
Close the speech with another quote that'll motivate them. Here's one I suggest: 'Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.' – Winston Churchill
We've had some hard times this year, and although we've met our goals (barely), the staff will need some motivation to push harder next year. That quote is quite relevant, I think.
Good luck!

activity_instructions: You work in the pharmaceutical industry. Your boss has asked you to summarize an article for him so that he can better talk in English about the major players in the industry. Summarize the article. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Here's a summary of the major players in the pharmaceutical industry:

The pharmaceutical industry is dominated by several key players, often referred to as "Big Pharma." These companies are leaders in innovation, research and development, and market share. The top companies include Pfizer, Johnson & Johnson, AbbVie, Merck & Co., Roche, Sanofi, AstraZeneca, Novartis, Bristol-Myers Squibb, and GSK (GlaxoSmithKline).

Pfizer continues to lead the industry, especially with its significant contributions during the COVID-19 pandemic through the development of the Comirnaty vaccine.

Johnson & Johnson is known for its wide range of healthcare products, including pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and consumer health products.

AbbVie has gained prominence with its blockbuster drug Humira, used to treat various autoimmune diseases.

Merck & Co. is recognized for its strong portfolio in oncology, vaccines, and infectious diseases.

Roche is a major player in both pharmaceuticals and diagnostics, with a strong presence in cancer treatments.

Sanofi focuses on vaccines, diabetes care, and cardiovascular health.

AstraZeneca is known for its work in oncology, cardiovascular, and respiratory diseases.

Novartis has a diverse portfolio including oncology, neuroscience, and ophthalmology.

Bristol-Myers Squibb is a leader in oncology and immunology.

GSK specializes in pharmaceuticals, vaccines, and consumer healthcare.

These companies are at the forefront of pharmaceutical innovation and play a crucial role in advancing healthcare globally. Their research and development efforts lead to new treatments and therapies that improve patient outcomes and address unmet medical needs.

activity_instructions: Write a summary of a negotiation. It could be something you did at work, something you purchased on your own, or a summary of what happened in the movies in this unit. What was the preliminary offer? What happened during the negotiations? What was the final deal? Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words. This activity is non-graded.
student_submission:
A recent negotiation I handled at work involved renegotiating a service contract with a vendor. The preliminary offer from the vendor included a standard renewal with a slight price increase. However, after reviewing the service quality and comparing competitors’ rates, I proposed maintaining the existing price while adding performance guarantees.
During the negotiation, both sides exchanged counteroffers. The vendor argued that operational costs had increased, justifying the price hike. I countered by highlighting our long-standing partnership and suggesting a compromise: a small price adjustment, but with additional service benefits included.
After a few discussions, we agreed on a final deal—a moderate price increase, but with enhanced service terms, including faster response times and additional support features. It was a win-win, as the vendor secured a renewal, and we gained better value for our investment.

Subject: Priorities for the Week: US Client Designs, New Hires, and More
Dear Team,
I hope you’re all doing well. I wanted to take a moment to highlight the key priorities for the week so that we can stay focused on what’s most important.
1. US Client Designs – High Priority Our work on the US client designs is progressing a bit slower than expected, but we’re still on track. This is a critical project, as a successful outcome will likely lead to future collaboration with the client. Please continue your efforts here and keep up the great work!
2. New Hires – Important As you may know, we have two staff members leaving in Q2, and we need to start looking for replacements soon. If you know of any suitable candidates, please pass their information along to me. Your input will be much appreciated.
3. Marketing Media Reorganization – On Hold The marketing media reorganization project has been put on hold for the time being. It’s a time-consuming task, and since we’re not actively using the old media, it won’t be a priority right now.
Thank you all for your hard work and dedication. Let’s keep the momentum going!
Best regards,

Let’s make this new tradition a delicious success!

Dear colleagues,
I’d like to begin by highlighting one of the key achievements this quarter — the renewal of our partnership with Crum. This wasn’t just a routine agreement; the organization specifically praised our dedication to quality, which reflects the collective effort behind our work.

That said, this success didn’t come without its challenges. Just three months ago, we were dealing with unresolved defects that put our client relationships at risk. On top of that, there were several minor technical issues that added complexity.

To overcome these obstacles, we introduced two major changes. First, the update delivery process was revised. Second, Quality Assurance procedures were strengthened. These improvements wouldn’t have been possible without strong collaboration across teams — something I believe all of us can be proud of.

Looking ahead, we’re committed to providing even more proactive support to prevent similar issues and ensure continued satisfaction for this partner and others we work with.

Thank you.

From_
ToAll

activity_instructions: You are a journalist for a financial magazine. You've been asked by your editor to write a report on the performance of the Hang Seng (HSI) stock market index. You have some notes and a graph as your guide. Write an article of 150-200 words, making it as accurate and interesting as possible.
student_submission:
The Hang Seng Index (HSI) in Hong Kong has shown a strong recovery and steady growth over the past six months. This positive trend has been largely driven by increased investment from Mainland China, which has significantly boosted the market.

A key factor in this growth has been the remarkable performance of the Properties and Utilities sub-indices, which have risen sharply. This reflects the growing confidence in Hong Kong’s real estate and infrastructure sectors, fueled by capital inflows from China.

Six months ago, the HSI dropped to 20,956, but it has since rebounded impressively, reaching a high of 27,499. Experts remain optimistic about the future of the index, predicting further growth in the coming year. This expectation is based on continued foreign investment and strong internal demand within Hong Kong.

Given these factors, the HSI is expected to maintain its upward trajectory, making it an attractive option for investors looking for long-term gains.

activity_instructions:
Custom instruction:
Based on the notes, prepare one or two points each for the Method, Findings, Conclusions and Recommendations parts of the summary report. Write 100–175 words.
student_submission:
Report on the surveys conducted in Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai

Method: a sample covering all the demographics was interviewed with 1.000 people in both Rio de Janeiro and Shanghai. The interviewers asked about how people felt about the collarless dress shirt.

Findings: the approval rating was 35% in Rio de Janeiro and 80% in Shanghai. Additionally, the would-buy rating was respectively 20% and 40%.

Conclusions: for the 65% in Rio and the 20% in Shanghai included in the not-approval rating, the product is not a highly desirable item for several reasons, i.e. design, size, color and material. For the 20% in Rio and the 40% in Shanghai (would-buy rating), people expressed just moderate satisfaction and among the factors that prevented them from being completely satisfied we signal: insufficient market research, bas execution of the initial idea and poor diversity in the final design. Changes for Rio are a priority, because Asia results are more satisfactory.

Recommendations:
•	More research about what men desire and need in an accessory
•	Design: more attention to details
•	Size: slim fitting
•	Colors: strong primary colors, e.g. black and white
•	Material: wrinkle-free and/or sweat absorbent

activity_instructions: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Metaphors are powerful tools that can convey complex ideas in a relatable and vivid manner, making abstract concepts more tangible for readers. For instance, describing a challenging situation as "climbing a mountain" instantly evokes the effort and perseverance required, creating a strong visual impact.

Focused free writing is another valuable technique, as it allows for the exploration of ideas without the constraints of structure or self-editing. This method encourages creativity and can lead to unexpected insights, helping to overcome writer's block and generate raw material that can be refined later.

Questioning, on the other hand, is essential for deepening understanding and developing critical thinking. By asking probing questions about a topic, writers can uncover new angles and perspectives, leading to more thorough and engaging content. This technique is particularly useful in research and analytical writing, where exploring different facets of a subject can enhance the depth and quality of the work.

Overall, these techniques provide a robust toolkit for effective writing, each serving a unique purpose in the creative and analytical process.

activity_instructions: You have just received a phone call from one of your informants. Take down the key points from the information she gives you. Use the bullet points to help you.
student_submission:
Intelligence Report – Smuggling Incident
Date: July 16, 2025.
Time of Report: 7:11 PM.
Source: Informant – Shirley.

Incident Summary:
On Friday morning at 2:30 AM, Barry Black, a known tobacco smuggler, is expected to arrive at the port aboard his yacht, Empress of the Seas. According to information obtained by the source, a large shipment of "sticks"—a term used as code for cigarettes—will be unloaded later that day at a warehouse located on Main Street.

The operation will involve Wayne White, suspected of involvement in illicit activities, as a cash transaction that could exceed one million dollars is expected. The clandestine nature of the operation indicates a large-scale smuggling scheme involving maritime logistics and land distribution.

Recommended Action:
Surveillance at the port is recommended starting at 2:00 a.m. on Friday, in addition to monitoring the warehouse on Main Street throughout the day. Teams should be prepared to intervene at the time of the exchange, securing evidence and making arrests if necessary.

activity_instructions: You're going to reply to Alice's blog post about cross-cultural communication. Give advice about your own culture. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
I work for a global company. I've been lucky enough to travel around the world and do business with many different people in many different countries. What I've learned is that understanding cross-cultural differences is critical for successful communication.

For example, people from my culture are apt to maintain eye contact in a conversation. In some countries I've visited, however, maintaining eye contact can be considered rather rude or even aggressive. I also have a way of gesturing a lot – you know, like moving my hands and pointing. In one country, I learned that pointing with a finger is somewhat impolite. Oh, yeah – and I have a tendency to talk a lot and be quite direct. I also tend to be a little uncomfortable with silence. There are a lot of countries where just the opposite is true.

I guess my point is that it's important to be sensitive to the culture you're working in. You don't have to be perfect, but a little understanding goes a long way!

activity_instructions: You are writing to Harry, a new manager in your company. He wants advice on how to effectively motivate his team and what strategies to avoid. Use the language and strategies you have learned in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Harry,

Here are some ideas for motivating your employees. I also included some things to avoid.

Incentivizing employees - Make them feel that the company's success means success for them as well. There's nothing like a possible reward to motivate people.
Taking active interest in employees' career paths - Offer them additional training and act as their mentor.
Emphasize a healthy work-life balance - Recognize that employees have lives outside the company. Spending family time and having time for socialization will give them a feeling of satisfaction.
Listening - If people feel like they are being heard, even when they are complaining, they will be happier and more productive.
Respecting - Treat subordinates the way you would like to be treated by your superiors.

Here are five ways to demotivate your staff:

Take credit or claim responsibility for work done by your subordinates.
Showing anger.
Let employees unfairly take the blame for things.
Lack of appreciation for good work.

activity_instructions: Read an email from your friend and give advice on some stressful problems he is having. Type in the input box. Write 100-200 words.
student_submission:
Hey Leon,

It sounds like you’re carrying a heavy load right now, and I want you to know it’s okay to feel overwhelmed. At work, when leadership doesn’t acknowledge your efforts, it’s incredibly frustrating. Remember that their failure to recognize you doesn’t diminish your value. Try setting small, personal goals that you can celebrate yourself. It helps restore a sense of purpose and control.

As for things with Tia, relationships are tough—especially when they start strong and then shift unexpectedly. Allow yourself time to process whatever happens next, and don’t rush to "be okay." You’re allowed to feel disappointment and sadness.

Most importantly, don’t go through this alone. Keep talking, whether it’s to a friend, a journal, or here. Stress feeds on silence, and you're doing the right thing by reaching out. Be kind to yourself—you deserve that right now.

activity_instructions: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Buenos Aires, my favorite city, is a vibrant metropolis known for its rich cultural heritage and lively atmosphere. The city is famous for its tango music and dance, which can be experienced in numerous milongas and street performances. Buenos Aires also boasts a diverse culinary scene, with parrillas (steakhouses) serving some of the best beef in the world. The city's architecture is a blend of European styles, with grand avenues and historic buildings that reflect its colonial past. Additionally, Buenos Aires is home to numerous parks and green spaces, providing a respite from the bustling city life.

In contrast, Asunción, the capital of Paraguay, offers a more laid-back and tranquil experience. Unlike the bustling streets of Buenos Aires, Asunción has a slower pace of life, with less traffic and fewer crowds. The city is known for its friendly locals and traditional Paraguayan cuisine, which includes dishes like sopa paraguaya and chipa. Asunción's architecture is a mix of colonial and modern styles, with colorful buildings and open plazas.

While Buenos Aires captivates with its dynamic energy and cultural richness, Asunción charms with its relaxed ambiance and warm hospitality. Both cities offer unique experiences, making them special in their own ways.

activity_instructions: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Yesterday I met a friend for coffee, and she told me about a difficult situation she'd experienced the previous week during a job interview.
She arrived at the company's offices and was taken to a meeting room, where they gave her a test to fill out and asked her to give them her cell phone number so she wouldn't have to search for information. Half an hour later, the interviewer came in and informed her that there had been a power outage and asked if she was happy to continue the interview. My friend thought it was a test... so she continued. Half an hour later, she left the room to find the interviewer and realized she'd been left alone in the office and all the employees had left! When she went outside, she realized the chaotic situation caused by the national blackout that kept Spain without power for almost a day. I told her they should have re-interviewed her, and she told me she only received an email saying she'd been dropped from the selection process... how unprofessional!

activity_instructions: Now write up the research proposal. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words.

University Research Project

Who: University

What:

A research project comparing the attitudes of first-year students towards traditional classroom and e-learning environments, including mature students and graduates entering university.

The research method is a qualitative study
The aim of the research is to find out whether students would like to attend classes in a virtual classroom during the holidays, how often and why?

The expected start time of the research is 3 months from the first semester. Students participating in the study must be interviewed on topics provided by the university.
Based on the answers to the questions, a summary must be prepared for the university, which shows the answers to the questions in diagrams by age group.

The reason for the study is that the university is considering creating a virtual classroom and wants to find out how many students would prefer such learning to traditional learning.

Thank you.

activity_instructions: You’re writing a brief performance review of your sales team member Oliver. Type in the input box. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission:
General performance

Oliver Murray had, without doubt, a very strong start with the company. He is only with us for a year now. He has interesting new ideas, and as a perfectionist, is making almost no mistakes. Oliver works hard to be successful, and he is unsually clever. He is an exemplary employee.

Key achievements

Oliver's creative approach to product testing has saved us lots of money, as he found and fixed product errors. These proved to be so accurate and reliable that his line manager promoted him to senior analyst although she'd only been with us for six months by that time. Oliver has been employee of the month already two times.

Areas for improvement

Oliver’s weaknesses lie in two key areas: time keeping and delegating. Even though he is a conscientious worker, he sometimes struggles to keep to deadlines. Therefore, his entire team occasionally falls behind schedule. With regard to delegating, Oliver fails to distribute work evenly among his team, often taking on more work personally than is pragmatic.

Goals

I would like to set the following two goals for Oliver. First, that he keeps an online team schedule, and updates it regularly. Second, that at the beginning of a task, he draws up a plan for a logical system of delegation based on employee availability, experience and proficiency. Meeting these goals will ensure Oliver is working to his fullest potential.

activity_instructions: Now write up the research proposal. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Research Proposal: Student Attitudes Towards Traditional vs. Online Learning

This research project aims to explore first-year students’ attitudes toward traditional classroom learning compared to online learning environments. The study will include a diverse group of students, such as mature learners and school leavers entering the university. The primary focus is qualitative, seeking in-depth insights into students’ preferences and perceptions of both learning modes.

A key aspect of the research will investigate students’ interest in attending virtual classroom sessions during vacation periods. Specifically, we aim to understand how often students would be willing to participate and their motivations for doing so. This will provide valuable data on the feasibility and demand for virtual learning outside the regular academic calendar.

The study is scheduled to begin in the fall and will run for three months. Its findings will support the university’s decision-making process as it considers developing a virtual classroom platform. Ultimately, this research will help shape future educational offerings that align with student needs and preferences in an increasingly digital learning landscape.

Anticipated Changes: Windows 11 24H2 (late 2024) with AI Copilot integration.

Microsoft 365 Apps

Update Schedule: Monthly patches; quarterly feature updates.

Anticipated Changes: Enhanced collaboration tools in H2 2024.

Adobe Creative Cloud

Update Schedule: Monthly updates.

Anticipated Changes: Firefly AI expansion in 2024.

Slack

Update Schedule: Bi-weekly patches.

Anticipated Changes: Threads UI overhaul in Q3 2024.

Zoom

Update Schedule: Monthly updates.

Anticipated Changes: Advanced AI meeting summaries in 2024.

Visual Studio Code

Update Schedule: Monthly releases.

Anticipated Changes: Improved Copilot integration in 2024.

macOS (Secondary Device)

Update Schedule: Annual fall update.

Anticipated Changes: macOS 15 with Safari AI tools (September 2024).

Update Strategy:

Monthly: Apply security patches on the first Saturday (Windows, Zoom, Slack).

Quarterly: Review major feature updates for Microsoft 365 and Adobe CC.

Annual: Reserve September for OS upgrades (Windows, macOS).

MAINTENANCE PLAN
Monitor Hardware Health

Use a shared calendar to log purchase dates and warranty expirations.

Run quarterly diagnostics (e.g., Dell SupportAssist) to check battery health, storage, and performance.

Automate Software Updates

Enable auto-updates for Slack, Zoom, and Visual Studio Code.

Schedule manual updates for critical systems (Windows, macOS) on the first weekend of each month to avoid disruptions.

Track Developer Roadmaps

Subscribe to newsletters (Microsoft, Adobe) for update announcements.

Add anticipated software changes (e.g., macOS 15 rollout) to the team calendar.

Coordinate with IT

Confirm hardware replacement policies (e.g., laptops refreshed every 4 years).

Submit replacement requests 3 months in advance to ensure timely transitions.

Backup & Security

Perform daily cloud backups via OneDrive/Google Drive.

Verify antivirus and firewall settings quarterly.

Contingency Planning

Keep a secondary device (e.g., iPad) for urgent tasks during updates.

Notify stakeholders of planned downtime in advance.

Final Notes:
By aligning hardware replacements with budget cycles, automating routine software updates, and staying informed about developer roadmaps, I will minimize workflow disruptions. This plan will be reviewed quarterly and adjusted based on company policy changes or new tools.

Hi Paul, 
Here the report concerning the training providers:
•	The goal of this report is to summarize my research on the best training providers to partner with, to improve communication skills across departments. As you may know, the two main candidates are TrainQuick: the cheaper and flexible, and Skills Pro:  the more expensive.
•	TrainQuick: Although it is affordable in terms of price in our company, it was not very welcome. The main defect found by our employees is the structure of the courses: the participants are mixed together with others from different departments.
In details:
• Skills Pro: the course is really more expensive and at the same time difficult. However, despite this, the course was very much appreciated by our employees who almost all managed to complete it,
•	Considering the results of the aforementioned research, to date, I believe that Skills Pro represents the best option for us as we cannot risk investing in less expensive courses that are not completed by our employees. Surely we should require our employees to study with each other

Eva

activity_instructions: Your boss has asked you to write a formal report recommending a training company. You've chosen Skills Pro. Use your notes to write up the report. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
At the request of management, an evaluation of corporate training companies was conducted to identify the most suitable provider for staff development. After careful consideration, I recommend contracting Skills Pro.

Skills Pro stands out due to its strong reputation in the industry, with over 10 years of experience in professional development. The company offers customized training programs tailored to each client’s specific needs, ensuring more effective results. It also boasts a team of highly qualified instructors with both certifications and practical market experience.

A key advantage is Skills Pro’s interactive training methodology, which blends theory with hands-on practice and actively engages participants. Furthermore, the company provides post-training support, including performance follow-up and additional learning materials.

Given these factors, Skills Pro offers the best cost-benefit ratio and is well-equipped to meet our organization’s training needs in a professional and efficient manner.

Final Recommendation: Approve the hiring of Skills Pro to conduct the corporate training sessions planned for the upcoming semester.

activity_instructions: Now help the scientist with his scientific report by writing the abstract, which should include all of the report's essential information. Use the notes to help you. Write 100-150 words.
student_submission: This study utilizes PC simulation techniques to evaluate the impact of a dam construction in sloth population. These simulations identified loss of habitat and reduction of diet diversity as the main consequences that would affect sloths, contributing to a probable decline of number in their population. This was obtained after analyzing various ecological variables. In order to mitigate potential damages, it is recomended to reallocate the sloth species to Corona Valley before starting the construction of the dam. The research comes from "West Indian Sloths and Two-Toed Tree Sloths: Megalonychidae" as detailed in Grzimek's Student Animal Life Resource.

activity_instructions: Now write up the research proposal. Use the notes to help you. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
RESEARCH PROPOSAL

The research will be developed based on the following assumptions:

- The first two months will be focused on doing interviews, while the answers will be organized during the last month.

- At the beginning of the semester, we will first interview mature students to give time to the school leavers to habituate to the university.

- The following questions will be done to all students, and their answers will be recorded:

- How old are you?

- Are you a senior or a freshman in the university?

-What type of class do you prefer more? Online class or traditional class? Why?

-Would you attend classes in a virtual classroom during vacation time? How often, and why?

-What subjects would you watch in the virtual classroom during vacation? And how much time would you be able to spend studying this subject?

-On the final of the project, a report will be delivered to the client, and a meeting will be booked to present the results.

activity_instructions: Your colleague is proposing a new location for your office. Read his email, then write the executive summary telling which one he recommends, Office One or Office Bravo. Type in the input box. Write 50-75 words. Use your own words where possible.
student_submission:
We are very pleased with the opportunity to deepen our partnership with Westpac and believe our proposal provides the most comprehensive approach for Westpac to execute its strategy successfully.  This initiative is critical for Westpac to differentiate its service delivery model in the midst of an industry shift towards growing customer share.  Westpac lags behind its key competitors and the risk of further customer attrition will result in a systemic deterioration of profitability.            
Westpac and Verint have formed a shared perspective on the importance of operational improvements to the bank’s overall transformation.  Our diagnostic work earlier this year suggests that a successful transformation program can free up at least 2,000 personnel for frontline sales roles over the next 12-24 months.  Assuming current levels of Westpac sales productivity, migration of 2,000 personnel to the frontline could add $156 million in annual revenues.  
As important, a successful redesign of existing operating processes will allow the bank to substantially improve turnaround times for customers and free up time consuming tasks carried out by frontline staff.  We therefore view operations transformation not simply as gaining efficiencies in back office processes, but as a strategic catalyst to lower cost, reduce frontline work, improve customer service, and increase the bank’s capabilities as if offers more complex products and services to market.  As such, operations transformation is an integral part of Westpac’s customer centric strategy that must be executed in full alignment with the bank’s new strategic direction

activity_instructions: Write a summary of the logistics industry, similar to the one in the previous activity. Compare your text with the model.
student_submission: The logistics industry involves the management of goods movement across global supply chains. It includes warehousing, transportation, and inventory management, ensuring efficient distribution. This sector has grown significantly, driven by e-commerce demand. Technological advancements, such as automation and real-time tracking, enhance operations, boosting efficiency, speed, and customer satisfaction in delivering products worldwide.

activity_instructions: You are a new member of a law firm who is shadowing your more experienced colleague. Listen to the closing arguments and the verdict of a tort action trial for trespassing, and take notes for future reference.
student_submission:
Mr and Mrs Byron's case against Mr Medina

The Byron family's home was broken into by Mr Medina. Mr Medina destroyed the family's sense of security and caused them a great deal of stress. Since the break-in, the family has been faced with fear every time they come home.

The defendant's defense attorney said in his opening statement that Mr Medina was confused and lost. He was just trying to find a place to spend the night.

The judge sentenced Mr Medina to 300 hours of community service and a fine of $1,000, which the defendant must pay immediately.

activity_instructions: Read the email from your manager. Then write an interesting, friendly advertisement for the policy change. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words.
student_submission:
Dear colleagues,

We have some exciting news that will make our mornings brighter and more delicious! Starting on the first Monday of next month, the company will be offering free breakfasts for all employees. Our goal is to help ease the morning rush, give everyone a chance to fuel up properly, and create a welcoming space to connect before diving into work.

We’ve carefully crafted a menu that balances taste and energy. Every day, you’ll find fresh fruit, yogurt, cereals, bagels, and doughnuts. In addition, there will be a special hot item each morning—anything from scrambled eggs and potatoes to fluffy pancakes with maple syrup. And to complement your meal, we’ll have freshly brewed coffee and tea, as well as natural orange and grapefruit juices.

I hope you’re as excited about this as I am! With your enthusiasm and creativity, this new initiative has the potential to be a great success.

See you at breakfast!

Best, Mary

activity_instructions: You are a life coach. It's your job to advise people on their lifestyle choices. You're in a consultation with a new client, Pete. Listen to him describe his lifestyle and take notes.
student_submission:
Thanks for sharing your situation. There are a few things we can work on.

First, quitting smoking is important, as your doctor said. It will give you more energy and improve your health.

Improving your sleep is also important to do. Try drinking less coffee in the afternoon and go to bed at the same time every night.

For your back pain, a better chair and taking short breaks to stretch will help.

When it comes to food, small changes like eating healthier instead of hamburgers can help you lose weight. A little exercise, like walking or stretching, would also make a difference.

activity_instructions:

Method

•	We took a sample of 2000 covering all the demographics
•	We asked how they felt about the collarless dress shirt.

Findings

•	65% in Rio and 20% in Shanghai didn’t approve the product and found it not a highly desirable item due to design, size, color and/or material.
•	20% in Rio and 40% in Shanghai expressed moderate satisfaction and  'would buy,' te product.

Conclusions

•	Product will have more success in Shangai with 80% approval. 
•	Changes for Rio are a priority.
•	Market research should be carried out before launching
•	Diversity should be considered in product design 

Recommendations

•	Design: more attention to detail, e.g. stitching color
•	Size: slim fitting
•	Colors: strong primary colors; black and white
•	Material: wrinkle-free and/or sweat absorbent

activity_instructions: You have just received a phone call from one of your informants. Take down the key points from the information she gives you. Use the bullet points to help you.
student_submission:
Certainly! Let’s take down the key points from the informant’s information:

Suspect Identification: Name, appearance, and any known aliases.

Location: Where the suspect was last seen or where the informant believes the suspect is currently hiding.

Activity: Specific activities the suspect is involved in, such as meetings, transactions, or movements.

Associates: Names and descriptions of any known associates or accomplices.

Vehicles: Description of any vehicles the suspect uses, including make, model, color, and license plate number.

Weapons: Any known weapons the suspect might be carrying or have access to.

Threat Level: Assess the potential danger the suspect poses to themselves or others.

Additional Information: Any other relevant details, such as known habits, routines, or recent changes in behavior.

These key points will ensure we have a comprehensive understanding of the situation based on the informant’s call. If there’s anything specific you need more details on, feel free to let me know!

Dear Mr. Livingston,

Thank you for booking with Cottages and Cabins. We are pleased to confirm your Villa reservation for four adults from 1 December to 15 December.

We have noted your request for a fully equipped kitchen, and we will ensure it is prepared for your arrival. We have also recorded your flight details (Delta 3425) to assist with any arrival arrangements. Please note that you have chosen not to hire a car at this time, but if you change your mind, we would be happy to assist you with this service.

We confirm receipt of your initial payment of $450, paid by credit card. The remaining balance can be settled upon your arrival using cash or credit card at reception.

If your travel plans change, please notify us as soon as possible so we can adjust your booking accordingly.

Thank you for choosing Cottages and Cabins. We look forward to welcoming you and ensuring you have a comfortable and enjoyable stay.

Best regards,
Juvenal Cardenas
Receptionist
Cottages and Cabins

Interesting post, I would like to share my vision and how we act in my country.
